loans.name: Ta Thi

texts.vi:
From Hà Nội, along route 3 toward Việt Bắc (windy city), there's a restaurant in the town of Nỉ-Trung Giã ran by Ms Tạ Thị Thịnh. This is where you can have authentic vietnamese dishes. As soon as you step inside the restaurant, you will be warmly greeted by the owner. All the dishes featured on the menu are prepared by Ms Thịnh with the help of her husband, a retiree. At the age of 47, after 9 years as a participating member of "Quỹ Tình thương" fund, Ms Thịnh has gradually built up her restaurant to be a viable business. Her 2 children are attending university. She is requesting a loan of 575 USD to buy more products/drinks for her restaurant

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Từ Hà Nội, ngược theo quốc lộ 3, về thăm chiến khu Việt Bắc, thủ đô Gió ngàn, dừng chân tại phố Nỉ-Trung Giã, ghé vào quán ăn của chị Tạ Thị Thịnh bạn có thể cảm nhận ngay được hương vị quê hương tỏa ra từ những món ăn dân tộc trong quán. Bước chân vào quán ăn bạn sẽ được đón tiếp bởi vẻ mặt rạng rỡ tươi cười của bà chủ cửa hàng. Các món ăn ở đây đều do chính bàn tay chị Thịnh thể hiện cùng với sự hỗ trợ của chồng là một quân nhân đã nghỉ hưu. Bước vào tuổi 47, sau 9 năm tham gia Quỹ Tình thương, chị đã xây dựng được một cửa hàng ăn khang trang, điều kiện bảo quản vệ sinh đầy đủ. Hiện nay chị có 2 con đang học đại học. Với mức vốn xin vay là 575 USD, chị dự định mua thêm thực phẩm và đồ uống để đáp ứng nhu cầu ngày càng lớn của khách hàng.

loans.use: buy food and drink for her restaurant

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Lê Thị Hiền, 31 years old, lives with her husband and 2 children in a shoreside village near Quảng Hùng, Quảng Xương district, Thanh Hoá. It was very difficult for her family to get a loan. All the banks required collateral. Since her family was in a difficult financial situation, it was impossible to qualify for a loan. When TYM fund opened a branch in Quảng Xương, she could qualify for loans from TYM because it was based on trust and support between women. With the loans, she buys fishes and resells at the market. The living condition of her family is not high standard but it had improved a lot. Everyday, she sells fishes at the market, she brings home about 125 USD a month. Her wish is to qualify for bigger loans. This time she's requesting a loan of 325 USD to buy fishing nets and fishes to sell.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị Hiền, 31 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 2 con nhỏ ở vùng quê ven biển thuộc xã Quảng Hùng, huyện Quảng Xương, Thanh Hoá. Việc vay vốn đối với gia đình chị trước đây gặp rất nhiều trở ngại. Các ngân hàng cho vay đều đòi hỏi phải có tài sản thế chấp nên để một gia đình có hoàn cảnh kinh tế khó khăn như nhà chị Hiền vay được vốn là điều gần như không thể. Từ ngày quỹ TYM về với Quảng Xương hoạt động với hình thức cho vay dựa trên sự tín chấp, bảo lãnh giữa phụ nữ vay vốn với nhau, chị đã có vốn để làm ăn, mức sống tuy chưa phải là cao nhưng đã có chiều hướng đi lên. Hàng ngày đi chợ bán cá thu nhập khoảng 125 USD/tháng, chị Hiền vẫn luôn mong muốn được vay những mức vốn cao hơn. Vòng vốn này chị đề nghị vay 325 USD thêm vốn vào mua lưới đánh cá và mua thêm cá để bán.

loans.use: Buy fishes and fishing-net

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Berdieva

texts.en:
Berdieva B. lives in Spitamen; she is married and has 2 children.  She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2006 and she recommended herself as a serious and executive client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures.  

She is engaged in commercial and trade services.  Mrs. Berdieva has a business in the wholesale rice selling industry.  She has a straight supplier, which is why the prices for her goods are lower than the bazaar prices.  She is very polite, which is why she has permanent clients who want to buy only her goods.  

Berdieva B. is very experienced in the business, but working in the trade sphere she meets stiff competition, which is why she wants to provide a wide assortment.  Now Mrs. Berdieva B. requests a loan of $750 for business development and widening of assortment.

loans.use: For business development and widening of assortment.

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
"My name is Yasmen A.. I am the mother of eight and all of them are under 16. All of my kids attend school. We run a business selling shoes. My husband generates decent profits out of this business.

Please give loans to my group members as well: Nasim Y. requires a loan for their shop; Aqila B. requires a loan for her family’s mobile phone store; Rukhsana B. wants to improve their fruit business; and Sarweri G. wants to start a tea stall. All of us are neighbors and wish each other a prosperous life."

loans.use: Expand our shoe business

loans.name: Lwaba East J Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Margret N.. She is currently in the business of charcoal sales and is requesting a loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal. Margret is 48 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant farmer for work. She has 3 children ranging from age 17 to 24 and her children go to school. Each week, Margret makes approximately UGX 15000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

Margret is joined in her small group by Sarah N., Harriet N., Justine N., and Christine B.. Sarah N. has a business in clothing sales and wants to stock more clothes. Harriet N. is currently operating a business in cassava selling and wants a loan to add to the business. Justine N. operates a business of selling hides and skins and wants to boost business. Christine B. is currently in the business of selling passion fruit and is requesting a loan to improve business.

loans.use: To add capital to charcoal business

loans.name: Palmiro

texts.es:
Palmiro is 67 years old. He and his wife Delia own a shop together, and thanks to their hard work and sacrifice they now own their own home.

Palmiro began to work at the shop more than 50 years ago with his parents. He also owns some cows and sells their milk. Palmiro and Delia's niece also works with them; she helps out at the shop and with the housework.

Palmiro needs this loan to purchase merchandise like rice, pasta, dairy, oil, drinks, and bread so that he can bring in more revenue, since he is spending more in order to pay for his niece's college education.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

Palmiro tiene 67 años de edad, él está casado con Delia y ambos son comerciantes, y ya cuentan con casa propia gracias al sacrificio de ambos.

Palmiro empezó a trabajar en la despensa con sus padres hace más de 50 años, también se dedica a la venta de leche ya que tiene animales vacunos. Actualmente trabajan con ellos una sobrina suya, ayudándoles en la despensa y en las labores hogareñas.

Necesita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías como arroz, fideos, lácteos, aceite, bebidas, panificados, bebidas y otros, para obtener mayores ingresos ya que los estudios universitarios de su sobrina demandan mayores gastos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise: rice, dairy, bread, oil, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en: Farida lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is the mother of 3 children. Her husband is working in the foreign ministry in Kabul and she is a tailor. She works in her home. She has a good number of clients and she wants to open a shop. She has requested an individual loan to complete her tailoring necessities and buy new machines to further her business with more success and help her family.

loans.use: To complete her tailoring necessities

loans.name: Marian

texts.en: Marian A. sells clothes in Ibatedo in the state of Lagos, Nigeria. She has been in this business since 1984 and has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past four years. She is 50 years old and married with two children. Her husband also works to support the family; this reduces the responsibility on Marian and she can focus on her business to attain maximum profit. She is requesting a loan of $850 to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Thi Bac

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Bac is 35 years old. She has joined the TYM Fund since the year 2003. She used the first loan to invest in livestocks but the income was not substantial. Therefore, she used the second loan to invest in buying scrap and recyclable materials to resale to the retailers. As she was experienced in buying scrap from households as well as determined to increase her family's income, she set up a scrap-buying store at home. Her business gets better and her income increases over time. Besides income from the scrap business, every month her husband earns additional income from construction works, thus her two children can go to school. This round of loan she wants to borrow 19 millions VND (1,150USD) to increase her capital so that she can expand her business. Her monthly income is 4 millions VND (about 258USD)

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Bắc năm nay 35 tuổi. Chị tham gia vàoQuỹ tình thương từ năm 2003. Vòng vốn đầu chị vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi nhưng công việc chăn nuôi cho thu nhập không cao. Do vậy vòng vốn sau chị đã sử dụng vốn vào việc đi thu mua phế liệu từ các hộ gia đình về bán lại cho các đại lý. Do tích lũy được nhiều kinh nghiệm từ công việc đi thu mua phế liệu lẻ cùng với quyết tâm phát triển kinh tế gia đình, chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn để đầu tư vào kinh doanh phế liệu. Hiện nay gia đình chị đã có một cửa hàng đại lý thu mua phế liệu tại gia đình. Công việc làm ăn của gia đình chị ngày càng thuận lợi và cho thu nhập ngày càng cao. Ngoài thu nhập từ đại lý thu mua phế liệu, hàng tháng gia đình chị còn có thêm thu nhập từ công việc đi làm thợ xây của chồng chị, do đó 2 con chị đều được đầu tư cho ăn học đầy đủ. Vòng vốn này chị muốn vay 19.000.000 đ để đầu tư thêm vốn vào cửa hàng thu mua phế liệu mở rộng kinh doanh. Thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Scrap business

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.en:
U. Gulnoza became a client in 2008 and showed herself to be very responsible. She makes repayments to her loans on time and has had no problem following loan procedures. She lives in the Asht region of Tajikistan and is married with 7 children.

Mrs. U. Gulnoza is engaged in trading fruits and vegetables at the local bazaar. She works directly with suppliers so she can sell for low prices and has many repeat customers. Mrs. U. Gulnoza applies to KIVA for a business support loan of 2200 STJ for 4 months in order to increase and improve her business.

loans.use: To increase and improve her business

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
Ry C., age 26, is a rice farmer who lives with two of her children. Living in Kampong Cham province, she typically makes US$2.00 per day. Her husband, Kun Keo, makes approximately US$2.00 growing cucumbers. The Kampong Cham area has not had favorable weather conditions for farming this past year. Along with increased inflation, it has been a difficult year economically in much of Cambodia. As a farmer, Ry C. is taking a lot of the brunt of the economic downturn. That is why she has approached CREDIT with a request for a loan. Ry C. is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase fertilizer, a purchase that she sees as a good opportunity to increase her income.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Chen

texts.en: Mr. Chen C. is a villager in Krouy Wat Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He is 29 years old and his only child is just three years old.Mr Chen C. is a poultry breeder and rice farmer. He earns a small revenue from rice farming as his current plot of farmland is small. In order to expand his rice revenue, he is requesting a loan to buy 0.5 additional hectares on which to cultivate rice. His wife, Mrs. Chim Ra, is a Khmer cake seller also earning a small income to help support their household.

loans.use: To buy 0.5-hectares of additional farmland on which to cultivate rice

loans.name: Zalha's Group

texts.en:
Zalha sells clothes and underwear in Zanzibar. She previously received one loan from BRAC Tanzania which she repaid on time and is now requesting her second loan so that she may buy more inventory. If her profits increase as a result of this loan, she will put the money back into her shop so that her business continues to grow.

Zalha is married and has two children, aged three and eight. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Kazija, who also owns a small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and underwear to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Kholmuhamad

texts.en:
N. Kholmuhamad is a farmer.  It is how he supports his family, which consists of his wife and two school-aged children (pictured in the photo because Kholmuhamad himself was absent on the day of our visit).  

With great sacrifice, he has been able to be successful and has supported himself with the loans he has received from IMON.  In spite of the economic challenges that he has encountered, he has been able, with much sacrifice, to support his home.  That is why today, he is concerned about improving his work by investing in crops through technical assistance, and by buying seeds and fertilizers for their development.  

Today he has approached to IMON for a loan that will permit him to buy supplies for his crops.  This loan will benefit him, as well as the family that he so loves.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Bi Bi Shiren

texts.en:
Bi Bi Shiren lives in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married and lives with her own nuclear family. She has been doing embroidery for many years. She works in her house and her husband sells what she makes at the bazaar. Her husband is also a taxi driver. Shiren wants to expand her embroidery business and exchange her husband's taxi for a new one.

She has requested an individual loan of 30,000 Afghani with a term of 12 months to enlarge her shop and complete her stock. She wants to say she is sure that after this loan, some changes will come to their life and they can support their family better in future.

Shiren is happy with this loan process in Afghanistan. She would like to thank Kiva for working with AFSG to achieve this wonderful process of small loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To enlarge her business

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim T., 33, is a professional tailor who lives with her husband in Battambang province. She typically makes US$ 4 a day, while her husband is a soldier and makes US$ 1 a day. This couple has one child. Mrs. Kim T. is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase more cloth for her tailoring business.

loans.use: To purchase more cloth for her business

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy S. is thirty-seven years old. She is married with three children. Lucy is resourceful and enterprising. She has sent three children all the way through high school with her business earnings. She operates a local restaurant and sells local foods like “fufu” and “banku”. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantains, taken with soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains, and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. 

Lucy says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she is no longer able to meet her production expenditure. She needs the loan to enable her to inject additional capital into the business to scale up production and maintain quality as well. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like maize, cassava, plantains, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood. Lucy is a member of a group called “Miracle” Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and provide support to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs, meat, fish and vegetables to produce cooked food for re-sale

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa A. is 38 years old. She is a married woman with four children - two boys and two girls. She says one of her children has completed senior high school while the rest are in the junior high and the primary schools. Adwoa’s husband is a mason by profession. She lives with the family in her brothers’ house in a town called Dormaa Ahenkro in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Dormaa is an agricultural-dominated town. It is about a 45 minute drive from Sunyani, the regional capital. Adwoa trades in fresh yams and crates of eggs to make some income. According to her, she procures the fresh yams and the eggs from Techiman and Kintampo where the price is quite economical. Adwoa sells her goods at the market square and also to retailers. She has been in business for five years. Adwoa wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure yams and eggs in bulk. She hopes to help her husband improve upon their standard of living and give all their children the best of education they can afford.

loans.use: To procure yams and eggs

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan S., 35, is a villager living in Battambang Province, Cambodia.  She is applying for a loan to increase her stock of grocery items for sale. Chan currently sells some products to neighbors in the village and she generates a daily income of $2.50. Chan is married to Mr. Ya, 47, who helps support the family by driving a motor taxi. The couple lives with two teenage children who attend school.  They hope the loan will help them attain a higher standard of living.

loans.use: Increase her stock of groceries for sale.

loans.name: Sophia B Group

texts.en: Mrs. N. Sophia, 45 years old, is married with seven kids. She has been selling fresh and dried fish for five years; the major challenge in her business is perishability of the fish.  Therefore, she is using the loan to purchase a refrigerator for the storage of her fresh fish. She is active and dreams of buying a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Ronald Alonso

texts.es: Ronald Alonso S. M. tiene la edad de 45 años, su estado civil es casado. Don Ronal tiene 3 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Don Ronald es una pulperia. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio, los que ofrece en su vivienda donde esta ubicado y dirige de forma personal, por lo que nace con el deseo de trabajar ya que no poseía ninguna fuente de ingresos. Por lo que sus propósitos son de mejorar cada día en su negocio ya que ha sido un apoyo indispensable. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo y así comprar los productos de uso diario que arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite y otros. El deseo de Ronald es asegurar un buen futuro para sus hijos y ellos puedan seguir adelante con el negocio.
texts.en:
Ronald Alonso S. M. is 45 years old, married and has 3 children who attend school.

For over 11 years, Ronald has owned a grocery store that he runs from his home in a personal way. He started the business because he didn’t have any source of income and wanted to work. Everyday he strives to improve his business since it has been an indispensable support.

He will use the loan as working capital to purchase everyday products like rice, sugar, beans, oil and other items. Ronald wishes to secure a good future for his children and ensure that they can succeed with the business.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rose Abéni

texts.fr: Cette femme  est une résidente du quartier d’agoè, elle est divorcée de son mari et vit seule avec ses quatre enfants. L’activité qu’elle exerce est la vente de peintures. Avant de débuter cette activité, elle a obtenu un crédit de WAGES qu'elle a déjà remboursé. Elle reçoit des commandes des entrepreneurs, des maçons et aussi des particuliers. Elle a commencé cette activité en 2004.  La demande de ses clients est de plus en plus élevée, pour y faire face, elle sollicite de WAGES un deuxième crédit pour acheter 35 boîtes de peintures « SCIL » de différentes qualités.
texts.en:
This woman lives in the neighborhood of Agoe, she is divorced from her husband and lives alone with her four children. Her business is the sale of paint. Before she started this activity, she obtained a loan from WAGES that she has already reimbursed. She receives orders from contractors, masons, and individuals. She started this business in 2004. Her customers' requests are getting higher and higher. In order to meet the demand, she is requesting a second loan from WAGES to purchase 35 cans of paint "SCIL" of different quality.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cans of paint

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: Marivic G. is from the village of Napurog, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old, separated from her spouse, and has five school-aged children. Marivic owns and operates a business providing transportation services to local community members. Marivic has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In May 2008, Marivic joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Marivic has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to pay the labor on maintenance of the transport vehicle to improve the business. Marivic is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service and to purchase stock for her sari-sari (variety) store. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service and to purchase stock for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is thirty-eight years old. She is the divorced mother of three children. All of her kids are in school in the community where they live. She was divorced some years ago when her husband disrespected her by getting married to another woman. Responsibility for the family rests completely on her and she works very hard to provide for the children.

She has being selling foodstuff for the past 15 years to provide for her family. She sells plantains and cassava by the main roadside that links to Koforidua Township, in the eastern region. She says her goods are usually purchased by travelers who regularly travel that road.

Mercy’s business is doing well due to the good human relation she has with her customers. Her major challenge is in accessing funds to buy more from the farmers so that she can store products when there is a price hike. Mercy wants a loan to buy foodstuff like bunches of plantains and cassava etc. to restock her inventory. It has also being her dream to save more from her business proceeds to take care of the children in school. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Nyame Mmoa’, meaning God’s Help.

loans.use: She wants the loan to buy food inventory.

loans.name: Kencha

texts.ru: Кенча Назарова проживает в районе Варзоб. Возраст 77 лет. Вдова, имеет 5 детей. Кенча более 15 лет занимается животноводством. Ей в этом помогают ее дети. Один из сыновей находится в России на заработках, он также высылает матери деньги. Клиентка просит кредит, для покупки дойной коровы и в дальнейшем будет продавать ее молоко.
texts.en:
Kencha N. lives in the Varzob district. She is 77 years old, a widow and has 5 children. Kencha has been involved in animal husbandry for over 15 years. Her children help her with this business. One of her sons works in Russia and sends money to his mother. Client is requesting a loan for the purchase of a dairy cow and plans to sell milk in the future.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Katrina

texts.en:
“The thing I’ve learned is that you can’t wait for things to come to you,” says Katrina about her mobile massage company.  Since losing her job at a spa when it closed down, she has focused on her own business working mostly with motorcyclists, racers, and mechanics recovering from injuries and surgery.  Since her clients rarely seek out a massage therapist, Katrina has built partnerships with automotive businesses who bring her in to work on their employees.  This niche market has enabled Katrina to establish a loyal customer base, but she needs to expand her client list in order to build a sustainable business.

A $3,000 loan will help Katrina buy a car to that she can travel to more businesses, and even raceways and other events, in order to expand beyond her current client base.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Katrina from  United States

loans.use: Purchase vehicle for mobile massage practice

loans.name: Jelica

texts.en:
Jelica was born in 1954. She is unemployed at the moment and lives with her sons. She worked in a textile factory as a tailor for a long time. Now, she is a housewife and makes some earnings by fixing old clothes for some secondhand stores. She cannot earn much but her sons are helping her.

Jelica is a member of our society – Women for Women International – and now she has requested a loan of 900 KM from WWI. She will use this loan to buy a new sewing machine and some materials to make clothes. Thanks to her long experience, she thinks that she will make a success in this business and become independent of her sons.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Carmen Minda

texts.en:
This is Carmen Minda P., 43, who hails from Concepcion, Marikina City, a bustling city on the eastern side of Metro Manila.  She is married to a preacher and is blessed with one child.

Carmen owns a sari-sari (general) store and she also manages a transport operation (taxi).  On idle days, she finds time to carve bar soaps, fashioning them to form any artistic shape imaginable, from figurines to flowers.  She found it to be an interesting hobby and source of income as well, especially during special occasions like mother’s day, birthdays, etc.  Combined, she makes $300 a month.

She joined the Kiva field partner, the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative, in 2007. She also wants to share with her friends the many blessings she has received since joining the CCT, so she invites them to attend their weekly meetings.    

Carmen currently needs a loan of P12,000.  She will use the funds to purchase replacement spare parts for their taxi.  She has been saving a lot so as to be able to buy more taxi units so she can help employ other people.



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Spare parts for the taxi

loans.name: Mama

texts.fr: Mama est une vendeuse ambulante des vêtements de friperie dans le quartier d’Adakpamé à Lomé ; c’est en 2001 qu’elle a débuté ce commerce parce que le revenu financier de son mari, conducteur de taxi, n’arrivent plus à couvrir tous les besoins financiers de leurs 03 enfants. C’est pour cette raison que cette dame a pris la décision de se lancer dans le commerce de friperie. Elle se promène de maison en maison et dispose désormais d’une clientèle qui lui reste fidèle. Ainsi, dès l’ouverture de nouveaux bals de vêtements, elle donne l’exclusivité des meilleurs jupes et habits à ses plus fidèles clients, ce qui la rapproche à chaque fois de sa clientèle. Actuellement elle a un besoin urgent de lancer une nouvelle  commande ; c’est pourquoi elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 05 bals de vêtements de friperie.
texts.en:
Mama is a traveling retailer who sells second-hand clothing in the Adakpamé area of Lomé; she started this business in 2001 because her husband's income as a taxi driver was no longer able to cover all the financial needs of their three children. It is for this reason that this lady decided to begin selling second-hand clothing. She walks from house to house and has built up a faithful clientele. Thus, every time a new bale of clothing is opened, she reserves the best skirts and outfits for her most faithful clients, which increases her bonds with her customers each time. Currently, she urgently needs to send out a new order; this is why she is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy 5 bales of second-hand clothing.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bales of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha A. runs a business of selling soft drinks at LKigamboni ward in Dar es Salaam. She an entrepreneur married business woman.  She sells juices, Drinking water, Ice cream and Soda to customers. Juices is made by her self by buying fruits from the market and using a blender to make it while soda and Ice cream is purchased from the whole sales shops and selling in retail to customers. Ice cream is mostly consumed by school children thus the market is during the school time. She needs a loan of Tshs 600,000 to boost up her business

loans.use: To boost up the business

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda D. is from the village of Salimbal, Lugait Misamis Oriental. She is 51 years old. Rosalinda is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Rosalinda owns & operates a business providing manicure and pedicure services in their village. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In October 2009, Rosalinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service like nail polish  and more. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosalinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide manicure and pedicure services

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en: Alejandra B. is from the village of Alegria. She is 58 years old, is married, and has one adult child. Alejandra owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Alejandra joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase piglets to raise and sell. Alejandra is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth M. is from the village of Grace Village, Sto. Nino, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 54 years old, married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elizabeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elizabeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina E. is from the village of Siempre Viva Sur, Mallig, Isabela. She is 57 years old. Cristina is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Cristina owns & operates a business planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale. Cristina has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Cristina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Cristina is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to have additional capital to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Cristina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Julia Auma

texts.en: Julia Auma O. is a rare kind of a woman. She is 50 years old, a mother of 7 and sole owner of a business most women consider a man's job. Julia runs a timber sales business in Malanga, Busia district. She has been doing this for well over 5 years. Like all timber tradespeople in the area, she buys a mature tree and develops it to timber before transportation to her store. Her labor force is comprised of men and, she says if it was not for her age, she would probably join them in the work as she used to. She requires a loan of KES 20,000 which will be used to replace her old wood cutting power saw. Her future plan is to expand into other towns.

loans.use: Buy a power saw

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La señora Juana P. C. tiene un negocio de abarrotes llamado “Las Juanas”  este ya tiene 3 años, aunque es pequeño tiene muy buenas ventas por el trato que le da a los clientes ya que es una señora muy amable. Se le dio un crédito hace unos meses el cual ya término de pagar donde ella agradece ya que le dio buenos resultados por que fue para comprar mercancía y ya todo se le acabo es por ellos que quiere volver a surtirlo para tener ese resultado y así obtener mas ingresos.
texts.en:
The señora Juana P. C. has a grocery business called 'Las Juanas' which she's had for 3 years. Although it is small she has very good sales because of the way she treats her customers, as she is a very friendly woman. She received a loan a few months ago, which she finished paying back and which gave her good results as she purchased products which have now all been sold. For this reason she now wants to resupply the shop to have a good result and obtain more earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the business

loans.name: Nael

texts.fr: Nael KÂ est une femme de 47 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 5 ans et a été 10fois de suite bénéficiaire de prêt. Son activité principal est l'embouche bovine et ovine, une activité qui lui permet de participer au bien-être familiale et de renforcer ses épargnes
texts.en:
Nael KÂ is a 47 year-old married mother of four. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois for five years and has received 10 consecutive loans. She is involved in the fattening of cattle and sheep for a living, which allows her to see to her family’s well-being and put money aside as savings.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her business productivity

loans.name: Basilio

texts.es:
El señor Basilio Pérez S., Reside en la comunidad de piedra larga arriba jurisdicción del municipio de Condega, el tiene una propiedad de 18 manzanas de extensión total, dentro de esta tiene 4 manzanas que las utiliza para cultivo de granos básicos sembrando frijol y maíz, El crédito él lo utilizara para comprar 3 toretes los cuales el venderá una vez estos adquieran mas peso y después  vender ponerlos a la venta  a un mejor precio y así sacarle utilidad o ganancia. Esto lo hace porque él tiene la necesidad de trabajar y obtener otros ingresos en épocas de verano, ya que la actividad principal de trabajo de este cliente es la agricultura siembra de granos básicos siendo este un producto de mucha importancia en nuestra dieta y como sector económico, pero esto  solo lo puede hacer en épocas de invierno entonces él tiene la necesidad de trabajar en verano y la alternativa es comprar y vender ganado como pequeño productor y de esta forma obtener otros ingresos en esa época. El señor Basilio Pérez comenzó a trabajar en esta actividad desde su menoría de edad en la finca de sus padres, después continuo la misma forma de trabajo iniciando con una pequeña herencia que le dieron sus padres, y el resto con esfuerzo propio y  por medio de financiamientos,  el todo el tiempo se ha dedicado a esta actividad de trabajo sembrando frijol y maíz de una manera tradicional. Con esta otra alternativa que es la compra y venta de ganado él espera tener operatividad de trabajo en épocas de verano y la vez mas ingresos e incrementar su hato ganadero, también poder adquirir capital con la ganancia para impulsar o más bien dicho con la ganancia ahorrar una parte para tener capital para iniciar el ciclo agrícola que inicia en junio de este año. 
Don Basilio P., ha tenido 8 créditos  desde el año 2004 lleva 6 años de trabajar con Ceprodel.
El impacto y beneficios que ha tenido con los financiamientos  es bastante importante ya que le permitieron mejorar sus actividades de trabajo lo que le han dado como resultado tener e ir mejorando su nivel de vida teniendo mejores ingresos. Y poder darles otras alternativas y condiciones a su familia ya que con estos ingresos él puede cubrir los gastos básicos de la familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Basilio Pérez S. lives in the community of Piedra Larga Arriba, in the Municipality of Condega. He owns a property equivalent to 18 city blocks in size. He dedicates four of those blocks to grow beans and corn. He will use the loan to buy three young bulls, which he hopes to sell at a profit when they grow and get heavier. As he is only able to farm during the winter, this venture will provide him with work and a source of income during the summer months. He earns a living mainly from farming grains prominent in the country's diet and which are very important to the economy. But as this line of work is only possible during the winter, he would like to buy and sell cattle as a small producer during the summer months. Mr. Basilio Pérez started working in agriculture as a young boy in his parents' farm. He continued in this line of work thanks to a small inheritance from his parents, his own hard work and outside financing. Farming has been a way of life for him and he has always used traditional methods to grow beans and corn. By buying and selling cattle, his goal is to have work through the summer months and to increase his earnings and increase the number of cattle he trades. Through saving part of those earnings, he will also be able to acquire the necessary capital that will allow him to be ready to invest in the farming cycle which starts again in June. Mr. Basilio Pérez has secured 8 loans since 2004. He has been working with Ceprodel for the past 6 years. The loans have been very beneficial, as thanks to them he has been able to improve his working conditions and increase his earnings, thereby improving his quality of life. He has been able to provide options and better living conditions for his family, since thanks to his earnings he can cover his family’s basic needs.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy three young bulls

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita P. is from the village of Magsaysay, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 69 years old, is married, and has three adult children.

Conchita is engaged in farming and also owns and operates a business selling rice in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for thirty years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Conchita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Conchita is requesting a new loan in the amount of 3,000 which will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizer and chemicals. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Conchita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.  

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizer and chemicals

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda A., 41 years old, is a single woman who supports her family by operating a general store. She lives in Tabao, Zone 2, Valladolid, Negros Occidental. She work hard to save some money to prepare for when she gets old and still be able to support the needs of her family. Imelda has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 4,500. Imelda is now borrowing Php 19,500 so that she can continue to operate her general store with the new additional working capital. This will be her 10th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 19,500, which she paid off within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Imelda aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her general store

loans.name: Yamuna

texts.en: Mrs. Yamuna M. lives in Tangal, Lalitpur. She lives in a single family home with her husband Mr. Purna M. and their son. Her husband works in a steel shop. Her son is studying in primary school.  Mrs. Yamuna M. opened a grocery shop two years ago to help improve the living conditions of her family.  Currently they can't provide a better education for their son because in Nepal the cost of education is very high. To overcome this problem she opened the grocery shop.  Due to lack of capital she can’t buy goods to sell in her shop, so she is requesting for her first loan of 15000 NPR to buy goods like rice, dhal, and noodles. She wants to earn more income to provide a better education for her son and wishes to help her husband upgrade the quality of life for their family.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her grocery store.

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es: Cirilo de 65 años, es un hombre muy correcto, responsable y trabajador,  que está casado con Abelaida de 65 años también, ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero desde hace 7 años que viven solos en una casa alquilada. Hace 50 años que se dedica a la siembra de papa, arveja, maíz, y habas sobre sus propios terrenos, pues estos productos naturales le resultan muy rentables al momento de comercializarlos, mientras que su esposa se dedica a cuidar del hogar y mantener bien atendido a su esposo, pero en temporada de cosecha, es ella que siempre lo ayuda en esa labor. Él asegura que su oficio, todo le parece fácil, ya que anteriormente se ha dedicado a la construcción civil, panadería y carpintería. Con el tiempo, espera construir su casa propia, debido a que las demás viviendas que construyó, las cedió a sus hijos, sin dejar claro la agricultura, que le brinda muchos beneficios. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que esta dispuesto a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, siendo la honradez y la puntualidad que lo caracterizan como persona. Asimismo asegura no defraudar a su grupo comunal. Los mil nuevos soles que solicita, le ayudará para comprar una bolsa de semilla de arveja, tres sacos de fertilizantes y tres botellas de insecticidas.
texts.en:
Cirilo, 65, is an upstanding, responsible, hard-working man. He’s married to Adelaida, 65, and they have 5 children. They have lived alone, however, for the past 7 years, in a rented house. He has been a potato, pea, corn and broad bean farmer for 50 years. He has his own farmlands and his crops are quite profitable. His wife is a housewife and tends to her husband but, during harvest season, she always helps him with this task. He assures us that he considers his work to be easy; he previously has worked as a construction worker, a baker and a carpenter. In time, he hopes to build his own house because he gave all the previous houses he built to his children, never neglecting farming, to be sure, which produces many benefits for him. This is his first loan with MFP and he is determined to repay in a timely fashion since honesty and punctuality are his personal traits: he also does not want to disappoint his fellow group members. He will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy a sack of pea seed, three sacks of fertilizer and three bottles of insecticide.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pea seed, fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Eli De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La señora Eli de los Ángeles C. Avendaño, es una persona  emprendedora dueña de un negocio de venta de perfume y electrodomésticos. El cual comenzó con un capital inicial de C$5,000.00 que lo adquirió producto de un préstamo hace 5 años. Este negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación. 
 El crédito solicitado es para invertir en capital de trabajo del negocio; como es la compra de pantalones, blusas, zapatos nacionales y cosméticos.
Es  casada, tiene un hijo a su cargo, actualmente se encuentra en el colegio. Dice que antes de tener este negocio ella Trabajaba en el mercado como vendedora en una abarrotería.

Lleva 7 créditos en  CEPRODEL a lo largo de 2 años los cuales ha invertido en su negocio con los que ha ido creciendo, diversificando sus productos para poder competir en el mercado, esto gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL.
texts.en:
La señora Eli de los Ángeles C. Avendaño, es una persona emprendedora dueña de un negocio de venta de perfume y electrodomésticos. El cual comenzó con un capital inicial de C$5,000.00 que lo adquirió producto de un préstamo hace 5 años. Este negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación. El crédito solicitado es para invertir en capital de trabajo del negocio; como es la compra de pantalones, blusas, zapatos nacionales y cosméticos. Es casada, tiene un hijo a su cargo, actualmente se encuentra en el colegio. Dice que antes de tener este negocio ella Trabajaba en el mercado como vendedora en una abarrotería. Lleva 7 créditos en CEPRODEL a lo largo de 2 años los cuales ha invertido en su negocio con los que ha ido creciendo, diversificando sus productos para poder competir en el mercado, esto gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para  invertir en la compra de mercadería como: ropa, zapatos y cosméticos.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
la sra. Eva R. M. tiene 41 años de edad, vive en la Aldea Popular, el Triunfo Choluteca. Doña Eva se dedica al comercio vende ollas de varios tamaños, este tipo de ollas grandes son utilizadas para hacer sopas y tambien para freir varias comidas, lo especial de este tipo de ollas es su material que calientan la comida rapido. este tipo de actividad lo realiza hace varios años atras y le ha dejado buenas ganancias.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas ollas al por mayor, para tener mayores ganancias, las cuales las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar y de su familia.
Eva es una sra. muy luchadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Eva R. M., 41, lives in the popular village, El Triunfo Choluteca. Eva sells assorted large pots that are used primarily to make soups and to fry various foods. What is special about these pots is that they are made of a material that heats up fast. She has been in this line of work for several years and she has earned good profits. She will use the loan to buy more pots at wholesale in order to have higher profits that she needs to meet expenses of her household and her family. Eva is a tanacious woman with a strong drive to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soup pots and ladles.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion P. is from the town of Banga. She is 47 years old. Salvacion is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Salvacion owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Salvacion has been engaged in her business for over 20 years.

In May 2009, Salvacion joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Salvacion has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Salvacion is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure and other farm inputs. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Salvacion from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly in recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients, but additionally savings, insurance, and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure and other farm supplies

loans.name: Alba Marina

texts.es:
la sra. Alba Marina M. tiene 61 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de San Lorenzo en el barrio San Antonio ahi vive junto con su familia, su esposo y una hija. Alba  se dedica al comercio, tiiene 6 años  de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad.
Alba vende electrodomesticos, nos comento que le va bien ya que consigue el producto a un buen precio, tiene una persona que le ayuda a vender en la ciudad de Choluteca y ella vende el producto a enfermeras, maestros, y empleados de empresas estatales.
 
vive comodamente ademas recibe ingreso de dos cuartos que ella alquila, su sueño es que su hija se le gradue.
texts.en:
Ms. Alba Marina M. is 61 years old. She lives with her family, her husband and daughter, in the town of San Lorenzo, in the San Antonio neighbourhood. Alba is a merchant, and she has been running her activity for 6 years. Alba sells electrical appliances. She told us her business is good as she is able to buy the products at a fair price. She has an assistant working for her in the town of Choluteca, and she sells her products to nurses, teachers and state employees. She lives comfortably, and she increases her income by renting out two rooms. Her dream is that her daughter succeeds in graduating.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy electrical household appliaces to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more soap and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Robie Jane

texts.en:
Robie Jane P. is from the village of  Balanok Gingoog City. She is 26 years old. Robie Jane is separated from her spouse and has 2 school-aged children. She owns & operates a specialized retail store where she buys and sells used clothing, known as ukay ukay. Robie Jane has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Robie Jane joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Robie Jane is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Robie Jane from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ream

texts.en: S., 48, has been selling vegetables in her community for nine years. S. buys vegetable in bulk from farmers and sells them retail to earn an income. Her husband is a cook who is hired by people to cook meals for their parties. He also fishes from the river, to provide food for his family and to sell to others. S. has five teenage children. Three of her children work in various jobs; the others are dependent on her. Recently, S. ordered a large amount of vegetables on credit from her supplier, and she does not have enough money to pay her supplier. Thus, she would like a loan in order to pay the bill for the vegetables.

loans.use: To pay for vegetables

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago de 57 años, vive en una zona periurbana en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil, el taxista informal en las calles de Guayaquil, tiene dos hijos. 

Para tener mas ingresos para su familia el decidió convertirse en taxista informal porque no tenia dinero para inscribirse en una cooperativa de taxis, poco a poco a vendió trabajando desde las 08h00am hasta las 18h00pm todos los días, haciendo carreras desde $ 1.00 hasta $ 15.00. Pero como el vive en un lugar que recién se esta reestructurando quiere comprar con el préstamo materiales de construcción como cemento, bloques y pinturas. 

En el futuro quiere construir mejor su casa y poder tener una cooperativa de taxis.
texts.en:
Santiago, 57, lives in a periurban area in Las Orquídeas, Guayaquil. He is a taxi driver in Guayaquil and has two children. In order to earn more income for his family he decided to become an informal taxi driver because he didn’t have funds to enroll in a taxi co-op. Gradually he sold his services working from 8am until 6pm every day making trips charging from $1.00 to $15.00. However, because he lives in a house that he’s refurbishing, he wants to use the loan to buy building materials and supplies like cement, cinder blocks and paint. In the future he’d like to improve his house’s construction and have a taxi cooperative.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For cement, cinder blocks, paint.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
El Señor Sergio S. O. tiene 37 años, el está separado de su esposa  y es padre de dos hijos a los cuales ayuda y apoya en su educación, el trabaja en el magisterio  como profesor de primaria, él también trabaja como moto taxista en el sindicato “CARRASCO”  en el cual esta hace mas de 10 años como socio activo y pertenece al directorio del mencionado Sindicato, el servicio que brinda es rentable por la alta cantidad de personas que solicitan este servicio por la facilidad,  rapidez y eficiencia. El sindicato cuenta con paradas y turnos para cada afiliado, en diferentes puntos de la localidad de Ivirgarzama donde las personas acuden para solicitar dicho servicio.

El cliente ya conoce bien de créditos, es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo de nuestra institución cuyo destino será la compra de una nueva motocicleta, debido a que la que tiene actualmente ya cumplió su ciclo de trabajo y de esta forma poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le permitirá también mejorar sus ingresos consecuentemente mejorar su calidad de vida.
Cabe señalar que el señor Sergio S. O. se apersono a CIDRE a solicitar su préstamo luego de que sus compañeros de trabajo le comentaron de las buenas condiciones crediticias con las que trabaja nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Sergio is 37 years old, separated from his wife and is the father of two children, whom he helps and supports with their education. He works as a elementary-school teacher and also drives a moto-taxi as a member of the "Carrasco" labor union. He has been an active member for more than 10 years and is on the union's directory. His taxi service is lucrative because of the high number of people who require the service due to its ease, speed and efficiency. The union has stops and shifts for each member in different points throughout the town of Ivirgarzama, where people use the taxi service. Sergio already is quite familiar with loans, but this is the first time he has taken one out with this institution. He plans to use the loan to purchase a new motorcycle because the one he currently has has run its course for his work. In this way he will be able to provide a better service to his customers, which will also help him increase his income and consequently improve his quality of life. It should be noted that Sergio came to Kiva partner CIDRE to request his loan after one of his co-workers commented to him about the institution's good credit conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Adikalie

texts.en:
Alikalie is 29 years old, married and has three children aged five, four and three years. He has two additional dependents, his younger brothers, who live with him because Alikalie is the only one who can take care of them.

In 2005 Alikalie established his soft drinks, provisions, biscuits and cigarette business. He began his business because he dropped out of school and found business to be his only alternative. Working seven days a week and fifteen hours a day, he earns about 1,471,200 SLL every month.

Alikalie would like a loan in the amount of 4,500,000 SLL. Alikalie requires a loan in order to buy more provisions. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 367,800 SLL. In the future Alikalie plans to purchase a popcorn machine. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more products for his shop

loans.name: Vigae Group

texts.en:
Balagashi A. is in his late thirties, divorced and has one child. During the week, he walks door-to-door offering manicure and pedicure services. During the weekend, he works at a beauty salon. Balagashi has been working in this for the past four years, and works daily between 10:00 a.m. and 6:00 p.m. The business earns Balagashi a good monthly profit.

This will be Balagashi's second loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. His previous loan was used to increase the stock needed for his business, a loan which he has successfully repaid. Balagashi aims to use a second loan to buy more materials such as towels and artificial nails. He also wishes to expand his business by starting to sell bed sheets. Balagashi's aim is to one day earn enough profit to build a house for himself.

Balagashi will share this loan with his loan group Vigae, which totals fifteen members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Balagashi is seen wearing black, second from right.

loans.use: To increase his stock and to start selling bed sheets

loans.name: Korng

texts.en: Korng D., 34, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. D. is employed at the factory, earning an income of about USD $3 per day. Her husband is a farmer and collects palm juice to sell, earning an income of about USD $1 per day. The family has to spend USD $44 on food, USD $2 on electricity and water supplies, and USD $50 on other necessary expenses every month.  D. is requesting a loan of USD $500 to purchase a tuk tuk for her husband to provide a transportation business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a tuk tuk

loans.name: Bo's Group

texts.en:
Bo S., 40 years old, is the village bank president having been selected by its eight members located in Preaek Hour Kaeut village in Kandal province. Each member of this group will use their portion of the loan to support their different purposes. 
 
She earns her living by selling groceries in the local village. She is a widow who works very hard to support her two children: one is a student and also helps the mother's business while another is just 2 years old. Her house now is old and needed to be fixed, so she would like to ask for a loan to add to her savings to fix her house. With the rest of the loan she would buy more groceries to support her business activities.

loans.use: To add to her savings to fix her house

loans.name: Edlen

texts.en:
Edlen B. is from the village of Bayo, Iguig, Cagayan. She is 28 years old. Edlen is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Edlen owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Edlen has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP when she sells one of her raised animals.

In 2010, Edlen joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edlen is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Edlen from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Mareme

texts.fr:
Madame MAREME D. est une femme de 37 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de NDONDOL depuis le 25 juin 2002. 

Elle fait du petit commerce de niébé et de mil. Elle fait aussi de l'embouche bovine.

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de poursuivre convenablement ses activités.

Son objectif est de pouvoir faire face aux besoins financier de la famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mareme D. is a 37 year old woman. She is married and the mother of four children in her care. She has been a member of the Village Bank of Ndondol since the 25th of June, 2002. 

She has a small business selling black-eyed peas (aka "cowpea") and millet. She also raises cattle. This new loan will permit her to properly continue her business. Her goal is to be able to handle the financial needs of her family.

loans.use: To promote her income generating business

loans.name: Norma Azucena

texts.es:
la señora Norma Azucena E. tiene 37 años de edad, vive en el barrio San Francisco, Norma es una mujer muy trabajadora, se dedica a la venta de joyas, su producto lo vende por pedidos grandes y tambien al detalle con los vecinos de su comunidad.
Norma es una mujer responsable y honrada.
junto con su esposo trabajan duro para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de joyas, en esta epoca de navidad muchas personas comprar joyas y es la oportunidad de vender mas.
las ganancias las necesita para dales una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señora Norma Azucena E., age 37, lives in the San Francisco neighborhood. Norma is a very hardworking woman. She is engaged in the sale of jewelry. She sells her product through wholesale orders and also at retail to neighbors in her community.

Norma is a responsible and honorable woman. Together with her husband, she works hard to cover the household expenses. During this Christmas season a lot of people buy jewelry, and it is an opportunity to sell more. She needs the earnings to provide a better quality of life to her children.

loans.use: The purchase of earrings, rings, chains, bracelets, and medals.

loans.name: Ramses

texts.en:
Ramses S. is from the village of Dist. 4. He is 31 years old. Ramses is married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Ramses owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Ramses has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, Ramses joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ramses is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to pay for services to increase his crop yield. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ramses from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase his crop yield

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe Group

texts.es: La señora Yolanda es la tesorera del grupo “Virgen D. Guadalupe”, grupo qye ah trabajado con Edaprospo desD. hace 10 años y que se conforma por 15 amigas y vecinas, ella esta casada y tiene 3 hijos, ademas vive del alquiler D. vestuario desD. hace 3 años y comenzo con su trabajo para ayudar a sus hijos. El grupo sabe que alcanzara sus metas con esfuerzo, ayuda D. Edaprospo y D. la Virgen D. Guadalupe por la que comparten su devocion.
texts.en: Yolanda is the treasurer of the Virgen D. Guadalupe group.  This group has worked with Edaprospo for 10 years and is maD. up of 15 friends and neighbors.  Yolanda is married and has 3 kids and to take care of them she has operated a clothing rental business for 3 years.  The group knows that they will reach their goals with hard work, help from Edaprospo and from the Virgen D. Guadalupe group to which they are very devoted.

loans.use: To purchase products and supplies.

loans.name: Martin Mauricio

texts.es: Martin Mauricio es un hombre muy trabajador él tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad. Su actividad económica es una pulpería, el dio inicio a su negocio por cuenta propia pues es su propia fuente de ingresos que es importante para su familia, es así que el ofrece una gran variedad de productos es así que sus clientes le realizan ciertos pedidos por lo que trata de hacer todo lo posible por complacerlos. El financiamiento que el solicita es para capital de trabajo y comprar golosinas, granos básicos, detergentes y una gran variedad de productos para la entrada a clases de los niños. El sueño de él es brindarle ciertas remodelaciones a su vivienda.
texts.en: Martin Mauricio is a hard working man and the father of two adult-children.  His business is a small grocery store in his home, a business he started on his own and is his family's main source of income.  This is why he provides a great variety of products and does his best to accommodate orders to keep his customers happy.  The loan he is taking out is for working capital and to buy sweets, basic grains, detergents, and a good variety of products as the children go back to school.  He dreams of doing some remodeling to his home.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Lucie

texts.en:
Lucie is 48 and is married, with seven children between 8 and 24 years old. Marie has been running a pub that sells drinks and food for 3 years. The pub is open from 5am until 9pm every day, and she employs one other person.

Lucie will use her loan to purchase more drinks and food for her pub and also to help start a new sorghum business. All her profits will go back into investing in this new business.

loans.use: Expanding her pub

loans.name: 'united Group'

texts.en:
Maima B., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'United Group'.  She is 57 years old, married, and has five children who are between the ages of 17 and 36 years. She did not attend school. 

For 24 years, she has been selling rice, meat, pepper, salt, seasoning, tomato, onions, etc. in Caldwell Community outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more rice, meat, pepper, salt, seasoning, tomato, onions, etc. to resell.

She describes herself as a determined woman whose dream is to improve her business. 

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Massa is inset at lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more rice, meat, pepper, salt, seasoning, tomato, onions to sell

loans.name: Amparo Soledad

texts.es:
Amparo de 34 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene un pequeño cyber en su casa. Antes de tener un negocio estable ella tuvo una tienda pero como pedio a su bebe tuvo que dejar ese negocio. 

En la actualidad ella tiene un pequeño cyber en su casa, en donde trabaja dando el servicio de internet y impresiones. Trabaja con ayuda de su hijo desde muy temprano hasta el anochecer. Tiene muchas aspiraciones para su negocio por eso quiere continuar comprando con el préstamo computadoras. En el futuro quiere tener el negocio más grande.
texts.en:
Amparo is 34 years old and she is a hardworking woman who has a small internet cafe in her house. Before she had a stable business she had a store but when she became pregnant she had to abandon that business.

Currently she has a small internet cafe in her house from where she provides internet and printing services. She works with her son's help from very early in the morning until nightfall.

She has great aspirations for her business which is why she wants to purchase computers with her loan. In the future she wants to have a larger business.

loans.use: to purchase computers

loans.name: Jose Johnny

texts.es:
José tiene 35  años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos menores de edades escolares. Vive en la zona rural del distrito de Pacora en la provincia de Lambayeque.  Cuenta con el servicio de agua, pero no tiene acceso a la electricidad. Su comunidad es pequeña con un aproximado de 200  familias.

Se gana la vida desde hace 4 años brindando el servicio de transporte de pasajeros contando con mototaxi propia, un vehículo que consta de una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior. Realiza esta actividad en una ruta fija. José es muy conocido en su comunidad y tiene mucha demanda de sus clientes. También, se dedica a la cultivación de maíz en un terreno cerca de su domicilio. Desea usar el préstamo para el mantenimiento y reparación de su mototaxi. Necesita mantener su vehículo en buenas condiciones para seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes. También, desea invertir en la compra de abonos para su siembra de maíz. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles. José es un hombre honesto y trabajador. Su mayor anhelo es lograr que su familia tenga una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José is 35 years old, married, and has three young children in school. He lives in the rural section of the District of Pacora in Lambayeque Province. José receives running water, but he does not have access to electricity. This small community has approximately 200 families.

José has earned his living for the past four years by providing passenger transport services using his own motorcycle taxi. This type of vehicle consists of a motorcycle and an attached cabin for carrying passengers. He conducts his business by traveling along a fixed route. José is well-known in his community and experiences great demand from his customers. In addition, he grows corn on a piece of land near his home. He wants to use this loan to maintain and repair his motorcycle taxi. José needs to keep his vehicle in good condition so that he can continue offering excellent service to his customers. He also wants to invest in the purchase of compost for his crop of corn. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN.

José is an honest and hardworking gentleman. His greatest wish is for his family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: To repair his motorcycle taxi and purchase compost for growing corn.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: El señor Ricardo es chofer. El crédito lo necesita para la compra de un motor para su taxi para su mejor funcionamiento en el trabajo que desempeña y sobre todo con mayor seguridad. Es casado, no tiene hijos y vive en anticrítico ubicada en la zona de las San Martín de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO.
texts.en: Sr. Ricardo is a chauffeur.  He needs this loan to buy a motor for his taxi so that it will function better in his job and above all provide greater safety.  Ricardo is married and does not have children.  He lives in a rental property in the District of San Martín in the city of La Paz.  This is the first time he has worked with IMPRO.

loans.use: To purchase a motor for his vehicle.

loans.name: Aquiles

texts.es: Aquiles de 42 años, natural del distrito de Quimbiri; convive con Gabriela de 33 años y tienen 01 hijo llamado Breyner de 01 y juntos viven en su propia casa donde reina la paz. Aquiles, es el sostén de su familia, desde muy niño sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar en la chacra, hoy es campesino y cuenta con 20 hectáreas de terreno en donde cultiva cacao y café plantas nativas de la zona selvática del Valle Río Apurímac.
