Han transcurrido 25 años trabajando en esta actividad, y manifiesta que le gusta mucho, además cuenta con el apoyo de sus familias, además de los jornaleros que contrata, para así terminar rápido el trabajo de siembra, poda de maleza y cosecha. Lo que más le gusta de su faena es cosechar los frutos de las plantas; ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es llevar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los centros de acopio ubicados en la ciudad de san francisco y Quimbiri; puesto que es muy pesado y le resulta difícil el transporte. Asimismo el no poder contar con suficiente ingreso económico para solventar los pagos por adelantado a los jornaleros quienes le brindan el apoyo en la cosecha y desmonte de maleza; es por ello que acude a los préstamos que facilita la Institución MFP. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es sembrar más plantas de café y cacao ya que cuenta con espacio suficiente. Este es su 12avo crédito con MFP, siente que el dinero del crédito le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy querido por el resto de sus compañeros. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles contratará jornaleros para que le apoyen en las cosechas.
texts.en:
Aquiles is 42 years old and from Quimbiri district.  He lives with 33 year-old Gabriela and they have one son called Breyner who is 1 year old.  Together they live in their own home where peace reigns.

Aquiles is his family's means of support.  His parents taught him to work on the farm since he was a very young boy.  He is now a farmer and has 20 hectares of land where he grows cacao and coffee which are both native plants of the rainforest area of the Apurímac River Valley.  He has worked in this business for 25 years and he says that he likes it a lot.  He also has the support of his familiy, in addition to the laborers that he hires so that he can finish his sowing, weeding and harvesting quickly.

What Aquiles most enjoys about his work is harvesting the fruit from his plants since that is when he feels that the months of hard work are providing him with their reward in the quality of the fruit.  He considers the most difficult part of his work to be transporting his products from the farm to the warehouses, which are located in the city of San Francisco and Quimbiri, as it is very heavy and difficult to transport.  Another difficulty is that he doesn't have enough money to pay in advance for the laborers who support him in his harvesting and weeding.  This is why he takes loans offered by MFP.

Right now, Aquiles' priority is sowing his coffee and cacao plants since he has enough space for this.  This is his 12th loan from MFP and he feels that the loan money will help him a lot in making progress in his work.  Aquiles is very well liked by the other members of his community bank.  He will use the 3,000 Peruvian soles he has requested to hire laborers to support him in his harvesting work.

loans.use: to hire laborers to help him with his harvest

loans.name: Joel

texts.es: Joel, de 37 años de edad, es natural de la ciudad de Palmapampa, convive con Mercedes de 29 años de edad y fruto de su relación tienen 02 hijos donde viven juntos en su propia casa ubicada en la comunidad de Sanabamba anexo del distrito de San Miguel. La labor que realiza Joel es labrar la tierra, donde cultiva cacao, café y frutas cítricas, en total cuenta con 03 hectáreas de terreno y es conocedor del arduo trabajo que se realiza en el campo. Tiene 15 años trabajando en esta actividad y en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros quienes se encargan de cosechar y  trasladar los productos recolectados hasta cierto tramo para luego ser transportados por medio de vehículos. Se siente muy comprometido con su trabajo; porque gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano hoy disfruta al ver que sus plantas son muy productivas permitiéndole obtener buenas ganancias. Asimismo considera que el invierno no es de su agrado porque son meses donde abundan mayor cantidad de insectos perjudicando a sus sembríos. Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro préstamo con mayor tranquilidad. Agradece a la institución por concederle el préstamo. Con el crédito solicitado comprará plantas injertadas como tangüelos y mandarinas.
texts.en: Joel is 37 years old and he is originally from Palmapampa. He is married common-law with Mercedes, 29 years old, and they have 2 children from their relationship. They live together in a house which they own, located in the community of Sanabamba, an annex of the district of San Miguel. Joel works the land where he cultivates cocoa, coffee, and citric fruits. He has 3 hectares of land in total and he is well acquainted with the arduous work associated with the land. He has been in the business for 15 years and during the harvest season has help from farmhands. They are in charge of the harvest and the transportation of the harvested goods to where they will be moved by vehicles. He is very committed to his work because it is thanks to his daily efforts that today he is able to enjoy watching his plants become very productive, earning him a good profit. The winter is not to his liking because during those months there is an abundance of insects that harm his plantations. This is his seventh loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and he knows that he if pays it on time he will be able to access another loan with greater ease. He is thankful to the organization for granting him a loan. With the loan he requests he will purchase grafted plants, such as tangelos and mandarins.

loans.use: to purchase critric fruit trees such as tangelos and mandarins.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a widow with five children, all of whom have graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past three years, she has operated a business selling dried fish. She sells at the market to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she also operates a business selling cashew nuts, which contributes to her other source of income. Mwanasiti faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During rainy season, the supply of fish is minimal and doesn't satisfy her customer's needs. She dreams of establishing business blocks to rent in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of dried fish for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es:
Segundo tiene  42 años de edad y es padre de un niño de 9 años. Segundo cuenta con su propio domicilio ubicado en una comunidad rural y humilde del distrito de Olmos- Lambayeque.

Segundo se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte público. Él cuenta con una mototaxi, que es una moto con una cabina en la parte posterior donde se pueden transportar pasajeros. Segundo brinda el servicio de mototaxi desde hace 3 años en su comunidad y alrededores, él cuenta con clientes fijos.

Segundo solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles que destinará en el mantenimiento de su moto, así como mejoras en su vivienda. 

Las mejoras en la moto de Segundo, le permitirán seguir brindando un buen servicio y por lo tanto obtener mayores ganancias para mejorar su calidad de vida. Él estaría muy agradecido de concedérsele el crédito pues le sería de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Segundo is 42 years old and is the father of a 9 year old boy. Segundo has his own home located in a rural and humble community of the district of Olmos- Lambayeque.

Segundo offers public transportation services. He has a motorrickshaw, which is a motorcycle with a cabin in the back part where passengers can be transported. Segundo has offered the motorrickshaw service for 3 years in his community and the surrounding areas. He counts on his steady customers.

Segundo is asking for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa that he will use to maintain his motorcycle as well as make improvements to his home.

The improvements on Segundo's motorcycle will permit him to continue offering a good service. Therefore, he will earn more to improve the quality of his life. He would be very thankful for considering him for the loan because it would be a great help to him.

loans.use: to maintain his motorcycle and to improve his housing.

loans.name: Purevsuren

texts.en:
Purevsuren is 42 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Tuv province of Mongolia. His two sons, aged 10 and 16, both attend a local secondary school. His wife is a technician in a weather broadcasting office.

Purevsuren manages a shoe making business in his town. He started his business in 2000 and has been able to stabilize it. He has built a good relationship both with his customers and partners. With 11 years of business operation, he has gained much experience and is planning to continue his business in the future. Purevsuren recently received many orders to make shoes for children who will ride horses during Naadam, a national holiday. His two sons help with the family business in their spare time. Purevsuren is a polite man who says, "I am planning to have my own workshop in the future." He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Ama est à son troisième crédit  dans notre institution  et est une bonne revendeuse de céréales et de charbon de bois car elle maîtrise bien son activité. Elle s’approvisionne à Anié(Atakpamé) puis revend  à domicile. Ama est mariée  à un commerçant et mère de deux(02) enfants.
texts.en: Ama is currently applying for her third loan with the microfinance institution WAGES. She is a successful seller of cereals and charcoal, because she fully masters her activity. She gets her supplies in Anié (Atakpamé) and resells out of her home. Ama is married to a merchant and is the mother of two children.

loans.use: to buy cereals and charcoal.

loans.name: Adalhia

texts.en: Adalhia is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Adalhia has a business selling grown and matured pigs. She has had this business for five years. Adalhia has requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy animal feed for the pigs. She has been a member of Kiva partner, HSPFI, since 2009. In the future, Adalhia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine is 38 years old, married and has three children in school. He runs a transport business to earn a living for his family. He has been in the business for three years and has employed two people to assist him. Besides, he is employed. He has retained his business through the financial support from Faulu Kenya.

Augustine hopes to own more Lorries for his transport business in the future. He has requested for 50,000 Kenyan shillings to repair his lorry.

loans.use: to repair his lorry.

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en: Kevin is a hardworking 21-year-old businessman who is single. For the last four years, he has been operating a quarry business to make a living. Previously he was employed as a miner. He wants in the next five years to have bought a truck for transporting the stones he mines to his clients. His dream is to be a prosperous businessman. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy two wheelbarrows, a spade and three mattocks. (A mattock is a hand tool similar to a pickaxe.) Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has learned the art of saving.

loans.use: to buy two wheelbarrows, a spade and three mattocks

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 43 years old and married with three children who are schooling. His wife operates a shop with a monthly income of KES 5000. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a registered client. He has been a good client who has paid his all previous loans well and without any complications. He is a carpenter and he has been doing this for the last six years. 

He applied for his second loan, which he plans to use to expand his carpentry business. He hopes to make a profit and reinvest the same in his business expansion by buying more timber, and velvet materials for making chair cushions. His dream is to be the best carpenter in the vicinity.

loans.use: to buy timber  and velvet materials for making chair cushions

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is an entrepreneur from Novaya Kahovka. She sells women’s clothing items such as jeans and sportswear in one of the city markets. She started this venture with the help of lending assistance in order to get going. She has now been in business for sixteen years. Currently, her turnover is about 30,000 Grivnyas and her monthly net profit is about 6,000 Grivnyas.

Irina loves what she is doing and is looking forward to the future. She is grateful for the opportunity this business has given her, not only to provide for herself, but also to help her family. The current loan of 15,000 Grivnas will help her business be stable this fall season.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal inventories

loans.name: Uon

texts.en:
Mrs. Uon lives in the Ornlong Veng district of Siem Reap province with her lovely husband and child. She has a pig fattening business and she also distills liquor in her home. She says that this work keeps her really busy but, luckily, her husband, a rice farmer, often helps her. Mrs. Uon typically earns an average of $4.50 US per day to meet the family's expenses. 

Mrs. Uon is requesting a loan from Kiva through HKL to use as capital to keep running her liquor distilling business and to purchase piglets for raising. For the future, Mrs. Uon plans to expand her business and to gain a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase piglets for raising and to keep running her liquor distilling business

loans.name: Affiyo

texts.fr:
Affiyo est une femme de 40 ans. Elle est mariée à un agent de la fonction publique. Elle a 05 enfants, dont 03 sont encore à l’école. Le premier a 12ans et le dernier a 01 an et demi.  
Affiyo vend des produits d’alimentation générale et des sacs de charbon depuis l’année 2000. Elle sert toute personne dans sa boutique. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la concurrence. 
Affiyo a requis son troisième crédit à WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de charbon, des bidons d’huile, des cartons de lait concentré et d’autres produits d’alimentation générale. Elle veut réinvestir ses profits supplémentaires dans son activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Affiyo voudrait pérenniser son commerce. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit d’investir dans l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants
texts.en:
Affiyo is a 40 year old woman. She is married to a public official. She has 05 children, 03 of whom are still in school. The oldest is 12 years old and the youngest is 1 and a half years old. 
Affiyo has been selling general food supplies and bags of coal since 2000. She serves all kinds of people in her shop. At the moment, her greatest challenge is the competition. 
Affiyo has requested her third loan through WAGES in order to buy bags of coal, cans of oil, cartons of condensed milk and other general grocery products. She wants to reinvest any additional profits into her business.
In the coming years, Affiyo would like to sustain her business. She says that she would like to use the profits to invest in the education of her children.

loans.use: Buy food supplies and bags of coal

loans.name: Khasifa

texts.en:
Khasifa is 35 years old and lives in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past ten years Khasifa has been working hard to manage her electronics shop, which sells engine oil, tubes, antennas, bulbs and electric kettles. 

To help expand her business, Khasifa has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more electronics for her shop, and will help Khasifa to generate greater profits and improve her family's welfare. Khasifa hopes that in the future she will be able to continue growing her business. 

Khasifa is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Khasifa who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more electronics for her shop

loans.name: Jenny Nohemy

texts.es:
Jenny, vive con su familia, su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella administra en su casa una granja de cerdos,  este negocio comenzó por iniciativa propia, para tener una ocupación y de ella una fuente de ingresos para cubrir algunos gastos de su familia.
Ella comprara tres cerdos y concentrado, para la granja, por eso solicita un préstamo para realizar la inversión, esto le permitirá ampliar el negocio y mejorar la atención a la clientela.
El propósito de Jenny es tener un negocio grande, ampliar el número de cerdos y el tamaño del corral, dándoles mejores cuidados para hacer mejor venta.
texts.en:
Jenny lives with her family: her husband and three children.  She has a pig farm at home that she manages.  The business started on her own initiative in order to have an occupation of her own and a source of income to cover some of the family expenses.

She will buy three pigs and feed concentrate for the farm.  This is why she needs a loan to make this investment that will allow her to expand the business and improve customer service.

Jenny’s goal is to have a large business, to increase the number of pigs and the size of her corral, providing better care for them so that sales will be better.

loans.use: to buy three pigs and feed concentrate.

loans.name: Etelvina

texts.es: La socia Etelvina actualmente se dedcia  a la preparación y venta de rocoto relleno, la socia es una mujer muy emprendedora y ahora esta con su negocio de venta de rocotos de forma independiente y ambulatoria, la socia compra al por mayor rocotos, los limpia, prepara el relleno y con una capa de ponche de harina con huevo lo enrrolla, en otra olla sancocha las papas y luego lleva en un olla con servilletas y manteles bien envueltos a vender a los difernetes clientes que ya la conocen y saben de su rica sazón. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de rocotos al por mayor, y de ingredientes para la elaboracion de los famosos rocotos rellenos acompañados con papa sancochada.
texts.en: Etelvina currently makes and sells stuffed hot peppers for a living. She is a very enterprising woman and her business selling hot peppers is now independent and mobile.  She buys hot peppers wholesale, cleans them, prepares the filling, and she rolls them in a layer of flour mixed with egg.  In another pot she boils potatoes and then she takes everything in a pot wrapped up really well along with napkins and table cloths to sell to her different customers who know her and know her food tastes good.  She is asking for a loan to buy hot peppers wholesale as well as ingredients to make her famous stuffed peppers with boiled potatoes.

loans.use: to buy hot peppers wholesale and to buy potatoes and other ingredients.

loans.name: Bodunrin Germaine

texts.fr: Bodunrin Germaine est âgée de 34 ans et vit au Bénin. Bodunrin Germaine est mariée à un électricien du nom de Alain. Bodunrin Germaine a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire. Le couple a deux enfants dont un scolarisé et tous à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant en charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de la famille, Bodunrin Germaine exerce depuis onze ans le métier de couture dans son quartier. De façon secondaire, Bodunrin Germaine vend des fournitures de couture. Grâce au revenu que lui génère cette activité, Bodunrin Germaine contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Bodunrin Germaine sollicite pour une quatrième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement par Bodunrin Germaine ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Bodunrin Germaine is 34 years old and lives in Benin.She left school after primary level. She is married to an electrician called Alain with whom she has two children. One of them attends school and both are in their care. In addition to their own children, the couple has one other child in their care. The children all live with their parents. The couple sees to the family's everyday needs together. In order to contribute to the family's needs, Bodunrin Germaine has worked as a seamstress for eleven years. She also sells sewing supplies as a secondary source of income. In order to meet the demand of her growing customer base she is seeking her fourth loan from ALIDé. She has successfully reimbursed all previous loans.

loans.use: to purchase dressmaking tools

loans.name: Sawe Puncak Indah Group

texts.en:
The Sawe Puncak Indah group was formed by 10 women who have similar purposes and businesses as pig breeders. They got the information about pig breeding from the other group at the next village. Actually, they already have pigs at home, but they want to improve their businesses by joining MUK.

Ni Ketut, head of the group, has three children and they all are still in school. Her husband works as a traveling salesman who sells banana, coconut, cacao and other items. Ni Ketut will use the loan to purchase superior piglets. Now the price is Rp 450;000 per piglet. Ni Ketut has a big dream of becoming a succesful pig breeder so she can help her husband with the living costs.

loans.use: To purchase superior piglets

loans.name: Adeluz

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Adeluz; ella tiene 23 años de edad y es soltera; La socia sigue trbajando en su negocio de servicio de llamadas telefonicas,ella trabaja en forma ambulatoria desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m,por medio de este trabajo la socia quiere salir adelante y poder ahorra para que pueda estudiar alguna carrera profesional,el sueño de l socia es poder tener un local donde pueda poner el servicio de llamadas . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar celulares.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Adeluz is 23 years old, single, and continues to work in her business of providing telephone calling services. She works as a traveling vendor from 7am to 9pm. Through her work, she is able to move forward and save toward being able to study for a professional degree. Her dream is to have a location where she can provide calling services. She is requesting a loan to buy mobile phones.

Adeluz is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phones.

loans.name: Joram

texts.en:
Joram has been farming for eight years.  The 32-year-old man was previously operating a motorbike transport business.  He works hard in his business so as to provide for his wife and six children. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to gain a lot of skills in business management.  This is because he has been trained in business management skills.

Joram needs a loan of 20,000 Kes to bu fertilizer, seeds and a water pump.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and a water pump.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase equipment to expand her printing business.

loans.name: Dede

texts.en: Dede is a smoked fish seller. She sells from house to house, but she has no money to buy fish in bulk. She wishes to buy fish in cartons from the harbour and smoke them for sale. She is seeking a loan of $700.00 from Kiva.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: He wants to invest the loan in the maintenance and repair of the bakery and to buy raw materials to produce high quality bread.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda Nohemí P., 24, runs a typing school, using old-fashioned typewriters. Hers is one of three typing schools in the town, but all the children need to learn how to type before they enter junior high school, so the school has thrived. Brenda and her husband started the school in 2004 after months of bureaucratic paperwork, and launched it with lots of advertising, and the business thrived from the start. 
Brenda charges about US$4.00/month for students to study at the school, and they can finish with certificates of varying ability. Right now she has 150 students studying. 
Like many women in her town, Brenda also has other irons in the fire. On weekends she sells new clothes in the town's Sunday market. Her husband Saulo works as a health worker for a government health service. Both of them are still pursuing advanced education. Brenda is getting a secretarial degree and hopes to go on to university and Saulo is studying Business Administration. They want the best for their two children. And their 5-year-old says he wants to be a doctor, so they're ready to educate him for a long time. Written by Randy Fay, Kiva Fellow

loans.use: Expansion of weekend clothing sales inventory

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Mrs. Elena C. lives with her husband and children, ages 12, 10 and 1, in their own home in the Munaypata neighborhood, on the north face of the city of La Paz. Elena and her husband run a small diner where they serve lunch every day of the month.

They previously received a loan from IMPRO to build a side fence on the property line bordering their neighbor. Due to the area's topography and the lack of fences, their home was prone to being burglarized.

The proceeds of this loan will be used to build the back fence surrounding their property, which will give Elena and her family a greater measure of security and safety. Elena has been a client of IMPRO since 2005 and has received 2 previous loans, both of which she has repaid in full. The socioeconomic analysis conducted by IMPRO qualifies Elena and her husband to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Elena C. vive en casa propia en la zona de Munaypata ladera norte de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposo y sus hijos de 12, 10 y 1 año de edad; la señora Elena junto a su esposo atienden una pensión de su zona ofreciendo almuerzos todos los días del mes. En anterior ocasión fueron beneficiados con un crédito de IMPRO para la construcción del muro lateral de su casa que colinda con el vecino, ya que dada la topografía y la falta de muros perimetrales de sus vecinos, su vivienda corría el peligro de sufrir robos. El crédito ahora solicitado será destinado a la construcción de el muro perimetral en la parte posterior de la vivienda que les dará mayor seguridad. La señora Elena C. es nuestro cliente desde el año 2005 y desde entonces ha sido favorecida con dos créditos con nuestra institución, los cuales a la fecha están completamente pagados. El análisis socioeconómico realizado muestra un estado financiero favorable y la califica perfectamente para acceder un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: To build a fence around home

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mrs. Heng K., aged 36, is a market vendor selling rice and beans, earning about $4 per day in revenue. Her husband works milling rice crops, earning about $2.50 per day. They have three children, two who are in school and one who is not yet of school-going age.

She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to increase her inventory of rice and beans to meet customer demand. She will reduce her costs by purchasing the inventory in bulk, thereby increasing her profit margins and raising her family’s income level.

loans.use: To purchase additional rice and beans to sell in the market.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro is 45 years old. He dedicates himself each morning to transporting passengers in his motorcycle-drawn cart and in the afternoons he works in his metal workshop. Right now, there are two vehicles in the workshop; he works on one and his son on the other. His wish is to see his sons become successful professionals. That's why he works hard in order to give them what they need. His companion, Irma, supports him in everything and he is very happy to find himself surround by a family that he values very much. He has plans to acquire another motorcycle cart and improve his workshop. He needs a sum of money which will make his desires possible and create happiness and prosperity for this enterprising and hard-working man. We support this talented and strong father who continues working hard for progress.

Translated by Princeton University Language Project.

Pedro de 45 años de edad, se dedica durante las mañanas al transporte de pasajeros en su motocarro y por las tardes se instala en su taller de estructuras metálicas, en la actualidad cuenta con dos vehículos, en uno de ellos trabaja él y en el otro su hijo.El anhelo que tiene es observar a sus hijos convertidos en unos exitosos profesionales, por esa razón trabaja arduamente a fin de darles lo que ellos necesitan, su compañera, la señora Irma, lo apoya en todo y él se siente muy feliz al saber que se encuentra rodeado de su familia que realmente lo valora mucho.Tiene planes de adquirir otro motocarro y posteriormente mejorar las instalaciones de su taller metálico, para realizar lo que realmente desea le es necesario un suma de dinero el cual posibilitará su propósito y generará alegría y prosperidad a este hombre emprendedor y luchador. Apoyemos a este padre que con talento y esfuerzo sigue trabajando arduamente por progresar.

loans.use: Purchase of car repair parts

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en: Jane, the group leader, is 42 years old and married with eight children. She sells matooke ( banana food) in the market. She wants to buy a plot of land and construct a house from the business profits.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Mey

texts.en: Mrs. Mey S., 38, works with her husband on their farm growing rice crops and raising horse making totally about $3 each day of income. This couple has seven children. One of their children works making incenses; another one works as a garment worker; one of whom is enrolled in school and the rest of which are married and stay separately. Mrs. Mey S. is humble to request for a loan to expand her livestock by adding more healthy horse to breed for generating more profit in the next twelve to eight months.

loans.use: To purchase more horses to breed.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi N., 47 years old, is a third year member of TYM Fund (Kiva Partner). Her family includes her husband, her four children and herself. Their family's main job is farming and animal breeding. She uses her previous loans efficiently so her family income increases significantly. The cost of piglets and cows are increasing, however, causing her a need to borrow larger loan. Since her children are all grown up and have their own job, it's easier for Mrs. N. to make the weekly repayment. This time Mrs. N. wants to borrow 575USD to buy piglets and food for them.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Ngọc, 47 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 3 của Quỹ Tình thương. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và 4 người con. Hoạt động chủ yếu của gia đình là làm ruộng và chăn nuôi. Các vòng vốn trước chị Ngọc đều vay và sử dụng vốn đúng mục đích nên mang lại hiệu quả kinh tế tốt. Giá lợn và bò hiện nay đều thường xuyên tăng nên chị Ngọc luôn muốn vay mức vốn cao. Các con đều đã trưởng thành và có việc làm nên việc hoàn trả tuần diễn ra thuận lợi. Vòng vốn này chị Ngọc xin vay 575USD đầu tư mua lợn giống và thức ăn chăn nuôi.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Aguilas Group

texts.es:
THE COMMUNITY CENTER “ALTO LIMA” IS LOCATED IN THE BALLIVIAN ZONE OF THE CITY OF EL ALTO. THE “AGUILAS” ASSOCIATION, COMPRISED OF 18 ASSOCIATES, MEETS THERE. THEY ARE A VERY AGREEABLE GROUP THAT,WITH THEIR LOAN ADVISOR, RICHARD SUXO, HAS WORKED WITH PRO-MUJER TO COMPLETE TWO LOANS. THE MAJORITY OF THEM HAVE SMALL CHILDREN THAT REQUIRE BASIC MEDICAL ATTENTION. THAT IS TO SAY THEY HAVE NOT HAD VACCINATIONS OR MEDICAL CHECKUPS FOR LACK OF ECONOMIC RESOURCES.

THE ACTIVITIES THAT THE "AGUILAS" ASSOCIATION MEMBERS PERFORM ARE OF ALL TYPES. FOR EXAMPLE, ONE OF THEM IS DEDICATED TO CARPENTRY. ANOTHER BAKES BREAD AND BISCUITS FOR SALE TO THE NEIGHBORHOOD STORES. BUT THE MAJORITY ARE DEDICATED TO THE MANUFACTURE OF CLOTHES SUCH AS: JACKETS, BAGS, SPORTS CLOTHES AND ALSO WHAT THEY CALL THE DRESSMAKING OF CASUAL CLOTHES; THAT IS TO SAY BLOUSES, SKIRTS AND T-SHIRTS.

THEY STATE THAT THEY NEED MORE CAPITAL FOR THE PURCHASE OF MACHINES FOR THE BAKERY AND CLOTHING BUSINESS, SO THEY CAN INCREASE THEIR PRODUCTION AND QUALITY. IN THIS WAY THEY HOPE TO BE ABLE TO GENERATE GREATER RESOURCES, ALL THIS FOR THE GOOD OF THEIR FAMILIES, SINCE INCREASING THEIR INCOMES WILL ALLOW THEM TO ASSURE THE HEALTH AND WELFARE OF THEIR CHILDREN.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

EN LA ZONA BALLIVIAN DE LA CIUDAD DE EL ALTO SE ENCUENTRA HUBICADO EL CENTRO FOCAL ALTO LIMA, A ESTE PERTENECE LA ASOCIACION “AGUILAS” INTEGRADO POR 18 SOCIAS. UN GRUPO MUY SINPATICO QUE JUNTO A SU ASESOR DE CREDITOS RICHARD SUXO, TRABAJAN CON PRO-MUJER HACE DOS CICLOS. LA MAYORIA DE ELLAS TIENEN NIÑOS PEQUEÑOS, QUE REQUIEREN ATENCIONES MEDICAS BASICAS, VALE DECIR QUE NO CUENTAN CON VACUNAS Y VALORACIONES INDISPENSABLES, POR FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONÓMICOS.

LAS ACTIVIDADES QUE REALIZA LA ASOCIACIÓN “AGUILAS” SON DE TODO TIPO, POR EJEMPLO UNA DE ELLAS SE DEDICA A LA CARPINTERIA, OTRAS PRODUCEN PAN Y BISCOCHOS PARA LUEGO OFRECERLOS A LAS TIENDAS DEL BARRIO, PERO LA MAYORIA SE DEDICA A LA CONFECCION DE ROPA COMOS SER: CHAMARRAS, SACOS, ROPA DEPORTIVA Y TAMBIEN COMO ELLAS DENOMINAN LA COSTURA DE ROPA LIVIANA, ES DECIR BLUSAS, FALDAS Y POLERAS,

AFIRMAN QUE NECESITAN MAYOR CAPITAL PARA LA COMPRA DE MAQUINAS DE CONFECCION, ASI AUMENTARIA SU PRODUCCIÓN Y CALIDAD, DE ESTA FORMA PODER GENERAR MAYORES RECURSOS, TODO ESTO PARA EL BIEN DE SUS FAMILIAS YA QUE AUMENTANDO SUS INGRESOS PODRIAN ASEGURAR LA SALUD Y BIENESTAR DE SUS HIJOS.

loans.use: To buy machines for the bakery and clothing businesses.

loans.name: Asha's Taifa Group

texts.en:
Asha is 31 years old and is married woman with 3 children, ages 14,12 and 9 years old. Asha has a bicycle rental business. She started in 2007. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more bicycle items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Mwajabu, Anna Makobora ,and Anna M., who have businesses renting bicycles and selling clothing.

loans.use: To buy more  bicycles for hiring.

loans.name: Helena Leta

texts.en:
Helena is 42 years old and originally from the capital city Maputo. Helena has five children, of which three are studying. Helena’s older daughter is at home and one of her sons lost his place at school, so will have to wait until next year.

Helena was raised by her mother who worked as a house maid. She studied until 2nd grade and stopped due to her mother’s difficult financial situation. Once her father abandoned her mother, Helena was taken to live with her grandmother and then with an aunt who was also a house maid.

Helena started to sell basic needs products for her aunt when she was a child. In 1981 she started to sell products at her own stand. Today Helena’s most profitable products are peanuts, beans and cereals. Helena works all day long, as the stand is located in front of her house. She is currently negotiating a stand at the Benfica market where she will have more customers and increase her daily income. Today Helena has a daily profit of MTn 75 (around US$3.00) and also has an income coming from three rooms she rents at a house she built next to her own.

Through a neighbor Helena heard about Hluvuku and decided to ask for her first loan of MTn 10,000 in order to strengthen her business. Helena will buy merchandise in bulk, reducing the price of acquisition and consequently increasing her profit.

In the future Helena would like to open her own general store, with legal license to operate and with many customers, so she can increase her income.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi M., aged 54, has two children, one of whom is married and has a secure job. Mrs. M. has joined the TYM Fund for seven years. During the first few years, Mrs. M. used the loans to invest into breeding animals and planting orchard, which helped increase her family’s income very much. After the first two years, Mrs. M. was more confident about asking for more loans to build more breeding facilities for chickens and pigs. She also makes use of food from her orchards to feed the chickens and pigs, helping her save a considerable amount of money to purchase furniture and improve the quality of her family’s life. In the next loan level, Mrs. M. wishes to borrow 10 millions VND to buy more tools for her work. Her family’s income is 3 millions VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Mỹ năm nay 54 tuổi. Hiện gia đình chị có một con đã trưởng thành đã xây dựng gia đình và có công ăn việc làm ổn định. Tính đến thời điểm này chị đã tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương được 7 năm. Những năm đầu tham gia Quỹ gia đình chị vay vốn đàu tư vào chăn nuôi và vườn cây ăn quả của gia đình cho thu nhập tăng lên đáng kể. Qua 2 năm tham gia vay vốn gia đình chị đã mạnh dạn vay thêm vốn đầu tư vào sửa sang chuồng trại để chăn nuôi thêm lợn, gà. Với nguồn thức ăn tận dụng được từ vườn nhà công việc chăn nuôi của gia đình đã cho thu nhập cao. Vì thế gia đình chị đã đầu tư được nhiều hơn cho việc chăn nuôi, mua sắm trang thiết bị, sửa sang nhà cửa. Vòng vốn tiếp theo chị muốn vay thêm 10 triệu đồng để đầu tư mua thêm lợn về chăn nuôi.

Thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu  is a married woman with 5  children aged between 12  and 3.  She is a bread seller. Every day, she works from 5am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Tatu now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To increase her stock.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mom L., 27, is a rice farmer who lives with two children. Living in the Kampong Cham province, she typically makes about US$1 each day and her husband typically earns US$2 of profit as a motor-taxi driver. Previously this couple used to raise fish together, but they were unsuccessful. The fish died because they have no skill in raising fish. This time they want to raise fish again because they now have an idea from their neighbors who raise fish successfully. Mrs. Mom is asking for a loan from Kiva via Credit, the local partner, to raise fish to double the family income. The loan will also help to purchase feed for the fish as well.

loans.use: To raise fish to double the family income.

loans.name: Afusatu

texts.en: Afusatu A. sells drinks and produces nylon in her home. She has been selling drinks for a long time but learned to produce Nylon within the past 2 years. Afusatu is 51 years old and is married with 5 children. Afusatu lives in Okoko, Lagos state, Nigeria and is a LAPO client. She is requesting a loan of of $850 to buy more drinks and materials for the production of Nylon. She thanks you in advance.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and materials for the production of nylon to sell

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Абдухалилов Алишер житель города Нурек. Возраст 28 лет. Женат и имеет двоих детей.Имеет продуктовый магазин , который находится в центре Яванского базарв. Занимается торговлей уже пять лет. Планирует получить кредит сроком на 10 месяцев. Получив кредит он сможет увеличить ассортимент товара и привлечь новых клиентов. Это принесет дополнительный доход.
texts.en:
Alisher A. lives in the city of Nurek. He is 28 years old, married, and has two children. He runs a grocery store in the center of the Yavan bazar. He has been in working in sales for five years already. He decided to take out a 10 month loan. The loan will be used to expand his inventory and attract new customers, which will increase his income.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Sales

loans.name: Abdoul

texts.fr: Agée de 26 ans Abdoul S. est un jeune commerçant celibataire installé à Mbour.Venu de son village natal ,il a débuté son commerce par la vente de lait caillé avant d' ouvrir il y a six (06) une boutique de commerce de detail  pour diversifier son activité.Avec le pret  demandé,il va renforcer les quantités de stock de marchandises pour mieux répondre à la demande de la clientelle
texts.en:
Abdoul S., 26 and single, is a young merchant living in Mbour. Having come there from the village where he was born, he began by selling buttermilk before he opened his little general store 6 years ago, in order to diversify his business. With the loan he is requesting, he hopes to bolster his inventory so that he can better meet the needs of his clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: business capital

loans.name: Kudjukalo

texts.fr:
Née à Lomé, la capitale du Togo, Madame K. est une femme de 31 ans qui a pour l’activité la restauration.  Depuis 2006 elle a exercé ce commerce dans le marché de Lomé, et elle n’a jamais bénéficié d’un crédit au près de WAGES.  Actuellement, ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite va lui permit d’acheter 10 ignames et de la viande.  Ces choses sont très importantes dans la préparation de la cuisine locale.  Les Togolais pilent les ignames pour préparer un repas qui s’appelle « fufu», et ils mangent le fufu avec la sauce de viande.  Donc, ce crédit sera très important pour Madame K. de bien vendre ses repas.
Madame K. est mariée avec un comptable et ils ont 2 enfants.
texts.en:
Born in Lomé, the capital of Togo, Mrs. K. is 31 years old and runs a catering business. Since 2006, she has run this business in the market at Lomé, and so far, she has not obtained any previous loans through the organization WAGES. Currently, this first loan she is asking for will allow her to buy 10 yams and meat. These ingredients are very important in the preparation of local cuisine. The Togolese crush yams to prepare a meal called "fufu," which is eaten with meat sauce. Thus, this loan will be very important for Mrs. K. in helping to sell meals. Mrs. K. is married to an accountant, and they have 2 children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy yams and meat

loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sin M., 48, is a widow with five children, one son who is a construction worker and four daughters. The eldest daughter is married and lives outside the family home; the youngest child attends school and the other children assist their mother in farming. The family lives along National Road Number One about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sim is a farmer. She grows green vegetables and flowers. She sells them to the middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. She is requesting a loan of US$ 600 to purchase a water pump, fertilizer, and pesticide for her farming business.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump, fertilizer, and pesticide

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary Mavis N. is seventy-two years old. She is a widow and has three children who are all living independently. Mavis is a dealer in hardware: assorted paints, nails, roofing sheets, hammers, PVC pipes, etc. at Haatso, a suburb of Accra where she lives with her grandchildren. She buys her supplies from importers in Accra at wholesale prices and sells to her customers at retail prices.

Mary is requesting the loan to enable her to procure increased stocks of paints, nails, hammers etc., to accelerate business progress. With the loan, she hopes to increase savings to expand her shop to include the sale of cement. She would be very grateful for your support.

Mary is in a group in her community called Strong Trust Bank. The members in the group guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan and provide support and assistance to one another in handling repayment.

loans.use: To procure hardware for re-sale

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
A. Gloria is a 42-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of two children who are currently in school. Through hard work, A. support for her children's education. She is a food vendor who sells kenkey (corn dumpling) in her neighborhood for the past eight years now. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains that cooked and eaten with hot pepper, gravy stew, or other types of soup and fried fish or meat. She has many customers, because many Ghanaians enjoy kenkey for breakfast, lunch and supper. She has added the sale of soft drinks and grocery products to her product line. 

She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials, like maize, meat, fish, rice, vegetables and firewood. As a part of her business expansion, A. has added cooked rice and stew to her product line. She said most of her customers requested rice, so she saw it as an opportunity. 

She hopes to raise more income to support her children so they can enter university. A. belongs to a village bank called ‘Joy’. She also hope to receive GH¢700 to improve her business by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.fr:
K. Elisabeth est née vers 1981 à Ganvié. K. Elisabeth est mariée à MIGNANWANDE Lissanon et mère de cinq enfants dont 2 sont scolarisés. K. Elisabeth a été initiée depuis son enfance à la vente de poisson. K. Elisabeth continue de mener cette activité de vente de poisson. K. Elisabeth a déjà deux crédits avec ALIDé. K. Elisabeth veut diversifier un peu son activité avec la vente de récipients et bassines en plastique. C'est pourquoi K. Elisabeth sollicite un troisième crédit; ainsi K. Elisabeth va pouvoir tirer plus de revenus de ses activités lui permettant de satisfaire au mieux ses besoins.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Elisabeth K. was born circa 1981 in Ganvié, she's married to Lissanon MIGNANWANDE and the mother of five children, out of which two attend school. She was introduced to fish selling during her childhood. To this day, she continues to run this business. She already benefited from two loans from Kiva's partner, Alidé. She wants to diversify her business by selling plastic basins and containers. This is the reason why she's seeking a third loan, which will enable her to increase her profit and to better provide for herself.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 10 plastic baskets and 15 plastic containers

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
Mariana is divorced with two children. She sells children's clothing at the central market in Drogobych city. Her profit is 4,000 UAH per month.

Mariana has been in this business for 3 years. She used to work in sales, as a cashier at a big sales company. Mariana is a very enthusiastic, hard-working and honest person. Her business goal is to start a second location and enlarge her business.

Mariana would like to borrow 5,500 UAH to increase her assortment. Affordable prices and large assortment that is renewed often help her to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: to increase her assortment

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Cette dame exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de sacs de charbons de bois en gros et en détail. Elle  vend à crédit à ses clients et récupère l’argent dans les 7 ou 8 jours. Actuellement son stock est épuisé, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite son premier crédit pour acheter 22 sacs de charbons de bois. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman earns an income in the commerce of sacks of charcoal, wholesale and retail. She accepts credit from her customers and collects the money in seven or eight days. Currently, her inventory is exhausted. She wants to resupply herself and is requesting her first loan to buy 22 sacks of charcoal. She is married and the mother of two children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Brigida Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Brigida.  Es socia del Banco Comunal “Aswancaris II” en la  provincia de Azangaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 42 años de edad,  vive en el Jr. Rinconada s/n Barrio Ezequiel Urbiola.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 03 año, la actividad a la que se dedica es la  venta de comida, su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, para comprar mas víveres para la preparación de comida para la venta

Actualmente ella desea un préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, este préstamo le servirá para poder adquirir mas víveres, y de esta manera seguir haciendo crecer su negocio.  Le gustaría poner un restaurante bien grande.

A ella le gusta mucho las reuniones y los encuentros deportivos ya que es una forma de compartir con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
Brigida is a member of the “Aswancaris II” Microfinance Institute in the Azangaro province, department of Puno. She is 42 years old and lives in the Ezequiel Urbiola neighborhood.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for 3 years. She has her own food sales business. Her first loan, which was in the amount of 300.00 PEN, was used to purchase more provisions for food preparation and sales.

She currently wishes to obtain a 500.00 PEN loan, which will help her to purchase more provisions, thus continuing to make her business grow. She would like to set up a big restaurant one day.

She really likes the institute’s meetings and sports events because they provide a way of spending time with her fellow group members.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase meat, rice, noodles, condiments, and vegetables

loans.name: Vuthy's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vuthy P. is a group leader of three members who all live in Chheu Teal village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Mao Bophea, are farmers who own a small piece of land, used for cultivating rice. After they finish their plantation, they are laborers hired by the other villagers. Even though they try to work hard, they still earn less income than is required to support their family’s expenses. Thus, Mrs. Vuthy P. decided to ask for a loan to buy bananas to resell to earn more money to support her family. She hopes this new business will succeed and improve her family’s living. She is 31 years old and the mother of three children, two are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. The man in the picture is a guarantor.

Two members in this group are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy bananas to resell to earn more money to support her family.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary D. is 41 years old. She is married and the mother of five children, four of whom are in school. Through her business, Mary has supported her eldest child through senior high school and continues the support. Mary lives with her husband who is also a trader. She is a food vendor and sells kenkey and fish through hawking. She carries the hot kenkey on her head and hawks until the sun goes down. She has been in business for the last fifteen years, so one can imagine she survives to cater to her family.

Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaian enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children’s education. Mary belongs to a village bank called ‘Nyame Adom’ which literary means God’s Grace.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials

loans.name: Teresa Julia

texts.es: Teresa Julia R. D. A. D. 43 años D. edad vive en el departamento D. Ahuachapán con sus seis hijos D. las edades siguientes Max D. 20años D. edad, Ángel 13 años, José 11 años, Henry  8 años, David 5 años y la mas pequeñita Alicia D. 2 años D. edad. Teresa en una madre ejemplar al sacar adelante a todos sus hijos y dándoles educación escolar a cada uno D. ellos. Teresa se dedica a la producción D. chocolate el cual distribuye en varias tiendas D. la zona, Teresa hace su chocolate desD. la etapa D. moler hasta el empacamiento D. cada tablilla del mismo, este crédito Teresa lo solicita para comprar materia prima para su producto ya que pretenD.  expandir su distribución D. su chocolate a diferentes lugares del país.
texts.en:
Teresa Julia R. D. A., 43, lives in the Ahuachapán department with her six children. Max is 20, Ángel is 13, José is 11, Henry is 8, David is 5, and the smallest, Alicia, is 2. Teresa is an exemplary mother in helping all of her children and giving each one of them an education. Teresa makes chocolate and distributes it to various stores in the area. Teresa is involved in each stage of making chocolate from grinding the chocolate to packing each chocolate bar. The loan Teresa is asking for is to buy raw material for her product. She is trying to expand the distribution of her chocolate to different parts of the country.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda S. is from the village of Panalsalan. She is 43 years old. Imelda is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Imelda harvests and sells ocean-caught fish in the local community. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Imelda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be Imelda's 7th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock for business.

loans.name: Dodoma Road Group

texts.en:
Zainabu is a member of the Dodoma Road in Kihesa,Iringa,she is 45 years old woman,she is widowed and a mother of 3 children,Her children are aged 27,21,15 years.

Zainabu started her own clothing business selling Vitenge,kanga(fabric) 2 years ago.she works 7 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 130,000 Tanzania shilling.

This is Zainabu`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tanzania shillings in order to buy more fabric(kanga,vitenge) for sale.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan,Zainabu hopes to save money,pay school fees,get more food for family and expand her business.

Hilda is another member of the same borrower group,she also requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more vitenge and kanga

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha is 48 years old and married with five children. Three of her children are in school. She operates a drinking stall where she sells all kinds of drinks such as soft drinks, canned malts, canned and bottled drinks etc. She has been in this business for eight years.

Agatha is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to provide for her business and to give the children a quality education. But she knows that without adequate funds it is not possible to realize that dream.

Recently she added sachet mineral water to her inventory. She wants a loan to buy assorted drinks like Coke and Pepsi products and other canned drinks to further upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy assorted drinks to upgrade her inventory.

loans.name: Martina Janett

texts.es: Martina Janet Rodríguez tiene 35 años, es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. Martina se dedica a un comedor, que está ubicado en las afueras de la ciudad y por medio de los financiamientos ha logrado proporcionarle mejoras a su local, Martina es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta trabajar ya que todas dificultades que ha tenido que atravesar le han enseñado a mejorar la administración de su negocio. Ella ofrece diferentes platillos variados en donde sus clientes escogen el que más les gusta muchos asisten a su local por es un lugar familiar. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para verduras, granos básicos, jugos, gaseosas, refrescos naturales, pollo, carnes, pescado, camarones entre otros productos. Su deseo es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda por lo que ya se acerca la temporada lluviosa.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 50 years old and married with four children. She lives in Edo State, Nigeria.  She is a farmer and has been in business for over 15 years. Victoria is requesting a loan of 30,000 NGN to purchase more seeds to plant and cultivate on her farmland. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more seeds

loans.name: Ireda Agali 3 Akao Agnes Group

texts.en:
Agnes A. is 35 years old. She is married and the mother of six children who are in school. She is also looking after her father in her home. She has been in the bakery business for over nine years. 

She is requesting the loan in order to improve upon her business by adding capital, getting an alarm for proper timing and adding more manpower for more profits. She is a courageous and hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to purchase a motorcycle for transporting her goods to shops, supermarkets and other marketplaces.

loans.use: To add capital, get an alarm for proper timing and add manpower for more profits

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en: Mrs. Jessica N. is from the town of Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old, is separated, and has only one school-aged child. Jessica owns and operates a business selling herbal products in the local community and earns Php 6,000 monthly net income from her business. In 2007, Jessica joined PMPC to gain access to its programs and services. Currently, she's obtaining her 4th loan in the amount of Php 25,000 which will be used as additional capital for her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Rubetes

texts.en:
Rubetes C. is from the village of Aurora. She is 21 years old. Rubetes is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Rubetes owns & operates a business planting & harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Rubetes has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rubetes joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rubetes is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rubetes from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. She is 49 years old and a mother of five children. She is a focused hard worker. She hopes to lift her business and family above poverty. She sells frozen foods such as turkey, chicken, and iced fish to make a living. This is the high season for sales and she hopes to make more profits. She hopes to own a butcher shop in the future. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 142,000 NGN to purchase more frozen foods to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Rosevilla

texts.en: Mrs. Rosevilla Y. is from the village of Mitacas, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. She is married and blessed with three adult children. She operates a hog-raising business. She has been engaged in her business for more than five years. She earns 5,000 Philippine pesos monthly from the said business. In 2005, Rosevilla joined PMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosevilla has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Rosevilla is requesting a new loan of 12,500 PHP, which will be used for hog raising. This will be the 11th loan taken out by Rosevilla from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for hog raising

loans.name: Meraluna

texts.en: Mrs. Meraluna L. is 37 years of age, married, and a resident of Remedios, Bonifacio, Mis. Occ. She is married to Walter L., a carpenter. They were blessed with four children. Two of the children are adults and two are now school age. Under these conditions, they had a financial crisis. For her first loan, she has the privilege of borrowing P3,000 to add to her capital for her sari-sari store to help her husband raise their family. The future income from this business will be used for the daily basic needs, savings and loan repayments. She is hoping that this business will become successful and progressive.

loans.use: Additional capital for her store

loans.name: Jose De Jesus

texts.es:
El señor José de Jesús P., tiene una propiedad de 20 manzanas de extensión ubicadas en una comunidad a unos 20 km de Condega, con diferentes tipos de aéreas para explotación de trabajo, tiene 4 manzanas que las utiliza para cultivar granos básicos (frijol y maíz), y 16 manzanas de área apta para el cuido y manejo de ganado, el se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos de consumo como cultivo de frijol y maíz,  la razón para la cual utilizara este financiamiento. Es para comprar 6 Rollos de alambres de púa para cercar bien su propiedad y pago de  mano de obra, esto como parte del mantenimiento que él da a su propiedad todos los años labor que realiza en época de verano. Este cliente todo el tiempo se ha dedicado a esta actividades de trabajo agrícolas desde la edad de 12 años en la pequeña finca de sus padres esto le ha servido de bastante experiencia en este sector agrícola, el comenzó a trabajar en su propiedad de 12 manzanas que le dieron de herencia sus padres de esa forma tubo el inicio y comenzó sembrando o cultivando granos básicos  frijol y maíz únicamente en épocas de invierno, posteriormente ha venido comprando mas terreno que hoy en día tiene 20 manzanas de extensión total ósea a comprado 8 manzanas para un total de 20 manzanas que actualmente tiene, el trabajo lo hacía con ayuda de su familia su esposa y 5 hijos quienes son mayores  de edad y le ayudaban en las actividades de trabajo en el campo a sembrar y cultivar hasta la cosecha de estos granos , actualmente sus 5 hijo ya están casados y son independientes de esta familia,  con esta inversión que realizara en su finca  el espera ir mejorando su propiedad como lo es en este caso asegurar el perímetro de su finca y de esa manera evitar que el ganado que él tiene no se salga de su propiedad y también tenerlo más seguro y evitar el secuestro de estos ya que en la actualidad con la crisis económica este tipo de delito ha venido aumentando por lo que hay algunos personas como este cliente que tiene la necesidad de asegurar mas su propiedad y la ves hacer divisiones internas para manejar mejor su ganado,  de esta forma el espera  garantizar su única forma de trabajo ejemplo, en tiempos de cosecha al no estar bien cercados sus áreas de cultivos esta propenso a que el ganado se meta donde está sembrado de granos y cause daños que le afectarían en la  cosecha de estos granos, por esa razón el ahorita que es verano aprovecha para hacer este tipo de reparaciones y mejoras en su finca. Esto le ayudara a mejorar en su actividad de trabajo permitiéndole garantizar mas sus cultivos y una vez que sale la cosecha obtendrá de una forma más seguro  sus ingresos provenientes de la cosecha. Don José de Jesús P., ha tenido 9 créditos  desde el año 2005 lleva 5 años de trabajar con Ceprodel.
El impacto y beneficios que ha tenido con los financiamientos  es bastante importante, porque este señor en épocas de verano es cuando realiza las mejoras de su finca y con esta ayuda que se le ha venido dando año con año le han permitido mejorar su propiedad o finca y a la vez sus actividad de trabajo lo que le han dado como resultado tener e ir mejorando su nivel de vida teniendo mejores ingresos y mejores condiciones  en su hogar para vivir él y su familia.
texts.en:
José de Jesús P. owns a large property comparable in size to 20 city blocks in a community about 20km from Condega. Within the property there are designated areas for different types of work. There are four blocks used to cultivate basic grains like beans and corn and 16 blocks suited for the raising and herding of livestock. He dedicates his time to growing basic grains like beans and corn, work for which Mr. P. is using this loan. The loan requested is to buy six rolls of barbed wire to surround his property and pay for the labor. Year after year, he enlists help during the summer to maintain his property. Since he was 12 years old, Mr. P. has dedicated his life to agricultural work. Working on his parents' small farm gave him a lot of experience in agriculture. He inherited a property the size of 12 city blocks from his parents, which gave him his start. He began planting and cultivating basic grains like beans and corn during the winter months. Later, he bought more property so he now has 20 blocks worth, or rather, he bought 8 blocks worth of property for a total of 20 that he currently has. Mr. P. worked with the help of his family: his wive and his five children who are already grown. They helped him working in the field planting and cultivating until harvesting grains. Currently his five sons are already married and living independently with their families. With this investment he will realize in his farm, Mr. P. hopes to continue improving his property by securing the perimeter of his farm. Doing so will prevent livestock from leaving his property and allow him to keep them safe and avoid their kidnapping, a crime that has increased during this current economic crisis. Because of these problems, many people--Mr. P. among them--feel the need to enclose his property to improve its security and to make internal divisions to manage his livestock better. By doing this, Mr. P. hopes to guarantee his only form of work. For example, when the agriculture is not well enclosed within its specific areas, the livestock are able to enter and cause damages that negatively affect the grains' harvest. Mr. P. is taking advantage of it being summer to make these necessary improvements to his farm. It will allow him to improve in his work, which in turn will allow him to ensure larger harvests and a more secure means of obtaining revenue. Mr. José de Jesús P. has had nine loans in the five years he has worked with Ceprodel. The impact and benefit of these loans are very important, because Mr. P. is able to make improvements to his farm during the summertime. The help he has received year after has allowed him to improve his farm and at the same time his work, which has allowed him to continue improving his quality of life with higher income and better living conditions for him and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying six rolls of barbed wire and paying for labor

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana N. is from the village of  Quezon Bukidnon. She is 59 years old, widowed and has 9 adult-aged children.  To make a living, Feliciana runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop in the local community.  Feliciana has been in business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Feliciana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Feliciana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI to purchase additional products to sell.  Feliciana is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to expand her business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Feliciana from HSPFI.
=======================================
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Expand the business

loans.name: Sinikagni Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe Sinikagni sont  des  femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kapaga, Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali).
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur troisième  prêt solidaire, après avoir remboursés sans difficulté  les deux prêts précédents. 
Elles font  essentiellement la  transformation des noix de karité en beurre qu’elle vendent au consommateurs et revendeurs.
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter chacune, 150kg de noix de karité (pour les transformer en beurre de karité). 
Elles s’approvisionnent dans les villages avoisinants et effectuent leurs ventes, après transformation, à Zéguoa et à Kadiolo ville,  au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 15.250FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The five members of Sinikagni Group are married women who, on average, are 38 years old and have two children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Kapaga in Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet their customers' needs. This is their third solidarity loan. They repaid their previous two loans without difficulty. Their main activity is producing butter from shea nuts and selling it to consumers and retailers. They will use their new loan to buy each 150 kilograms of shea nuts and transform them into shea butter. They get their supplies in the nearby villages and sell their final product in the cities of Zégoua and Kadiolo for cash to a clientele made up of men and women. They expect to make an average monthly profit of 15,250 CFA francs each, of which part will go into savings and meeting family needs, and the remainder will be reinvested in the business activities.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shea nuts

loans.name: Saren

texts.en:
Mrs. Saren C. (pictured with her husband) and her husband, Mr. Chen Sot, have been married since 2005 and have three children: two daughters and a little son. They are living in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Saren has been a silk weaver for more than 15 years. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. She is applying for her second loan of $200 to add to her own money to purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To add to her own money to buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Félix tiene 41 años, es un hombre luchador y entusiasta, su principal objetivo es salir adelante. Convive con Nancy de 37 años y ambos tienen 7 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con 4 de ellos en su vivienda propia. Desde hace 16 años que se dedica a la siembra de Papa,  arveja y verduras, en terrenos arrendados. Con ayuda de sus hijos y de su esposa, caminan 3 kilómetros diariamente para cuidar sus cultivos, de esa manera aseguraría tener una mejor productividad. Las labores agrícolas para él son fáciles pues está acostumbrado a trabajos pesados, sin embargo le resulta complicado trasladar sus cosechas hacia los mercados de su ciudad, para comercializarlos a los mayoristas, quienes ya conocen la calidad de sus productos. Por el bienestar de su familia, espera comprar mas adelante sus propios terrenos para cultivo, además anhela construir otra vivienda más cerca de la ciudad e instalar un negocio de venta de verduras y tubérculos. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su grupo comunal, puesto que se siente comprometido con la labor que desempeñan sus compañeros. Con los dos mil soles que solicita, comprará dos bolsas de semillas de arveja y un saco de fertilizante.
texts.en:
Félix, 41, is an enthusiastic, hard-working man; his main goal is to succeed in life. He lives with Nancy, 37. They have 7 children but only four still live at home with them. For the last 16 years he has farmed potato, pea and vegetables on leased farmlands. With his wife and children’s help, they walk 3 kilometers daily to tend to their crops assuring a better harvest. Farm work is easy for him because he is accustomed to hard, physical labor. However, it is complicated to transport his crops to market in the city for sale to wholesalers who know the good quality of his products. For the good of his family, he hopes eventually to purchase his own farmlands; he also hopes to build a home closer to the city and set up his own vegetable and tuber sales business. This is his 5th loan with MFP. He enjoys working with his communal group because he feels committed to the work his fellow group members do. He will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy two sacks of pea seed and one sack of fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pea seed and fertilizers.

loans.name: Pablo Jose

texts.es:
El Señor PABLO JOSE M., Labora como Vigilante en el Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez de Managua.
 El  tiene tres hijos a su cargo, y estos se  encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado tres créditos con CEPRODEL durante tres años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 3 créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Cemento, piso y arena para su casa de habitacion.
Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
El Señor PABLO JOSE M., Labora como Vigilante en el Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez de Managua. El tiene tres hijos a su cargo, y estos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado tres créditos con CEPRODEL durante tres años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 3 créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL, el es un cliente excelente. El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Cemento, piso y arena para su casa de habitacion. Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: MEJORAS DE VIVIENDA Y AMPLIACION

loans.name: Maria Calixta

texts.es: La Señora María Calixta 53 años, pues esta no es la primera vez que realiza un financiamiento para su negocio. Pues es una excelente cliente dedicada a este negocio desde 36 años, pues inicio desde muy joven, ya que sus padres no tenían la posibilidad de proporcionarles estudios así fue que ella empezó vendiendo frijoles cocidos, pues la mayoría de sus vecinos recurrían a su vivienda en busca de este productos y con el paso del tiempo logro vender también leña pues ambas cosas se utilizan en vivir diario.
