Es así que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de frijoles ya que por quintal le resulta mucho más favorable, leña. Su deseo es mantener esta actividad que es su único medio de vida.
texts.en:
This is not the first time that María Calixta, 53, has taken out a loan for her business. She is an excellent client who has been dedicated to her business for 36 years, as she started when she was very young. Since her parents were unable to provide her with an education, she started selling cooked beans. Most of her neighbors come to her house looking for this product. Over time she also started selling firewood, since both of these products are used in daily living. Thus, she requests a loan to buy beans in bulk, since this is much cheaper, and firewood. Her desire is to continue with this activity, since it is her only means of support.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy beans and firewood

loans.name: Arleen

texts.en:
Arleen Q. is from the village of Inawa-an, Batangan, Valencia City. She is 38 years old. Arleen is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Arleen owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling food and daily use products in the local community. Arleen has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Arleen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arleen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Arleen is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Arleen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Juan Vicente

texts.es:
El señor Juan Vicente P. R. Díaz vive en la compañía Almada.
El señor Juan Vicente es una buena persona y muy trabajador. Elabora sus artesanías con flores artificiales con su familia en su domicilio, luego viaja al interior para realizar sus ventas, esta actividad lo realiza desde hace 10 años. 

La profesión lo adquirió de sus padres y luego fue juntando un poco de capital para independizarse de sus padres, gracias al buen trato con sus clientes, ahora tiene su clientela formada y  el negocio va creciendo contantemente.  

Solicita el crédito para la compra de flores artificiales para elaborar sus productos y también para la reventa de flores, ya  que en la zona muchas familias tienen su mismo rubro. Don Juan agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo obtenido para su actividad  y mediante ello va generando nuevos ingresos a su unidad familiar.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Vicente R. D. lives in Almada. Mr. Juan Vicente is a good person and very hard-working. He and his family make handicrafts at home using artificial flowers, and then later goes into the interior of the country to sell. He's been doing this for 10 years. This profession was passed down from his parents, and Juan was later able to save a little capital to strike out on his own. Thanks to the good relationship he has with his customers, he now has an established clientele and his business continues growing. He is asking for the loan to buy artificial flowers to make his wares and also for resale, since many families in the area are in the same line of work. Mr. D. thanks the Fundación Paraguaya for the support he has obtained for his business, through which he continues generating more income for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Powell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flowers and raw materials for his business

loans.name: Juana Doribel

texts.es: Juana Doribel tiene 47 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Hace más de 2 años que tiene este negocio, ubicada en su vivienda pues con mucha ayuda de su esposo y empeño propio ha progresado, ella ha obtenido muchas experiencias y todas le han enseñado cosas muy importantes. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como golosinas, detergentes, granos básicos, refrescos y jugos.
texts.en:
Juana Doribel is 47 years old and works in a grocery store. It has been more than two years since she has been working in this business which is located in her home. With her husband's help and her own determination she has been able to progress.Through many experiences she has gained much knowledge. The loan is for the purchase of goods such as sweets, detergents, basic grains, sodas, and juices.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of goods such as sweets, detergents, basic grains, sodas, and juices.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel G. is from the village of Carikkikan Norte. She is 34 years old. Raquel is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Raquel owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Raquel has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Raquel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Raquel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Raquel is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Raquel from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita P. is a married woman who lives in Kampendoy, Barangay Sillon, Bantayan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures: food vending, pig fattening and sewing sack bags businesses. Her husband Renerio P. Sr, who is 49 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 5 children who are 17 to 28 years old. 

Teresita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 cycle loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Teresita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 15th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 which she intends to use as an additional working capital so that she could continue to save up for their future and to provide her children with good education. Teresita P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital.

loans.name: Marvin Jose

texts.es:
Don Marvin de edad de 45 años, es un hombre trabajador, dedicado al comercio desde hace varios años, una pulpería en donde vende una variedad de productos, comenzando con poco y que ha venido creciendo gracias al esfuerzo y apoyo de Afodenic.
Pues lleva once ciclos en donde ha logrado mantener el equilibrio de su negocio como las mejoras a su vivienda.
Lo que quiere hacer es un cuarto,  ya que sus hijos son tres, y el cuarto que tienen están ya muy incomodo, la solución es poder construir otro al fondo del solar.
Comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, hierro, cemento, zinc logrando así hacer su construcción.
texts.en:
Marvin, 45, is a hardworking man who has been a merchant for a number of years. He has a grocery store where he sells a variety of products. Starting out with little, he has managed to grow thanks to his efforts and the support of AFODENIC. He has participated in 11 loan cycles where he has managed to keep his business going and make improvements to his house. What he wants to do is add a room, since he has 3 children, and the room that they have is very uncomfortable. The solution is to build another at the back of the lot. He will buy construction materials such as: stone, sand, iron, cement, and corrugated metal roofing sheets to use in the construction project.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as: stone, sand, cement, iron, corrugated metal roofing sheets, and other supplies to build a room at the back of his lot

loans.name: Alina

texts.es: Alina, de 30 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en casa de su mamá junto a su esposo Diego de 24 años y sus dos queridos hijos Sarai de 6 y Cristopher de 2 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. En los verdes campos del poblado de Huaracayo (Distrito de la provincia de Tarma), Alina tiene sus cultivos de papa y arveja, todas las mañanas sin importarle las condiciones del clima sale a trabajar sus tierras, ya que es la única fuente de ingresos para su familia. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 15 años de experiencia y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de la plaga de insectos. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es el primer crédito con MFP y esta ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su grupo comunal, donde se siente muy contenta. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más fertilizantes para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Alina, a very sincere and industrious woman of 30 years old, lives in her mother’s house with her husband, Diego of 24 years and their two beloved children, Sarai of 6 years and Cristopher, aged 2. The children are their reason for being. In the green fields of the town of Huaracay (District of the Tarma Province), Alina works her potato and pea plots every morning irrespective of the day’s weather. Alina provides the family with its only source of income. Alina loves tilling the land and has been doing so for 15 years. Alina believes that protecting crops from insect infestation is the hardest part of the job. As time goes on, she would like to purchase more land in order to increase production. This is Alina’a first loan with MFP and she is saving in order to be able to make timely repayments, as she does not want to cause problems for the communal group of which she feels very happy to be a part. With the loan amount of 1000 nuevos soles (Peruvian Soles), Alina plans to buy more fertilisers.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilisers for crops.

loans.name: Theng

texts.en:
Mrs. S. (her husband is pictured) is 26 and currently lives with other family members in the province of Kompong Chhnang. She is a domestic farmer and also arranges a daily routine, including cooking and caring for kids. 

S. also relies on the income from her husband who has been operating an animal trade in the village. He always travels to buy cows from rural people and he then fattens the cows for a while before selling them to raise a profit. 

This couple attempts to work for money in order to support their two kids who are in primary school. Mrs. S. sees that the animal sale business is a profitable one and she wants to sustain its growth, this is why she requested a loan from Kiva. She will provide this loan to her husband for use as capital to buy animals to resell.

loans.use: To buy animals to resell.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn T. is from the village of Sepac, Sapang Dalaga. She is 35 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business supplying retail electronic load. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $63 a month for these activities.

In 2006, Marlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. 

Marlyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for the business. This will be her 9th loan from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for e-load sales

location.town: Calamba-Sapang Ama Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina M. is from the village of Brgy. Uddiawan, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 59 years old, married and has 4 adult children. Florentina owns & operates a general store where she sells daily-use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste. She has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Florentina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yan's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of four members, all of whom reside in Kbal Kaoh village, Kandal province. Each member of the group would like to use a portion of the loan to support his or her own business.

Mrs. Yan P. is the 48-year-old leader of the group. To earn a living, Yan works as a farmer. She owns a plot of land, where she cultivates vegetables. She explains that she is a widow and that she works very hard to support her two children. Both of her children attend the local school. Yan does not have enough money to support her vegetables. Thus, she is seeking a portion of this group loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and a hose to better cultivate vegetables.

loans.use: To improve her farming operation by purchasing fertilizers, pesticides, and a hose

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda R. is from the village of Unidos Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old. Glenda is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Glenda owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Glenda has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Glenda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Glenda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Glenda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Jenaro

texts.en: Jenaro N., age 29, operates a motorcycle transport business, popularly known as bodaboda business in Kenya. He has a hand cart for goods and a motorbike to transport people from one place to another. He operates from Kahawa West, a highly populated area. Jenaro was working as a houseboy before he started his transport business, buying his first bicycle with the savings from his houseboy job. He saved more until he could afford to buy a motorcycle. He is married to Beatrice Muthoni, who is a dairy farmer, and together they have three children named M., Wambui and Jimfred, ages seven, four and two years old respectively. The transport business has been in operation for three years and Jenaro's monthly income is 7,100 Kenyan shillings (KES). Jenaro was introduced to KADET by existing clients. This is his first loan. With this loan he intends to finish paying for his motorbike which has a balance of 15,000 KES and use the remaining balance of 5,000 KES to buy animal feed to increase milk production in his wife’s farming business. Jenaro hopes to own a taxi and eventually build a home. He did not go beyond primary school in his education and he wants to provide quality education for his children.

loans.use: To finish motorbike payments and buy animal feed

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Leonor es una madre de familia de 35 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito de Chepén, una zona agrícola de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir para todo público. Ella tiene un puesto de venta en uno de los mercados centrales del distrito y también las vende por pedidos durante la semana. Su negocio tiene bastante acogida ya que ella lleva trabajando bastante tiempo en esta actividad y es conocida en el rubro. Los ingresos que percibe de este negocio los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo, que es estibador, con los gastos económicos familiares.

Leonor es una mujer que tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante. Actualmente desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más prendas de vestir, de modo que pueda aumentar sus ingresos y ayudar aun más a su familia. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Leonor is a mother, she is 35 years old and she lives together with her husband and their children in the district of Chepen, an agricultural region which is highly commercialized given its location in La Libertad. It is located more than one hour from the city of Chiclayo. 

She sells items of clothing to the general public. She has a stand in one of the central markets in the district and she also sells during the week by taking orders. Her business counts on a solid client base because she has had a long time in the business and she is well known. The income that she earns is used to contribute with her husband, a fork lift operator, towards the family’s finances. 

Leonor is someone with a great will to come out ahead. She wishes to expand her business with the purchase of more items of clothing. She will be able to increase her profits and she will be able to help her family even more. In order to meat her goal she has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan in the amount of 1000 soles.

loans.use: To purchase items of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna J. is from the village of Brgy. Homestead, Bambang,Nueva Vizcaya. She is 57 years old. Myrna is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Myrna owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Myrna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Myrna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mayuri

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Maryuri, ella tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 15 y 9 años  edad de los mismos que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una compañía.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y productos de Esika (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta y a también vende en su casa. Trabaja todos los días unas tres horas por dia, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a   Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite.

Este crédito es para comprar la  ropa más que todo ropa de mujer, pantalones, blusas, cremas, perfumes y  otros productos. Ella es socia del Banco Comunal ya por 32 ciclos y le gusta porque fue con uno de estos créditos que pudo iniciar su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank "Crucita" meet in the parish of Crucita in the Portoviejo canton. This town is known for the beautiful beaches that surround this lovely place, and that are visited by many national and international tourists. It is known as Crucita The Beautiful.
Here we met Maryuri. She is 46 years old, married, and has two children who are 15 and 9 and who are at high school and grade school. Her husband works for a company. 
She sells clothes of all sorts and products from the company Esika (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women's accessories). She sells door to door and from her home. She works every day for three hours. She offers her clients credit and collects every 15 days. She goes to Guayaquil to buy her merchandise every couple of weeks or monthly, depending on what she needs.
This loan is for buying more clothes, particularly women's clothes, pants, blouses, creams, perfumes, and other products. She has been a member of the community bank for 32 loan cycles and she likes it because she was able to start her business with these loans. Her dream is to be successful with her business.

loans.use: To buy women's clothes, pants, creams, perfumes, etc

loans.name: Rosa Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos, se reúne cada quince días  El Banco Comunal Quiroga.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Rosa, es madre soltera de tres hijos uno ya es mayor de edad y dos de 9 y8  años que estudian en escuela. Ella vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva 9 años en  el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos a podido sacar a sus hijos adelante nos cuenta que el bankito es lo mejor.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local, nos cuenta que  le realizan pedidos sus clientes. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta las 11am ya que luego  tiene que ir a su casa a ayudar a sus hijos en las tareas escolares, ella  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la manda a traer desde  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite.

Este crédito es para comprar la  ropa más que todo ropa de mujer, pantalones, blusas, interiores, entre otras prendas. Sus sueños son poder darle lo mejor  a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Quiroga Community Bank gets together every other week in the Quiroga district of the city of Calceta. Most of the people in this area work in agriculture, raising animals, and selling their products.

Here we met Mrs. Rosa. She is a single mother with three children. One is an adult and the other two are 9 and 8 years old and attend school. She lives in her parents' house. She has been with her community bank for 9 years and she likes it because thanks to the loans she has been able to help her children get ahead and she tells us that the little bank is the best.

She works selling all types of clothing and she sells it door to door. She also sells out of her home where she has a small store. She shares that her customers make requests. She works every day from 8 am until 11 am and later has to return to her home to help her children with their school work. She sells to her customers on credit and collects from them every 2 weeks. She orders merchandise from Guayaquil every 2 weeks or every month according to her needs.

This loan is to buy more clothing, especially women's clothing like pants, blouses, underwear, and other articles. She dreams of giving her children the best of everything.

loans.use: To buy women's clothing: pants, blouses, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Ben Ochieng

texts.en:
Ben has operated his motorcycle business in Naivasha town for the past two years. He is 27 years old and is married to Pauline Shirago. They have two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan. He paid his first loan of Kshs 15,000 well and in good time. He plans to use the loan to set up a shop from where he will be selling eggs.

The anticipated income will be ploughed back into the business. In the future he wants to grow his business and to have a stable source of income.

loans.use: To set up a shop to sell eggs.

loans.name: Mañanitas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Mañanitas está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras, joviales, risueñas y con mucho deseo de auto superarse  una de ellas es la señora Walkiria F. de 41 años inicio su negocio hace ocho años con un pequeño canasto de truchas como prensapelos, pirañas, colas, pulseras, aros etc. en la actualidad ella comercializa adornos, juguetes, relojes, retrateras entre otros productos.
 Ella tiene cinco hijos de 22, 21, 19, 17 y 15 años quienes le ayudan en el negocio. F. con el crédito piensa aumentar su negocio y poner una fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en comida frita.
Las otras integrantes son Darling de los Ángeles L. Carranza quien se dedica al comercio de calzado desde hace 8 años y Gloria de los Ángeles Gonzales Osorio se dedica al comercio de ropa y calzado..
texts.en:
The Mañanitas group consists of three hard-working, cheerful, smiling people, who have a strong desire to achieve.  One of these is Mrs. Walkiria F., 41 years old, who started her business eight years ago with a small basket of articles such as hair clips, combs, bracelets, earrings, etc.  At present she sells ornaments, toys, watches, picture frames, and other goods.
She has five children, 22, 21, 19, 17, and 15 years old, who help with her business.  With the loan, F. plans to expand her business and set up a “fritanga,” or casual restaurant offering fried food.
The other members are Darling de los Ángeles L. Carranza (who has been in the shoe business for 8 years), and Gloria de los Ángeles Gonzales Osorio, who is in the clothing and shoe business.

loans.use: For products and to set up a fried-foods restaurant

loans.name: Daysi Elizabeth

texts.es:
Daysi de 27 años, es una joven emprendedora que tiene un salón de belleza, donde hace cortes de cabello, peinados, tinturados etc. Trabaja desde las 08h30am hasta las 20h30pm en su salón de belleza. 

Desde muy joven ella trabajo haciendo cortes de cabello y peinados por eso decidió que su actividad principal de generar ingresos era tener un salón de belleza. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo productos de belleza, herramientas para su negocio. En el futuro quiere incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Daysi is 27 years old and she is a young enterprising woman who owns a beauty salon. She offers hair cuts, hair styling, dying, etc.  She works from 8:30am to 10:30pm in her beauty salon.

Since she was very young she has been providing hair cuts and hair styling services, which is why she decided to make this her primary income generating business. She has great aspirations for her business which is why she would like to purchase beauty products and styling tools with her loan. In the future she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products

loans.name: Flordelez

texts.en: Flordelez A.'s main source of income comes from providing pedicure and manicure services to local community members. She is 43 years old, separated from her spouse and has three grown-up children. She is from the village of Tayong, Sagay, Camiguin Province. Flordelez has been in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Flordelez joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Flordelez has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase materials needed to provide her service. Flordelez is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase supplies like nail polish and cuticle remover. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase supplies needed for her service like nail polish and cuticle remover.

loans.name: Nuevo Arco Iris Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVO ARCO IRIS” iniciará su quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Tejada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Hilda. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de ropa , fabricación de colchones, compra de mercadería, compra de repuestos, tejido en lana, venta de tostado, venta de peluches.

La señora Hilda, indica que hace once años que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de libros, el que inicio por intermedio de su hermana mayor que tiene el mismo negocio, lo viene realizando hace nueve años atrás.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de libros: libros, fábulas, obras, cuentos para pintar, los que comprará del Desaguadero y también por mayor de las galerías de la Ceja y otros que le dejan en el puesto. Posteriormente los venderá en la calle Tiwanacu (calle comercial de la ciudad de El Alto) todos los días, desde las 15:00 a 21:00. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en salud y negocios.
texts.en:
The “NUEVO ARCO IRIS” (New Rainbow) communal bank will start its fifth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Tejada Center.  It has 8 members and is led by a governing board headed by Hilda.  The communal bank’s members carry out a variety of businesses such as: clothing sales, mattress manufacturing, merchandise purchases, replacement parts purchases, wool weaving, snack sales and stuffed toy sales.

Hilda indicates that she’s been working with Pro Mujer for 11 years having joined thanks to an invitation from a friend.  She currently has a business selling books that she started thanks to her older sister who is in the same business.  She’s been in business for nine years.

The loan she’s taking out now will be used to buy books:  books, fables, coloring books, that she’ll buy in Desaguadero and also at wholesale in large stores in La Ceja as well as others that are delivered to her stand.  She then will sell them on Tiwanacu Street (El Alto’s commercial street) every day from 3-9pm.  This way of working allows her to generate income to help her family in whatever way possible because she lives in an unmarried relationship state and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the training, the health services and business.

loans.use: to buy books.

loans.name: Claudia Liliana

texts.es:
La tradicional arepa se convirtió en el negocio de Claudia Liliana R. de 37 años, quien con unos ahorros, la ilusión de salir adelante con su esposo y su hija, sus manos y dos hornos que les prestaron le dio vida a Rikarepa, un negocio familiar en el que trabaja ella su esposo y además genera empleo a dos mujeres cabeza de familia. 

La ilusión de progrsar, brindarle una buena educación a su hija y mejorar su calidad de vida son el motor que día a día impulsa a Claudia a trabajar desde las 3:00 de la mañana, hora en la que se levanta para empezar las labores propias del negocio. 

Actualmente Claudia está atravesando por una dificultad, pues uno de sus hornos se dañó y requiere ser reparado para que siga funcionando y puedan continuar respondiendo a sus clientes. 

En el futuro esta emprendedora espera ampliar su negocio, comprar más hornos, generar empleo y comprar un carro que le permita distribuir sus arepas a diferentes municipios del suroesteste de Antioquia.
texts.en:
The traditional 'arepa' (cornmeal roll) turned into a business for 37 year-old Claudia Liliana R..  With some savings, the desire to get ahead in life together with her husband and daughter, her two hands and two ovens that somebody loaned her, she started Rikarepa, a family business in which both she and her husband work.  In addition, they provide work to two women who are heads of their respective families.

The desire to make progress, provide her daughter with a good education and improve her quality of life are the driving forces which compel Claudia to start work at 3 o'clock in the morning.  This is the time that she gets up in order to start her work.

Claudia is currently having a difficult time because one of her ovens became damaged and needs to be fixed so that it can continue working and so that she can continue responding to her customers.

In the future, this entrepreneur hopes to expand her business, buy more ovens, create more jobs and buy a car which will allow her to distribute her arepas to different towns in the south-west of Antioquia.

loans.use: to fix her oven

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 47 years old and married with 4 children, 3 of whom attend school. Jesusa works very hard to provide for her family.

Jesusa has operated a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as t-shirts, pants, blouses, curtains etc. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell. In the future, Jesusa would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

loans.name: Hacia Adelante 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Glenny is one of the members of the group Hacia adelante 1, 2 & 3 (Going Forward). She makes her home in a simple structure with her parents. She operates a business where she sells underwear, both in her house and by walking. She is a young hardworking woman just 26 years old, whose challenges are to do business, get a good income and to start studying in the university.

Glenny is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for almost one year, which she started with her first Esperanza loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing  a big quantity of underwear at wholesale prices. 

Her group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and the sugar cane industry. The main economic activities are a free trade zone and a cement factory. Their community is a tourist area outside San Pedro and Santo Domingo, which makes this community very active. There are a lot of businesses and people working in the street. Also, this town is close to the main airport of the Dominican Republic.

loans.use: to buy underwear at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Ngueyenne Group

texts.fr:
Ce Banc Villageois a été inauguré le 31 mai 2011. Il est composé de 41 femmes qui habitent le même village. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame GORY est présidente du Banc Villageois (elle assise sur une chaise à gauche de la photo levant la main). Elle est âgée de 45 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle a aussi en charge un autre enfant qui lui est confié par son frère.

Elle s’active dans la vente de poisson frais et de beignets. 

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital afin de mieux développer son activité de vente de poisson.

Son objectif est de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This "Banc Villageois" was launched on May 31, 2011. It is made up of 41 women who live in the same village. Their main business is sales.

Madame Gory is president of the "Banc Villageois" (she is seated on the left, raising her hand). She is 45 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She also supports another child for her brother.

She does business selling fresh fish and beignets.

This loan will allow her to increase her working capital to expand her fish-selling business.

Her goal is to help with the improvement of her family's living conditions (health, diet, clothing, etc.) and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish and flour to make beignets.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling used clothing in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional used clothes to sell for her used clothing business.

Fe has been in this business for seven years. Fe earns more income from her general store.

Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is married, with one 14-year-old child. She has been doing mixed farming for the last 13 years in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya. Her farm produces cabbages, potatoes, french beans, and tea. Josephine fully relies on farming for her family's upkeep.

Josphine has requested a loan of 35,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds as her new venture. She says this venture will help her pay the school fees for her child's education and improve the family's standard of living. She also intends to start a cereals retail business to supplement her farming income.

Josphine is, however, alarmed by consistent crop failures in recent years and sees this as a threat to her farming business.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. She has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages and snacks. She has had this business for 3 years. 

She requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy more canned goods, beverages and snacks to sell. Dioscora has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks to sell.

loans.name: 5 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs Ngọc operates a food stall selling vegetables. She is requesting a loan to purchase more vegetables for resale.

Ngọc is 52 years old and married with two children. She is the group leader of the 8.5 Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of four members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

In 2008, Ngọc joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Ngọc has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for five years.

The main hardship that Ngọc faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Ngọc hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Kuña Rory Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo gracias a una D. las miembros. Ella se motivo en la idea D. producir un bien para sus compañeras, dando la una visión D. que a través del comité estarían alcanzando un  nuevo progreso a cada una. Encantadas aceptaron formar el comité al que denominaron Kuña Rory. Actualmente el grupo cuenta con doce integrantes. Todas tienen la esperanza D. seguir luchando por salir adelante, buscando el progreso D. cada una D. ellas y la D. su comunidad.
La señora Juliana es vendedora D. todo tipo D. artículos, como ser frazadas, sabanas, ropas y demás. Por medio D. este trabajo ella ha podido salir adelante y generar un poco más D. ingresos, con lo cual pueD. ayudar con los gastos D. la casa. Uno D. sus Sueños es poder tener una tienda donD. pueda estar ofreciendo constantemente sus mercaderías.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. sabanas, edredones, ropas y demás para la posterior venta. Por medio D. esto ella podrá abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda D. sus clientes.
texts.en:
This committee formed thanks to one of its members. She was motivated by the idea of creating something good for her team members, giving her a vision that through this committee each of them might achieve a new step forward. Delighted, they agreed to form the committee with the name Kuna Rory. Currently the group has 12 members. All have the hope of continuing the fight to get ahead, looking for progress for each one of them and for the community. 

Juliana is a saleswoman for all sorts of items, like blankets, sheets, clothes and more. Through this work she has been able to come out ahead and to generate a little more income, which helps with the household expenses. One of her dreams is to be able to have a store where she can sell her merchandise all the time. She is requesting a loan to buy sheets, quilts, clothes and the like for resale. With this she can stock up and fill her customers orders.

loans.use: to buy blankets, sheets, quilts and other items for resale.

loans.name: Ruzigul

texts.ru: Рузигул вдова. Ей 51 год. Она проживает в районе Дангара. У нее четверо детей. Двое ее детей студенты. Ее младший сын учится в школе, а старший живет отдельно и занимается своим бизнесом. Сама Рузигул занимается шитьем. Этим видом деятельности занимается пять лет. Она берет кредит для покупки тканей, чтобы сшить платья для продажи.
texts.en: Ruzigul is 51 years old, a widow and has four children.  She lives in the Dangara district.  Two of her sons are students.  Her youngest son attends school, and the oldest lives separately and has his own business.  Ruzigul is involved in sewing and has been in this business for five years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of fabrics in order to make dresses for sale.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 52 years old and is married to Alfredo who is village farmer. She has worked in her own store for 10 years and is able to earn about P2,000 a month. She uses her income to buy feed and some goes on household expenses.

Perla sells different kinds of daily-use products, cosmetics, ingredients and groceries. She acquires her groceries at the market of Maddela because she gets the best price there. She would like to ask for an additional amount of P25,000 to buy stock such as sugar, oils, milk, snack foods, canned goods, instant noodles, shampoo, detergent soap and assorted biscuits for her general store. In this way, she'll be able to meet costumer demand and increase her income. She is hoping to improve their standard of living through the income she gets from her retail shop and hog raising business.

loans.use: to buy stock for her general store

loans.name: Jesus Mario

texts.es: El sr. Jesús  nació en el departamentos  de  Chuquisaca, convive  con la Sra. Olga ella es ama de casa.  El se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz, yuca, maní y sandia .su domicilio esta ubicado en Betanzos a 32km de limoncito el Torno,  también cuenta con una parcela en Guapurucito al sur de Betanzos a 22 km, el destino del crédito es para mantenimiento de sus plantaciones de  sandia también para la siembra de maíz y yuca y todo lo que implica el preparado de la tierra. Todo lo que siembra lo vende directo al consumidor en el mercado el Torno.se siente muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo que le ha brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Jesús was born in the Department of Chuquisaca. He lives with Sra. Olga, who is a homemaker. Jesús is a farmer who grows corn, cassava, peanuts, and watermelons. His home is located in Betanzos, which is 32 km away from Limoncito in El Torno. Jesús also has a parcel of land in Guapurucito, which is 22 km to the south of Betanzos.

This loan will be used to maintain his watermelon crops, as well as for planting corn and cassava and everything that is required for preparing the land. All of his crops are sold directly to the consumer at the market in El Torno. Jesús is very grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for maintaining his watermelon and corn crops.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en: Liezel is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Liezel provides multipurpose van services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 5 years. Liezel has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for gasoline to maintain the van. Liezel is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and gasoline to maintain the van

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
To make a living, Josie has operated a food-production business, where she sells street food in the village, for more than two years. She earns 300 Philippines pesos (PHP) each day in the business, which is being rolled into revolving capital to maintain the business. She is 45 years old and is married with three children. 

To expand her business, Josie wants to borrow PHP 5,000 to purchase raw ingredients needed in her food-production business.

Josie hopes to further grow her business and to increase her income, which will secure her family's future and the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed in her food production business.

loans.name: Juliri

texts.en:
Juliri is 39 years old and lives in the town of Tororo in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past six years, Juliri has been working hard to manage her clothes shop, which sells dresses and men's suits. 

To help expand her business, Juliri has requested a loan of 1,600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes, and will help Juliri to generate greater profits and get a contract to build a house. Juliri hopes that in the future she will be able to educate her children up to university level. 

Juliri is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Juliri who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes

loans.name: Luciana Fredesvinda

texts.es:
Luciana de 46 años, Con la ayuda de Dios Logro establecer una papelería en su casa la cual ya lleva trabajando 15 años.

Sus hijos le ayudan a trabajar todos los días de 7am hasta las 10pm. Gracias a dios no ha presentado ningún problema. Es madre soltera que saca adelante a sus dos hijas (14 y 24 años) que están estudiando.

Con el prestamo quiere comprar cuadernos, plumas etc. La meta que desea alcanzar es poder incrementar mas su negocio y vivir tranquilamente con sus dos hijas.
texts.en:
Luciana, 46, with God's help managed to set up a stationery store in her house.  She has been doing this work for 15 years.

Her children help her work every day from 7 a.m. until 10 p.m.  Thanks to God the store hasn't presented any problems.  She is a single mother who gets her two daughters ahead; they are 14 and 24 years old, and they are students.

With the loan she wants to buy notebooks, pens, etc.  The goal she wants to reach is to be able to increase her business more and live peacefully with her two daughters.

loans.use: to buy notebooks and pens.

loans.name: Moustapha

texts.fr: Monsieur Moustapha  habite au Sénégal. C’est un jeune divorcé  de 28 ans qui est père d’un garçon de 10 mois et d’une fille qui vivent sous sa charge. Il s’active dans le secteur  tertiaire  de  la prestation de services  depuis 2009. Ce qui l’intéresse  le plus c’est l’informatique qu’il pratique et le Relation ship  qui découle de son contact avec la clientèle. Il est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis juin 2011. Il sollicite un crédit de 200000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’une imprimante qui lui permettra  de renforcer son chiffre d’affaire et d’assurer une bonne rentabilité de ses investissements. Son objectif final est d’élargir son marché et arriver à s’autofinancer.
texts.en:
Mr. Mustafa lives in Senegal. He is a young 28-year-old divorced father of a 10-month-old boy and a girl, both living under his care.

Since 2009 he has been active in the third sector providing services. What interests him most is working with computers and developing relations though his contacts with customers. He has been a member of one of the U-IMCEC branches since June 2011.

He is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs he will use to purchase a printer. This will enable him to increase his turnover and ensure a good return on investment. His ultimate goal is to expand his customer base and reach a state of self-financing.

loans.use: buy a printer

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua  is married with a child and her husband is a sprayer. For the past two years, she has been selling sugar cane and ice cream at Besease near Elmina. Ekua assists her husband with paying the utility bills.  

Ekua is requesting a loan to purchase more sugar cane to sell. She will use the profit from her loan to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar cane to sell

loans.name: Hay

texts.en:
Mrs. Hay is a mother of two young children and lives together with her husband in Prey Chor district. She is now 29 years old and is in the business of cultivating rice crops for a living. She is able to grow her rice plants twice a year as the river flows through her village and she gets enough water from it. 

She generally earns an average of $1.50 per day through her activities. This year Mrs. Hay plans to expand her farmland and increase her rice production. However, due to the lack of capital, Mrs. Hay wasn't able to buy a piece of farmland from her neighbor. For this reason, she has asked HKL for funds so she can purchase the land and expand her farm. 

She hopes to grow her farming business gradually.

loans.use: to buy a piece of farmland.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa de cincuenta años de edad, reside en casa propia junto  con su hijo y nuera. Su esposo murió hace algunos años. Elsa ha hecho de su casa un negocio. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ricas pupusas que día a día ofrece a sus clientes con mucho entusiasmo. Elsa es una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora y dedicada en su negocio. Muchas personas la conocen y dan referencia de ella y da las deliciosas pupusas que ofrece. Para Elsa lo más importante son los clientes, por lo que se preocupa en atenderlos de la mejor manera posible esto ha hacho que muchas personas la prefieran ya que siempre tiene una sonrisa y mucho entusiasmo para atender su negocio. Desea ampliar la capacidad de su negocio de tal manera que pueda cubrir una mayor demanda. Para esto necesita invertir en mayor cantidad de insumos que le permitan lograr su objetivo. Esto la ha hecho tomar la decisión de solicitar a INTEGRAL este crédito para comprar los insumos necesarios como: maíz, arroz, queso, frijoles, tomates, repollo, etc. con el fin de aumentar sus ventas y sus ingresos que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Elsa, age 50, lives in her own home with her son and daughter-in-law. Her husband passed away a few years ago. Elsa has made her home into a business. She makes and sells rich pupusas [a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans], which she offers her clients every day with great enthusiasm. She is an enterprising, hard-working woman who is dedicated to her business. She is well-known and customers often refer others to her because of her delicious pupusas. Elisa's customers are the most important part of her business, so she works hard to give them the best possible service. Because of this, many people prefer her business; she's always got a smile and a great enthusiasm for her business. She wants to expand her business so that she can serve more customers. In order to achieve this goal, she needs to invest in more supplies. For this reason, she has decided to request this loan from INTEGRAL in order to buy the necessary supplies such as: corn, rice, cheese, beans, tomatoes, cabbage, etc. Her goal is to increase her sales and her income in order to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy: corn, rice, cheese, beans, tomatoes, cabbage, etc.

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran is married and has 4 sons and 2 daughters. 2 of them are studying and 2 of them work to financially contribute to the family.

Sughran is a housewife and does her houswork. She is very active and performs her duties very well. She cooks food for the family and keeps her home clean. 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son who operates an eggs sales business. Eggs sales increase in the winter season because this is an good food item that stays fresh in the cold.
With this loan, he will buy eggs in bulk quantity and will supply them to different grocery shops in the market to earn profits. 
He is relatively new to his business and working very hard. Sughran is hopeful that an investment will help him get established in the business. 
Note: “In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sughran”.

loans.use: To buy eggs for re-selling

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en: Bilal is a 28-year-old Lebanese married man. He’s living with his wife and only one child. He’s considered as the main source of income in the family and is working really hard to provide a better future for his young child. He started his own metal workshop in 2005. Today, he wants to take out a youth loan of $1600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase extra metal products for his business. He notes that this Kiva loan will increase his profits by 20%. In the future, he plans to open his own metal shop.

loans.use: to purchase extra metal products for his business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
This is Victoria, 29, and a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Azelo, an overseas contract worker, and has two children. The entire family manages their own household while operating the business. Victoria works hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.

Victoria retails processed meat products, such as hotdogs, sweetened pork, etc. She gets her products from the wholesaler and sells them per piece/pack for a profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Victoria earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue business operations, Victoria is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan, which she will use to buy additional processed and frozen meat products to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in business income as she expands the business. 

Victoria hopes to be able to expand soon, as she dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of processed meat

loans.name: Duo San Francisco Group

texts.es:
DUO GUADALUPE
Tiburcia Hernandez de 49 años  que se dedica a la venta de frutas  y helados  donde ella vive  desde hace 17 años  ella necesita otro crédito para invertir para este tiempo de Semana Santa  es donde aprovecha a generar más ingresos y poder salir a vender helados  en la aldea con la ayuda de su esposo, su deseo es poder agrandar su negocio y tener variedad de frutas  para que su clientela no suba al pueblo a comprar  y así  mismo poder ser un apoyo económico en su hogar y sacar adelante a su familia,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de frutas y productos para elavorar helados.

loans.use: Compra de frutas y productos para elavorar helados.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Tindwende Group

texts.fr:
Mme SAFIATA représente le groupe TINDWENDE.  Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 02enfants. Le plus âgé a 06ans et le moins âgé a 01an. Personne ne va à l’école. 
Mme vend des œufs  depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Gounghin. Ses clients sont les hommes, les femmes,  gérants  de kiosque et boutique.
Elle veut s’acheter 30plaquets d’œufs.
Mme veut épargner ses bénéfices afin de renforcer son activité. Elle ambitionne augmenter  son commerce et  subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Safiata represents the Tindwende group. She is going well. Married, she is a mother of two children. The eldest is six years old and the youngest is one year old. None of the children go to school.

Safiata has been selling eggs for five years. She procures her goods in Gounghin. Her customers are men, some, and kiosk and shop managers.

Safiata would like to buy 30 trays of eggs. She wants to save her earnings in order to strengthen her business.

She hopes to one day expand her business and support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy 30 trays of eggs

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margrate is 40 years old, a single mother of three children .She is a strong member of women of faith group.Margret is determined to educate her children so as to future grounds. Her first born is in college, second in secondary and the third is in primary school.With school fees and the childrens upkeep on her shoulders  she works extra hard to meet their needs .She buys fruits from farmers in Muranga around Saba Saba and Maragua, rural areasand sells them to fruit vendors at Korokoco market .She has many custormers who are fruit  vendors which makes her business performance good at times.Currently her capital is USD 225.Though she has taken USD 43 from the groups revolving fund, she needs a further USD 75 to increase her purchases for supply and she belives with thatwill be able to deliver more fruits and reduce cost and save time.

loans.use: Margrate wants to buy pineapples, oranges, apples, bananas, and mangoes in large quantity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The capital will be used to buy raw material in order to produce paint and sell it.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has 8 years of experience in her business. She began working for another person in a sewing shop. With her savings, she began to attend classes to gain greater knowledge of sewing, and she achieved her goal. Then she began working for hospital where they proposed that she make uniforms for the employees. Until now, she has been combining the two aspects of her job. She works mornings in the hospital and makes uniforms in the afternoons. She works every day of the week.

Maria wants to use the loan to buy fabrics because the demand for uniforms has increased. Additionally, with the savings from her job, she wants to buy an industrial sewing machine, which will allow her improve her to do a better job.

Maria is married. She has 5 children, all of whom are married. She is 61 years old and her children are proud of her for her hard work and her dedication to her job. She has been able to build a cement house. Her children are a great help to her with whatever she needs.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

p> Maria tiene una experiencia de 8 años con su actividad. Se inicio trabajando para otra persona en un taller de costura. Con sus ahorros comienza a asistir a cursos para obtener mayor conocimiento de la costura y lo logra. Entra a trabajar a un Hospital en donde le proponen que ella elabore los uniformes de los empleados. Hasta el día de hoy ella ha logrado combinar las dos actividades. Trabajando por las tardes en el hospital y las mañanas se dedica a la elaboración de uniformes. Trabaja todos los días de la semana.

Maria desea el crédito para comprar telas ya que han aumentado su demanda por los uniformes. Además con las ganancias que le deje su trabajo comprar una maquina industrial que le permita realizar un mejor trabajo.

Maria es casada. Tiene 5 hijos todos casados. Tiene 61 años y sus hijos están orgullosos de ella por su esfuerzo y dedicación al trabajo. Ha logrado poder construir su casita de cemento. Sus hijos son una gran ayuda para lo que necesita.

loans.use: to invest in fabrics and maybe an industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca G., 49, is married and lives with her husband and five children in the lush green lowlands of western Guatemala. She sells chicken and other groceries from her small neighborhood store, the "Tienda Noremí", named after her youngest daughter. She has grown her business over four years from just a few beans and groceries to a pretty significant little store. Her big product is chicken, which she buys and sells about 300 pounds of a week, for a profit of nearly US$60. The loan she is requesting will once again be used to buy more products to sell, including chicken.

Paying the electric bill to run the refrigerator and keeping the kids in school are a running battle. Her husband works in the fields, but at this time of year the harvest is over and he just finds any work that he can do. She is thankful to provide an extra income that makes their ups and downs more manageable.

Francisca cannot read or write, but is very proud that all of her children have the opportunity to get a good education.

loans.use: Purchase inventory for store

loans.name: Hermelinda Francisca

texts.es:
Hermelinda is a single mother who, despite difficulties she faced living in her home town, decided to fight to keep her family together and far away from violence. For this reason, she decided to move to another town and establish herself there. Shortly afterwards, she lost her husband and was left alone with three children. Through much effort and hard work, she managed to educate them so that they are able fulfill a variety of activities in society. Things have never been easy for Hermelinda’s family, but thanks to their sense of unity and dedication to each other, they have been able to regain the peace and calm that had been taken from them.

Hermelinda currently raises pigs and guinea pigs in a part of her house that she has adapted for this purpose. She has been selling them to friends and family, but due to advice that many people have given her, she has decided to install a small food stand outside her house for the purpose of selling to the general public. In order to proceed with this plan, she is requesting a loan of $400.00, which she is committed to repaying over a period of 6 months. This way she will be able to begin her project and improve the quality of life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Hermelinda es una madre que a pesar de las dificultades que le tocó vivir en su ciudad natal decidió seguir luchando por mantener a su familia unida lejos de la violencia.. Por ello decidió migrar a otra ciudad y establecerse en ella; a poco tiempo de haberlo hecho perdió a su esposo y se quedó sola con sus 3 hijos; a base de esfuerzo y mucho trabajo los educó a fin de que puedan desarrollar diversas actividades dentro de la sociedad.Las cosas nunca fueron fáciles para la familia de Hermelinda pero gracias a la unión y compromiso de cada uno de sus miembros han podido recobrar la paz y calma que les habían arrebatado.Hermelinda actualmente cría cuyes y cerditos en un espacio de su casa que ha acondicionado especialmente para esta actividad. Los ha ido vendiendo a amigos y familiares; pero gracias a muchos consejos ha decidido instalar un pequeño stand de comida típica en las afueras de su hogar a fin de ofrecerlos al público en general.Para llevar a cabo este proyecto, solicita un préstamo de 400 dólares con un compromiso de pago durante un periodo de 6 meses para poner en marcha su proyecto y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Hermelinda will install a food stand in front of her house, where she will serve typical food so that the entire community can enjoy her wonderful cooking.

loans.name: Abdón

texts.en:
Abdón is 44 years old; he lives with his partner Rosa Franco in Paraguarí, Paraguay. Abdón currently manages a company that offers private security services.

Abdón began this business two years ago. Before, he worked as a security guard at a service station. The money he earned in this capacity was very small, and after working there for some time saw the need for security services in other areas. In this way Abdón decided to open his own private security company. His services are currently being contracted by one of the private high schools in the town of Paraguarí. Additionally, he works weekends at special events and parties.

Abdón has requested credit so that he can buy new uniforms. He is planning to employ three new security guards, due to the high demand for his services.

loans.use: To buy new uniforms

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Business support

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: she needs the loan to purchase goods

loans.name: Lucia's Group

texts.en:
Isabel, Paulina, and Lucia have been members of the community bank “Luz Divina” for six, ten, and fifteen years respectively. In the community bank they have learned to save, be responsible, punctual, and try to improve themselves day by day.

Isabel is 40 years old. She lives with her partner and son. Isabel has had a store selling food staples such as flour, sugar, and rice for six years. One year ago she started selling pre paid phone cards.

On the other hand, Paulina is 40 years old. She is a single mother and has three children. Paulina has a store where she sells food staples, fruits and vegetables. Paulina started her business with a lone from the community bank, and little by little has expanded her merchendise. In addition Paulina sells prepared food form her store. Paulina is thinking of opening a restaurant.

Lucia is 51 years old. She is a widow and has five children. Lucia, together with her daughter, makes breads that they cell at the regional transportation center. Additionally, in her free time Lucia washes clothing and sells fruit. Isabel, Paulina, and Lucia need loans of 300, 900, and 450 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy pre paid phone cards, sugar, rice, soap, detergent, soft drinks, flour, and fire wood.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest earning savings account each associate has. Isabel, Paulina, and Lucia plan to use their savings to expand their businesses, and open a restaurant. Their dreams are to open a market, that their son studies at the university, to own house, and to help their daughter start her own business.

loans.use: Isabel, Paulina, and Lucia need loans of 300, 900, and 450 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy pre paid phone cards, sugar, rice, soap, detergent, soft drinks, flour, and fire wood.

loans.name: Rama

texts.en:
Rama T. lives in Khokhana Dobato, between Khokhana and Sainbu-Bhaishapati of the Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this region are involved in farming and business.

Rama lives with her husband and children. Her husband, Sanu Raj T., went Saudi Arabia to work two years ago. Her daughter works in garment factory and her two sons are studying in grades 12 and 10, respectively.

Rama is a grocery shopkeeper. Her children also help in her shop. Due to the lack of money she can’t expand her business. So she is a loan to buy grocery items such as rice, maize, paddy and more.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for her shop

loans.name: Soun

texts.en: Mr. Soun C., 44, and his wife, Mrs. Chi Rani,, both earn about $10 per day growing and selling mushrooms from their home. They live with their four children in Kos Keo Village, Banteay Meanchey Province. One of the children helps with the mushroom business, while the other three are still in school. Mr. C. seeks a $200 loan to expand his business, which will help them pay his children’s school fees.

loans.use: To expand his mushroom-growing business

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 28-year-old Ana M.. She is married and has no children. She has 2 dependents, who live with her because they are her sister-in-law's children. In 2006 Ana established her café business. Ana requires a loan in order to purchase utensils and ingredients, such as rice, oil, and beans, in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

When you see a SELFINA entrepreneur whose business title is "restaurant" or "café," you may have to adjust your mental image of what that is. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches, with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don’t even appear in the Lonely Planet’s budget guide, but if you’re looking for a cheap and tasty meal and someone to have a chat with, this is the place to be. The food is all local: rice, ugali (a hot, sticky dough, made from maize flour), and plantain (a cooked savory banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients and utensils for her café

loans.name: Glendy Jessenia

texts.es:
In the municipality of Villanueva of the city of Chinandega, Mrs. Glendy P. is working very hard to accomplish her dream of reconstructing her house of residence, which has been deteriorating over the years due to the natural phenomena that had befallen it.

With the responsibility of maintaining her small son, this lady together with her husband is looking for ways to improve their living conditions. For this reason, Mrs. P. is seeking the support of Ceprodel in obtaining a loan that will give her the means to get the construction materials needed to continue the work they have started, work that they had to pause due to financial difficulties. However, currently realizing the need to continue the work, she hopes that her loan will be granted without a problem.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

En el municipio de Villanueva de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Glendy P. se esfuerza grandemente para llevar a cabo su sueño de reconstruir su casa de habitación el cual a través de los años se ha venido deteriorando debido a los fenómenos naturales que le han azotado.

Con la obligación de mantener a su pequeño hijo, esta dama en conjunto con su esposo se dedica buscan la manera de como mejorar sus condiciones de vida y para ello, la señora P. busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le de la oportunidad de adquirir sus materiales de construcción para continuar con esta obra ya que al haberla iniciado en parte, se vio en la obligación de no continuar por la falta del recurso económico. Sin embargo hoy en día al darse cuenta de la necesidad de continuar espera en que su crédito será otorgado sin ningún problema.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials.

loans.name: Thi Loan

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Loan (ID number: 020011), is 47 years old this year. This is the second time she applies for loan. She had already repaid the first loan fully. This second time she wants to borrow 2,714,000VND (approximately 175USD) to invest and get more stock for her butcher stall in the wet market. Her husband also helps her with the stall. Her family's daily income is about 100,000VND (approximately 6.50USD). She has a school-going child. Her family has not borrowed from any other Funds. She really likes to join this Fund because she can repay the loan on an installment basis.

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Cô Nghiêm Thị Loan (MS: 020011), năm nay 47 tuổi. Cô tham gia vay lần hai. Lần một cô đã hoàn trả xong. Lần hai cô vay 2.714.000 VND bổ sung vốn đi chợ buôn bán thịt lợn. Chồng cô cùng đi chợ giúp cô bán hàng. Thu nhập của gia đình cô khoảng 100.000 VND/ngày. Cô có một con đang đi học. Gia đình cô chưa tham gia vay vốn ở đâu. Cô rất thích tham gia chương trình vì được trả dần.

loans.use: Meat selling

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali, 64 years old, lives in a village close to Saida in South Lebanon. A very hardworking plumber since his youth, he needs a loan of $1,200 to purchase goods and new equipment to better perform his job. Ali has been a micro-credit client of Al Majmoua for the past five years, repaying all of his debts on time.

loans.use: To purchase plumbing goods and new equipment

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is 42 years old. She is married. She has been a khanga seller since 2004. Every day she works at her business.

Fatma now requests a loan to buy more khanga for her business.

loans.use: To buy more cloth (khanga) for her business

loans.name: Ndèye Gnagna

texts.fr: Ndèye Gnagna D., 32 ans, mariée avec 03 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de TP Tackou Ligueye depuis 4 ans et demi. Elle veut renforcer son activité de restauration (vente de boisson et de sandwich) au niveau de sa buvette. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer ses conditions de vie. <b> Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Ndèye Gnagna D., 32 years old, and married with three children in her care, has been a member of the TP Tackou Ligueye village bank for four and a half years. She wants to transform her catering business (the sale of sandwiches and beverages) into a food stand. The income would permit her to improve their standard of living.
