The loan that she is requesting would be repaid in a lump sum in six months time.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of sandwiches and beverages

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma sells fish, flour, and oil in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can expand her inventory and increase her sales. She is currently able to earn a profit of approximately $125 each month.

Salma is 45 years old and married.

loans.use: To buy fish, flour, and oil

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 64 years old, and she is a widow with 3 children. She lives in Benin City with her family. She sells goats. She needs the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more goats to sell. She is happy because the festive season is fast approaching and the demands for her goats will be high. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more goats to sell

loans.name: Ram Keshari

texts.en:
Mrs. Ram Keshari M. is a 22-year-old woman who lives in Thecho. Thecho is located in Lalitpur district of Kathmandu valley. Thecho is one of the backward areas of Lalitpur. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Mrs. M. lives in a nuclear family with her husband and their daughter.

Her husband's name is Dadu Raj M.. He is a carpenter and opened his furniture shop a year ago. All the requirements of the family are met using the shop's income. Therefore Mrs. M. seeks a loan in the amount of Rs10,000 to buy lumber to meet the demand for her husband's furniture. Her husband makes different sorts of furniture such as beds, tables, and chairs.

loans.use: To buy lumber

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Tiện, hiện nay 46 tuổi, gia đình chị có 2 con đã trưởng thành. Sau 5 năm tham gia vào Quỹ, nhờ chăm chỉ và sử dụng nguồn vốn có hiệu quả gia đình chị có thêm điều kiện đầu tư phát triển kinh tế và mua sắm thêm tiện nghi trong gia đình. Nguồn thu nhập chính của gia đình chị từ nghề nông và dệt chiếu, bên cạnh đó có thêm một phần thu nhập từ việc đi buôn bò của chồng chị. Vòng vốn tới chị Tiện muốn vay 8.000.000 để đầu tư cho công việc buôn bán bò của gia đình
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Tiện is 46 years old and has two grown children. After five years of participation in the TYM Fund, working hard and using her loans effectively, her family has been able to improve their financial situation and buy a few modern conveniences. The main sources of income for her family are farming and weaving straw mats. In addition, her husband earns some money from selling livestock. In the next round of lending, Mrs. Tiện hopes to borrow 8,000,000 VND (475 USD) to invest in her family’s business selling cows.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is 35 years old and she lives in Cimislia district, Gradiste village. The main activity of the borrower is growing cereals and grain legumes. She has experience in the field for more than 15 years, thanks to her parents because they taught her many things in agriculture, how to have good results and a good income.

Galina's business was launched in 1999. She has more plans that she aims to perform in the near future. Galina works together with her son who is 20 years old; he is a student, but when he has free time, he always helps his mother with great pleasure. One future plan of the borrower is to increase working capital and namely to buy seeds and fuel to irrigate the 15 hectares of arable land to be more productive.

loans.use: to increase her working capital

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
La sra. Maria incio el negocio, porque es una persona mayor de edad y por esta razon le fue muy dificil encontrara trabajo, ya que no pueden contratarla en una empresa facilmente, auqnue ella un se siente fuerte para trabajar, su edad era un impedimento,  ante tal situacion ella opto por abrir una pequeña tienda de abarrotes,  junto a su esposo y así seguir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida, poco a poco ha logrado hacer mas clientes gracias a que brinadn un buen servicio. 

Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $3500 que pagara en 8 catorcenas para comprar mercancia y surtir bien su negocio para tener mas variedad de productos y así tener mas clientes.
texts.en:
Maria started her own business because she is a senior citizen and it was very difficult for her to find a job. She could not be contracted by a company easily, and although she feels strong enough to work her age was an impediment. Facing this situation, she opted to open a small grocery store together with her husband, and in this way move forward and improve their quality of life. Little by little she has attracted more customers by offering good service. She is seeking a loan of $3,500 pesos which she will repay in 8 fortnightly installments. She will use the loan to purchase merchandise and restock her business so that the variety of products will attract more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy second-hand goods for resale

loans.name: Colette

texts.fr:
A. Colette est née vers 1952 à Ouidah dans le département de l'Atlantique, au Sud du Bénin. Colette est mariée, elle a cinq (5) enfants, tous déjà adultes et installés à leur propre compte. C'est depuis son enfance que Colette a été initiée au commerce par sa défunte tante auprès de qui elle est restée jusqu'à son mariage. Après son mariage, Colette s'est mise à vendre de l'huile de palme, du maïs, de la farine de manioc, de bois de chauffe et divers autres articles. Colette a eu déjà deux prêts de ALIDé qu'elle a bien remboursé et grâce auxquels elle a augmenté le niveau de son commerce. Aujourd'hui encore, Colette sollicite un prêt en vue de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Colette A. was born around 1952 in Ouidah in the Atlantique province, in the south of Bénin. Colette is married; she has 5 children, all already adults and living on their own. Since childhood, Colette was taught to sell goods by her late aunt, with whom she remained until her marriage.

After her marriage, Colette started selling palm oil, maize, manioc flour, firewood, and various other articles. Colette has already received two loans from ALIDé which she reimbursed in a timely manner and thanks to which she was able to improve her little business. Today, Colette is requesting another loan, with a view to satisfying the needs of her clientele.

The significance of ALIDé in the local language of Bénin, Fon, is "there is always a pathway for the poorest of the poor". Bénin is a small country in West Africa next door to Nigeria; its GDP per inhabitant is US$ 1,500. ALIDé offers special loans at 0% interest to very vulnerable persons and it is in a group that will soon begin to offer a micro-insurance program (health insurance) for the beneficiaries of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of jerrycans of palm oil and of a locally produced alcoholic beverage called SODABI

loans.name: Marya

texts.en:
Marya is married. She sells food at the market in the small city of Zhidachev. She has been in this business for 15 years. She always offers her clients good and fresh food products, providing them with what they need. Marya is a hard-working and enthusiastic person. She wants to continue her business to make a living for her family.

Marya would like to borrow 7,000 UAH to increase her inventory. There are many celebrations in April and May and demand for her products grows.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Norma Agustina

texts.es:
La señora Norma es socia del Banco Comunal “Aswancaris II” en la  provincia de Azangaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 32 años de edad, es conviviente con 04 hijos a su cargo, vive en el Jr. Barrio Revolución. Tiene estudios de 3ro de segundaria.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 01 año, la actividad a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de carne, su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que utilizó para comprar mas carne.
Actualmente ella desea un préstamo de S/ 1500.00 nuevos soles, con este dinero podrá adquirir mas carne para que su negocio crezca y tener mas ganancias.  Pinesa poner una boutique.

A ella le gusta mucho la forma de pago, los ahorros y los encuentros deportivos que realiza su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of the Aswancaris II Communal Bank in the province of Azangaro located in the state of Puno. She is 32 years old and a common-law wife with four children under her care. She lives in the Jr. Barrio Revolución neighborhood and has a third grade education. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for a year. Her business is buying and selling meat. Her first loan was for 300 soles and was used to purchase more meat. Now she would like a loan for 1,500. With this money she will be able to purchase more meat so her business can grow and she can earn more. She is thinking of buying a boutique. She likes very much the form of payment, the savings and the sporting events that her communal bank organizes.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase meat to sell

loans.name: Nov

texts.en: Nov T. is 65 years old and has owned a medium house located in the Pursat Province where she has lived with her family members for years. She and her husband currently cultivate different crops on their one hectare piece of farmland that was inherited from their grandparents. The couple has six children; three of whom are employed in different jobs. Since 1990, the family has been farming and they also hired the neighbor's oxen to help with plowing their farmland. Nov T. hopes to reduce the cost of plowing by using loan money to buy a cow. She will be able to rent out the cow to other farmers for a profit and she will also raise its offspring.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Vasyl

texts.en:
Vasyl is a single dad who is raising two teenage sons. His wife left him and he was forced to find ways to feed his growing boys. This is how he ended up being a small entrepreneur from Belaya Tserkov working in the sphere of recycling services. Vasyl owns two small market stalls at different marketplaces in his home town of Belaya Tserkov. He has two hired employees who help him run his small venture. People bring empty glass bottles that are to be recycled to Vasyl. He collects them in plastic boxes and takes them to a recycling company. Vasyl has been in this business for eight years so far. Presently, he gets about 19,000 Grivnyas in income each month. 

Vasyl is seeking a 5,500 Grivnya loan to re-construct and equip his garage with necessary units for glass bottle storage. Moreover, he would like to re-construct it so that he could keep his car there as well. Vasyl believes he could use his spacious garage facility much more efficiently if he reorganizes everything inside. People who know Vasyl always characterize him as a determined, focused individual who never stops when faced with challenges. He is a fighter and always makes sure his family has all they need. We believe Vasyl’s responsibility and perseverance will help him repay the current loan as well.

loans.use: To re-construct and re-equip his garage that serves as a storage facility

loans.name: Bahor

texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following its development MLF “MicroInvest”  transformed into a Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. In October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest”, together with LLC “Frontiers”, founded the Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”.
“Arvand” continues to carry out its mission, which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.
A. Bahor first applied to MicroInvest in 2005, when she was in a difficult situation. Thanks to her previous loans she could open and strengthen her livestock and milk processing business. She has a good herd. Bahor is married with 4 daughters who help her. She also works as a cook in the local pub. The processed milk she sells into the collective farms and in the local bazaar. Working with “Arvand” , Bahor is applying to KIVA for a loan of 2600 STJ, which she will use to buy specialized milk control equipment.

loans.use: to purchase specialized milk control equipment

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en: Flordeliza R., age 29, owns a tricycle transport. Her husband, Reynaldo R., is the one operating the tricycle to earn income for their family. She has one child who is studying in elementary school. Now, Flordeliza needs a loan to repair her tricycle. She is asking for a loan of 12,000 PHP from CEVI to buy the needed parts for her tricycle and to get started on a new business as well. Because she is looking for some other income sources, CEVI is helping her by providing credit assistance, education and insurance coverage.

loans.use: For tricycle repair and to start up a new business

loans.name: Álvaro Santos

texts.es:
Alvaro Santos A. T. es un joven señor de 30 años, vecino de Los Tijos de Upala, localizado en la provincia de Alajuela. Es una comunidad rural  con una extensión relativamente grande, con topografía semi montañosa ubicada en Costa Rica, Centroamérica.  La comunidad se dedica especialmente a la agricultura de granos básicos, y en menor escala a la ganadería. Vive con sus padres su hermana y su sobrino.

Desde hace poco más de un año, don Alvaro se ha desarrollado como microempresario, tiene un pequeño terreno en el cual  se dedica a la siembra de camóte, un tubérculo de agradable sabor, rico en nutrientes, de procesamiento agroindustrial amplio y de gran demanda tanto en Costa Rica como en otros países. Dice que gracias a este proyecto ha aprendido mucho y también le ha dado oportunidad de desarrollarse personalmente y profesionalmente.

Actualmente don Alvaro está solicitando un préstamo de ¢600,000 (seiscientos mil colones), para ayudarse con  la preparación del suelo, compra de semillas, fertilizantes, entre otros insumos que sean necesarios para garantizar la siembra óptima del camote. 

Con esta inversión  espera lograr una buena cosecha, con un producto de características apropiadas para conseguir un precio de venta alto. Ya que desea realizar más proyectos en el futuro y también mejorar las condiciones de su familia.

Don Alvaro forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Los Tijos, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será  su primer préstamo y con el espera seguir creciendo como microempresario.
texts.en:
Alvaro Santos A. T. is a 30 year-old young man who lives in Los Tijos de Upala, a relatively large and mountainous rural community located in the province of Alajuela in Costa Rica, Central America. The community’s primary business is agriculture, growing basic grains, and its secondary business is cattle raising. Alvaro lives with his parents, his sister and his nephew.

A little over a year ago don Alvaro became a micro-entrepreneur. He has a small plot of land where he grows sweet potato, a flavorful tuber, rich in nutrients, widely grown and in great demand in Costa Rica as well as other countries. He has learned a lot from this project, which has given him the opportunity for personal and professional growth.

Don Alvaro is requesting a $1,025 (600,000 colones) loan to help with the soil preparation, purchase of seeds, fertilizers and other materials needed to guarantee an optimum sweet potato crop.

With this investment he hopes to get a good harvest with a high quality product that he can sell at a high price. He wants to start more projects in the future and improve his family’s quality of life.

Don Alvaro belongs to the Communal Credit Company of Los Tijos, one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This is his first loan and he hopes to continue to grow as a micro-entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to harvest sweet potatoes

loans.name: Anju

texts.en:
Mrs. Anju N. is a tailor in the village of Khokhana-Dobato in Lalitpur. She opened her tailoring shop 4 years ago. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies dresses and school uniforms for both boys and girls. She prefers to make popular dresses like kurta sulwar, blouses, ladies' long dresses, makhshi, and others. Before starting her own business, Mrs. N. took a 6-month training course in tailoring.

Now Mrs. N. is requesting a 15,000 Nepalese rupee loan to buy raw materials for her work. Mrs. Nepalil lives in a single family home with her husband and one son. Her husband's name is Mr. Rabendra N., and he works in private office. Her son is studying at the primary level.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for tailoring

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is married and has two adult children. She sells clothing at the central market in the town of Nova Kahovka. Valentina started this business eighteen years ago. At that time she did not have any other opportunities for making a living. She was courageous enough to start this business with very little money and almost no experience. Little by little she began to gain clients as well as experience in sales.

Today Valentina enjoys her business, and it has become a stable source of income. Valentina would like to borrow 9,000 UAH to increase the assortment of clothing in her shop. She hopes to make additional income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of clothing in her shop

loans.name: Carola Lastenia

texts.es:
La microempresaria Carola Lastenia C. F. tiene 57 años de edad es casada con 3 hijos todos adultos quienes viven en sus propias casas, es de la etnia creole y se dedica desde hace mas de 9 años a la venta ambulante de diferentes productos, entre estos perfumes de hombres y  mujeres, paraguas, sandalias, cremas faciales, productos laminados (cadenas, aretes, anillos) y otros productos en general.

Con este negocio ha podido mantenerse ya que su marido no trabaja por su avanzada edad y con la pensión que obtiene no puede cubrir los gastos del hogar. La microempresaria C. ya ha sido beneficiada con un préstamo por parte de kiva por un monto de US 600 y fue cancelado en tiempo y forma. Aprovecha este medio para agradecer a los prestamistas que confiaron en ella entregándole el dinero.

Actualmente la señora Carola tiene una gran demanda de productos encargados por lo que requiere un financiamiento para comprar lo siguiente:

10 Unidades de Perfumes de mujer los que le cuestan US 15 cada uno, 8 unidades de perfumes para caballero que le cuestan US10 cada uno, 8 unidades de paraguas cuestan US 3 cada uno, 5 juegos de vestidos de sofá a US 35 cada juego, 2 docenas de  sandalias de mujer a US 84 cada docena, 3 docenas de menticol a US 35 cada docena, 8 unidades de crema alizadora a US 5 cada unidad, 3 docenas de  agua florida a US 20 cada docena y 3 docenas de aretes laminados a US 66 cada docena.
texts.en:
Carola Lastenia C. F. is a 57 year old entrepreneur. She is married and has three adult children who live in their own houses. She is Creole. For over nine years she has been a street vendor selling products like men’s and women’s perfume, umbrellas, sandals, face cream, laminated products (chains, earrings, rings), and other general products. She has been able to support herself with this business. Her husband does not work because of his advanced age, and the pension he gets does not cover the household expenses. This entrepreneur, C., has received a loan from Kiva for the sum of US $600. It was paid back on time and in the manner agreed upon. She takes advantage of this opportunity to thank the lenders who had confidence in her and lent her the money Carola currently has a great demand for ordered products. That is why she needs a loan to buy the following: 10 units of women’s perfume that cost US $15 each, 8 units of men’s perfume that costs US $10 each, 8 units of umbrellas that cost US $3 each, 5 sets of sofa covers at US $35 per set, 2 dozen women’s sandals at US $84 per dozen, 3 dozen Menticol (an antiseptic lotion) at US $35 per dozen, 8 units of straightening cream at US $5 each, 3 dozen of scented water at US $20 per dozen, 3 dozen laminated earrings at US $66 per dozen.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy women's and men's perfume, umbrellas, sets of sofa covers, women's sandals, antiseptic lotion, straightening cream, scented water, and laminated earrings

loans.name: Elizabeth Jepkorir

texts.en:
Elizabeth Jepkorir is 40 years old. She is married to Peter, a businessman, and is blessed with three children.

Elizabeth was introduced to Kiva partner KADET by Roseline Kiptoo. With the loan Elizabeth is requesting from KADET, she plans to add stock, including trousers, shorts and shoes, to her clothing business. Her dreams are to grow her clothing business and buy a plot of land in Iten Town to build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy clothing stock

loans.name: Gen Tic Women’S Group Auma Doreen

texts.en: Doreen A. is a 29 year old business lady. She is married and the mother of five children, three of whom are schooling and looking after one dependant. She has been in the charcoal business for four years. She is in need of capital and is requesting this loan to purchase 30 bags of charcoal or more. Doreen plans to work very hard and hopes to educate her children.

loans.use: To add capital by purchasing 30 bags of charcoal or more

loans.name: Aun's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Aun K. is the leader of a group of four members who all live in Damnak village in Takeo province. She is 43 years old and the mother of a child who is attending the local school.  Mrs. Aun K. is a Khmer noodle seller and also a pig breeder. Since her pig-breeding business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets and pig food for breeding. She would use the rest of the money from her loan to buy fertilizer to support the plantation of her husband, Mr. Try Phat.

loans.use: to purchse pig-breeding supplies, and fertilizer for her husband

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina M. is from the city of Maloro, Tangub City. She is 41 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Catalina owns and operates a business running a food stall, tending a canteen near the school. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Catalina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Miregen

texts.en:
Miregen V. is from the village of D'ban, Calamba, Mis. Occ. She is 27 years old. Miregen is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Miregen operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including "kinasun" (small clams) and shrimp, in the local community. Miregen has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos a month from these activities.

In 2007, Miregen joined GDMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Miregen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Miregen is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Miregen from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina R. is from the town of Quirino. She is 41 years old. Gina is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Gina plants, harvests, and sells rice. Gina has been engaged in her business for over 24 years and earns approximately 70,000 PHP per harvest from these activities.

Gina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina is requesting a new loan of 28000 PHP to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. This will be Gina's sixth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her immediate family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Som V., 31, is married and lives with her two-year-old child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. V. is employed at a local garment factory in the city, earning an income of US$2 per day. She has been with this business since 2002. Her husband is a salt middleman, earning US$4 per day. He sells salt products in his village and in the province. (V.'s husband is pictured here.)

V. and her family members try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well as to get rid of necessary daily expenses. Therefore, V. is requesting a loan of US$850 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to purchase more salt products for sale. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy more salt products for sale

loans.name: Mario Jose

texts.es: El Sr. Mario H. E. es taxista tiene carro propio tiene 6 años de trabajar como taxista, el dinero los solicita para compra de un juego de llantas, es casado tiene cuatro hijos, ha tenido 3 créditos con Ceprodel y si le han impactado los crédito ya que se ha ayudado en poner en marcha su taxi y así no atrasarse en su trabajo y poder tener sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Sr. Mario H. E. has been working as a taxi driver for six years and has his own vehicle. The money he is requesting will be used to purchase a set of tires. Mario is married and has four children. He has received three previous loans with CEPRODEL. The impact of each loan has helped keep his taxi business in operation so that he does not fall behind in his work and still generate an income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a set of tires

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok N., age 58, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia.   She is engaged in a weaver of Cambodian traditional silk, earning approximately $3 per day.  By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses.  Sok has been with this business since 2001. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of $1 per day.  Sok wants a loan to expand her business and is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase more raw silk to produce more silk products for sale. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: Buy more raw silk to produce silk products

loans.name: Jekafo. Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe Jekafo, 5 femmes mariées  et 1 célibataire ont en moyenne 39 ans, 3 enfants et  vivent la plupart dans des familles monogames à Hamdallaye  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Le prêt précédent  a été bien remboursé. 
Elles font la vente de tissus pour draps de lits, du qoikère, du bois de chauffe,  des parfums, des parures, de la friperie, de la restauration etc.
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 75kg de tissus pour draps de lits,  2 sacs de 100kg de riz,  6 paquets de condiments alimentaires, 160 sachets de qoikère, 1chargement et demi de camionnette en bois de chauffe,  2  paquets de parfums, 4 paquets de parures et 5 balles de friperie.
Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages environnants.  Elles revendent à Sikasso ville de façon ambulante, à domicile et dans les différents marchés, au comptant souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 27.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The six members of the Jekafo group – five married women and one who isn't – are on average 39 years old with three children, and live for the most part in monogamous families in Hamdallaye, one of the neighborhoods in Sikasso, in the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali. In response to customer needs they are requesting their second group loan from the Soro Yiriwaso MFI, having fully repaid the first one. They sell fabric to make bed sheets, oatmeal, firewood, perfume, ornaments, second-hand clothing, food preparations, etc. With their new loan they will buy: 75 kilos of fabric for bed sheets, two 100-kilo bags of rice, six packages of food condiments, 160 bags of oatmeal, 1 ½ pickup loads of firewood, two packages of perfume, four packages of ornaments, and five bales of second-hand clothing. They get their supplies from the main market in Sikasso, and from villages in the vicinity. They resell their products inside the town of Sikasso, either as itinerant vendors, from their homes or in the different markets, for cash but often for credit, to a customer base of both men and women. They hope to reach average monthly earnings of 27,500 FCFA each, of which a part will go to savings and taking care of family needs, and the rest will be reinvested in the business activities.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various items

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en: Mrs. Saroeun T. is 41 years old and lives in Kamnab village in Kandal province. She is the mother of one child who is a student in the local school. She works as a tailor at home and her husband, Mr. Thuch Soem, fixes flat tires. With both these businesses, they earn a small income to support their family's living costs. Mrs. Saroeun T. is requesting a loan to build a bathroom.

loans.use: To build a bathroom

loans.name: Diénaba

texts.en:
Diénaba S. is a 33-year-old woman from the village of Nianing on Senegal's Atlantic coast. She is married and the mother of five children. In the two years that she has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NIANING SANTHIE she has never had any problems in paying back her loans.

Diénaba S. runs a small restaurant and, as a second occupation, raises chickens. She plans to use this loan in equal parts to buy chicks and to purchase products for her restaurant. The earnings from these activities help her to cover her family's living costs.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and buy products for her restaurant

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom T. is a 29 year old married woman and she is a villager who lives in Check village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Kim Art, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they cultivate rice to earn a living for their family.

However, they face a face a problem because they do not have enough money to support the rice field. Thus,Mrs. Mom T. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline to support her farm crops. Mrs. Mom T. is a mother of two children who all are too young to study or work. Her husband is on the right of the picture.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline.

loans.name: Sombang Lestari Group

texts.en:
Ni Kadek P. is a 32-year-old woman living in the town of Melaya - Bali.  Ni Kadek is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by MUK.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 'Sombang Lestari' (MUK-0025).

Ni Kadek is married and has 1 infant child.  To make a living, Ni Kadek owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale.  Ni Kadek has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 200,000 IDR a month from these activities.


In 2010, Ni Kadek joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ni Kadek is requesting for the first time a loan from MUK in the amount of 1,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  This will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from MUK.  Ni Kadek plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About MUK:

The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans, thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.





Ni Kadek P. (0) merupakan 32 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali.  Ni Kadek adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 10 anggota.  Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar.  Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Sombang Lestari (MUK-0025).


Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Ni Kadek sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 10 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Kadek menghasilkan sekitar 200,000 IDR.  Dalam 2010, Ni Kadek bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Kadek meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari MUK.    Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,000,000 IDR.


Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK.


Tentang MUK:

Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita O. is from the village of Medina, Gingoog City. She is 49 years old. Mercedita is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Mercedita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling food and daily use products in the local community. Mercedita has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Mercedita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercedita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. Mercedita is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Mercedita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly es casada, tiene 31 años y 2 hijos, Nelly tiene un cafetín en el Colegio Condorcanqui en donde vende golosinas, comida, negocio que realiza hace 5 años con la ayuda de su esposo. Además Nelly vende salchipollos de manera ambulatoria en el arco de Carmen Alto.
Nelly pertenece al Banco Comunal Florecer y solicita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, aceite, azúcar y golosinas.
Los sueños de Nelly son educar a sus hijos y tener un carro para que trabaje su esposo.
texts.en:
Nelly, 31, is married and has two children. She has a small snack bar at Condorcanqui School where she sells snacks and food. She has been in this business with her husband’s help for 5 years. In addition, Nelly sells salchipollos (fried potatoes with fried, shredded chicken) at the Carmen Alto Arch. Nelly’s a member of the Florecer (To Bloom) communal bank and she’s asking for a 2000 sol loan to buy rice, cooking oil, sugar and sweets. Nelly’s dreams are to provide an education for her children and to have a car that her husband can operate.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, cooking oil, sugar and snack items.

loans.name: La Confianza 1,2 Group

texts.en: Eulalia is the coordinator of her group La Confianza (The Confidence), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the urban slums north of Santo Domingo, an area where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and their three children. Eulalia is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza and is excited to invest in her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business of selling breakfast by purchasing salami, ham, beef, plantains, bananas, oranges, tamarinds, limes and disposable plates and silverware. She will use the profits to invest in her home by repairing her roof. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Salami, ham, beef, plantains, bananas, oranges, tamarinds, limes and disposable plates and silverware

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Seng C., 44, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, the most populated city in the country. She is a housewife and her husband is a driver for a private company, earning an income of USD 3.3 per day. C. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase books to resell to school children. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. C.'s husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy books to resell.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena B. is from the village of Dalipuga, Iligan City. She is 48 years old. Rowena is married and has 1 school-aged child. Rowena owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) shop where she sells food & daily use products. She has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rowena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Rowena is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Rowena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital

location.town: Dalipuga, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Gilma Jeannett

texts.es:
Gilma resiD. en san miguel departamento D. san miguel, ella es madres soltera tiene tres hijos (Gerson, Oscar y xiomara) su esposo los abandono hace varios años desD. entonces ella se dedica a la venta D. tortillas para la manutención D. sus hijos.
Trabaja en la venta D. tortillas hace 5 años las venD. dos veces al día D. 6 a 7 D. la mañana D. sus tres hijos solo estudian dos varones las niña xiomara D. 17 años no estudia ya que trabaja desD. muy pequeña junto con ella en la venta tortillas porque Vivian en una situación económica muy mal no tuvo otra opción que enseñarle a su hija el mismo oficio que ella para mejorar su condición D. vida,
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra D. maíz, leña y otros productos para la elaboración D. las tortillas y otra cantidad la utilizara para comprarle a su hijo Gerson un par D. aros o lentes para la vista ya que él tiene problemas D. visión.
Esto le ayudara a tener materia prima para la venta D. tortillas y que su hijo tenga sus lentes para ver mejor y que mejore su rendimiento escolar porque a veces él se siente deprimido por qué no pueD. distinguir lo que le ponen en la pizarra
sus aspiraciones son que su negocio crezca y sacar mejores ganancias y que su hijo Gerson se motive a seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Gilma lives in San Miguel, department of San Miguel. She is a single mother and has three children (Gerson, Oscar and Xiomara). Her husband abandoned them several years ago. Since then she has been selling tortillas to support her children. She started selling tortillas 5 years ago and she sells them twice a day, from 6 to 7 in the morning. Out of her three children only the two boys are in school. The girl, Xiomara, who is 17 years old, doesn't, and has been working with Gilma selling tortillas since she was very young. This is because their financial situation was desperate and Gilma had no other option than to show her daughter her skills to help them improve their living conditions. The loan will be invested in the purchase of corn, wood and other products for the preparation of tortillas. With the money she will also buy her son Gerson a pair of glasses because he has sight problems. The loan will enable her to store raw materials for her tortillas and her son to see well and perform better at school; sometimes he feels sad because he can't see what's on the blackboard. She hopes that her business will grow and give better profits and that her son Gerson will find the motivation to continue to study.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn, wood and other products to make tortillas

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
Esta clienta madre de familia de dos niños  y estos se en encuentra en edad escolar.
El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de materiales de construcción ya que va a reparar el techo de su casa de habitación.
Ella dice que gracias a  los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel  ha podido mejorar su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
This client is the mother of two children who are school aged. The requested loan is for building materials and supplies to repair her roof. She says that thanks to Ceprodel loans she has been able to repair her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia K. is 43 years old and married. Her husband is a constructor and they have seven children aged between 2 and 29 whom they hope to educate to the university level. Her business is located in Mwingi but served by the Thika Branch. Thika is the region in Kenya known for the production of pineapples. 

She has been selling goats to the local people for the last three years. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is getting food for the goats during the dry season and actually, some goats die during this period. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more goats to meet her customers' demand. She sees diversifying the business to cereals in the future. She describes herself as hardworking, social and responsible.

loans.use: To buy more goats

loans.name: Sharon Juliah

texts.en:
Sharon Juliah K. is 24 years old, separated and has one child age, age six, who is in grade two. She runs a salon in Karionbangi's open air market (stall number 600) and most of her customers are youths and Ladies, and  she also plaits for pupils at Joy Academy School on a monthly basis. Her monthly income has risen to Kshs.12, 000 in  the three years that she is been operating the business.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a Credit Officer and she has never borrowed from any other MFI.Juliah is applying for her first loan of Kshs.15,000  from KADET LTD and she intends to buy a blow dryer worth Kshs.5,000 and  beauty products worth  Kshs.10,000 for the salon work to progress well.

Sharon hopes to save some of the income earned to open a beauty shop and a school, as this will help her to serve her customers who are increasing in great numbers due to the satisfactory services she offers, hence be able to provide the basic needs to the family.

loans.use: Buying a blow dryer worth Kshs.5,000 and beauty products worth Kshs.10,000

loans.name: Dalisay

texts.en: Dalisay L. owns and operates a mini-restaurant serving a variety of different meals to customers in her community. She is 41 years old, married and has three grown-up children. She is from the village of Mahayahay, Iligan City. Dalisay has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Dalisay joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Dalisay is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase food and drinks for her restaurant. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food and drinks for a restaurant

location.town: Mahayahay, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Kisakyamaria Group-Jinja

texts.en: N. Betty is 45 years old and a member of KisaKyamaria group-Jinja. For ten years, Betty has been running a charcoal sales business in Jinja central market. Her customers are principally market vendors, hotel owners and restaurant owners. Betty, who is married with no children, says it’s a business she began with no prior experience. By her own account, she is a stickler for diligence. With this loan, she wants to purchase more bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Maria Linda

texts.en:
Maria Linda M. is from the city of Pallua Sur, Tuguegarao City. She is 38 years old. Maria Linda is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Maria Linda owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Maria Linda has been engaged in her business for more than six years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Maria Linda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Linda has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. Maria Linda is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Maria Linda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
Marleny tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a su familia en el caserío Punto Nueve del distrito de Lambayeque, una zona de pobladores humildes que se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, se encuentra situada a más de media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la elaboración de venta de comida. Ella prepara alimentos en su domicilio y los ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y personas que vienen a trabajar en la zona, adicionalmente vende cerveza y chicha los fines de semana. El negocio es de mucha ayuda para su familia, ya que por medio de el se encarga de ayudar al sostenimiento de su economia diaria.

Marleny desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de insumos para elaborar más platos de comida ya que la demanda por su negocio ha aumentado, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Marleny is 24 years old, single, and lives with her family in the Point Nine contry house of the Lambayeque district, an area of humble inhabitants who are mainly agricultural workers, and is located more than half an hour from the Chiclayo city.

She sells food. She prepares meals in her home and sells them to neighbors and people working in her area. She also sells beer and chicha (a local cornflour fermented drink) on weekends. The business helps her family a lot since it helps with financial maintenance.

Marleny wishes to expand her business with the purchase of more materials to make more food since the demand for her service has increased. This is why she requested from Edpyme Alternative a 1000 Peruvian Soles loan.

loans.use: To buy more materials to make more food expand her business.

loans.name: Virginia Francisca

texts.es:
La Señora. Virginia C. es socia del banco comunal Yanaturo, vive en la comunidad que lleva el mismo nombre en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por su belleza natural, su cultura, su gastronomía que deleita los paladares de propios y extraños, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora. Virginia tiene 36 años de edad, vive en unión libre y tiene 6 hijos de 20, 15, 12, 5, 2 y 1 año de edad, su primer hijo estudia, trabaja y ayuda en la economía del hogar, su segundo hijo estudia en el colegio, su tercera hija esta en la escuela, su cuarta hija estudia en el jardín de infantes. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y trabaja conduciendo un trailer, con el sacrificio y trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña Virginia se dedica a la venta de joyas y ropa, actividad que la realiza hace 14 años y su producto lo vende recorriendo su comunidad a sus amigas y conocidas. También se dedica a la cría de pollos, esta actividad la realiza hace 5 años.

Es el segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y sus vecinas le han incentivado a formar parte de la banco, su crédito lo va  a invertir en la compra de ropa para surtir mas su mercadería. Su meta es tener un almacén para vender sus productos en su propia casa.
texts.en:
Virginia is a member of the “Yanaturo” Communal Bank, and she lives in the community of the same name in the city of Cuenca.  This city is known for its natural beauty, culture, and a gastronomy that delights the taste of locals and outsiders.  Its people maintain their culture and traditions.

Virginia is 36 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 6 children, aged 20, 15, 12, 5, 2 and 1.  Her 1st child studies, works and helps in the household economy; her 2nd son is a student; her 3rd child, a daughter, is also in school; her 4th, a daughter, is in kindergarten.  Her husband is a trucker who hauls a trailer.  With much sacrifice and work by both, they have been able to construct their own house.

Virginia has sold jewelry and clothing in her community for 14 years, selling to friends and acquaintances.  She also raises chickens, which she has done for 5 years.

This is her 2nd loan with her communal bank.  Virginia's neighbors motivated her to join the bank.  The loan will be invested in buying clothes to expand her merchandise.  Virginia's goal is to have a store to sell her goods from her own home.

loans.use: TO BUY CLOTHES TO SELL

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 22-year-old single man from Lebanon living with his parents. Despite his young age, he has gained good experience working as a house painter, starting six years ago. He works on a freelance basis upon the customers’ request. As is common in Lebanon, he helps his father with the family income. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a compressor and paint for a new project. He needs to be prepared to satisfy the client and build a good business reputation. In the future, he hopes to continue the growth of his business and be able to take on construction projects in order to expand his business operation.

loans.use: to purchase a compressor and paint

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
Maria tiene 29 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 3 hijos.  Vive con su familia en el distrito de Catacaos en la Ciudad de Piura, a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del Departamento de de Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de sandalias y ropa en el mercado de su localidad.  Por la buena atención que brinda cuenta con una clientela fidelizada que la estima y la apoya.  Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza de animales como chanchos, pavos, patos y gallinas, los cuales engorda para venderlos posteriormente, con la finalidad de percibir ingresos y ayudar a su familia.

Maria quiere adquirir más mercadería para poder venderla y aumentar sus ingresos, para poder ayudar a su familia.  Para lograr su objetivo ha creido conveniente obtener un préstamo de Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 soles.
texts.en:
Maria is 29 years old, lives with her partner, and is the mother of 3 children.  She lives with her family in the Catacaos district of the city of Piura, 4 hours from the city of Ciclayo, capital of Lambayeque department.

She works selling sandals and clothes in her local market.  From the favorable attention she has gained she has a faithful clientele that thinks highly of her and helps her.  She also works raising animals such as pigs, turkeys, ducks, and chickens, which she fattens up to sell later, from which she gets her income and helps her family.

Maria wants to acquire more merchandise to sell in increase her income in order to help her family.  To achieve her goal she's decided to get a loan from Edpyme Alternative of 2,000 soles.

loans.use: Acquire more merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Parniati

texts.en:
Parniati is a 50-year-old lady. She is originally from Jombang, East Java – another province in Indonesia. She is married to Yadi, a 53-year-old man who is running a furniture business on a small scale. Parnati and Yadi have been blessed with two children: Siswoyo and Abdi. Both have graduated from school and are currently living in Jakarta. 

Parniati is running a food-stall business in Lili Market, about a 40-minute drive from Kupang City. She has been running this business for five years to support her husband, as his income from selling furniture is unstable as a result of expensive raw materials. Initially, Parniati aimed to run a second-hand clothes business, but this business will require her to move from one market to another market according to the market schedule. She then decided to run a food-stall business as she realized that not so many people run a similar business at the Lili Market, which is situated not far from her residence. 

To run the business, Paniati borrowed money from a cooperative with daily repayment. The interest rate charged was quite high, but Parniati didn’t have another option. Due to the limited capital that she has, Parniati couldn’t improve her business. She then heard about TLM's lending program and got interested in joining the program for its monthly repayment and achievable interest rate. 

Parniati is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 10,000,000 from TLM. Parniati plans to add more menus in her food stall, expand her food stall and buy a new table for the food stall. Parniati really hopes that the loan can help her to improve the business.

loans.use: To add more menus, expand the food stall and buy a new table

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is a single woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

She has operated a food selling business for the past two years, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Sophia faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. She hopes to open more businesses in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of Kikoi’s for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of Kikoi’s for sale.

loans.name: Doris Azucena

texts.es:
Doris, reside en Osicala departamento de Morazán, está casada y vive en casa de sus padres, se dedica a vender ropa, tiene 21 años de edad, Doris tiene un año de dedicarse al negocio, realizándolo todos los días de 8:00am a 4:00pm, visita casa por casa en los alrededores del lugar.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo que necesita para comprar ropa (pantalones, peluches y tarjetas) estos artículos los ofrecerá a los clientes, este préstamo le ayudara para tener a disponibilidad mercadería que puede ser demandada.
Las aspiraciones de Doris son adquirir un local estable en el centro De Osicala, aumentar el volumen de ventas y comprar en un futuro su propia casa.
texts.en: Doris lives in Osicala, a department of Morazan; she is married and lives at her parent's home.  Doris is 21 years old and has been selling clothes for a year, operating from 8AM to 4PM going door-to-door at nearby locations.   She is soliciting a loan needed to purchase clothing, ( pants, stuffed animals, and cards) items which would be offered to clients.  This loan will help her have at her disposal merchandise that could be on demand.  Doris aspires to have a stable location at the heart of Osicala, increase the volume of sales, and purchase her own home in the future.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise: Pants, Stuffed animals, cards

loans.name: Deylin Francisco

texts.es: El señor Daylin Francisco se dedica a brindar el servicio de  moto taxi, es un hombre muy responsable que disfruta de este medio de vida. Hace más de 4 años que ofrece este servicio y que siempre se preocupa por brindar una buena atención. Daylin se caracteriza por ser un padre responsable y que disfruta de su negocio y de interactuar con sus clientes. Lo que él quiere es incrementar las ganancias para brindarle más comodidades a su familia. El piensa en su futuro y en la de su familia, quiere brindarle una mejor calidad de vida, al igual lograr unas metas propuestas para crecer como persona. El financiamiento es para la compra de llantas, repuesto y tapizar asientos.
texts.en: Daylin Francisco provides moto-taxi transportation services.  He is a very responsible man who enjoys making his living in this way.  He has been providing these services for 4 years, and he is always concerned about providing the best possible service. Daylin is characterized as a responsible parent who enjoys his work and enjoys interacting with customers.  He wants to increase his earnings so that he can provide more comfortable conditions for his family.  He thinks about his future and that of his family; he wants to provide them with a better quality of life and also achieve his goal to grow as a person.  This loan will be used to purchase tires, spare parts and seat covers.

loans.use: to buy tires, spare parts and seat covers for his mototaxi.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en: Jimmy D. owns and operates a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, soap and biscuits in his community. He is 34 years old, married and has five school-aged children. They are from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. Jimmy has been in his business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Jimmy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Jimmy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Jimmy is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and beverages. This will be his second loan from HSPFI. He plans to use additional income to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for making meals

loans.name: Carlos Humberto

texts.es:
Carlos de 58 años, es un hombre trabajador que inicio su actividad en el taller de calzado de su padre cuando el falleció y  también alquilas departamentos.

El labora diariamente en el taller de calzados y cobrándole en cada quincena a  sus inquilinos. Le dificultad realizar los calzados cuando la gente se le va a quejar porque no le entregan a tiempo lo que ellos piden. Sus hijos están casados y viven fueran del país. 

Con el préstamo desea comprar materiales de confección de calzados para incrementar sus ingresos como pegamento, cuero, parches. En un futuro seguir en el negocio y terminar de arreglar sus departamentos de alquiler para un mejor acabado.
texts.en:
Carlos, age 58, is a hard-working man.  He started his business activity, a shoe shop, when his father died.  He also rents apartments.

He works every day in his shoe shop, and he collects from his renters every two weeks.  It is difficult for him to work on the shoes when people are going to complain to him because he does not deliver what they want on time.

His children are married and live outside of the country.

He wishes to use the loan to buy materials to make shoes in order to increase his earnings.  He will buy things like glue, leather, and patches.  

In the future he will continue with the business.  He will also finish fixing up the apartment rentals with better finishing touches.

loans.use: to buy glue, leather, and patches.

loans.name: Marta Magdalena

texts.es: Marta Magdalena D. sesenta años D. edad vive con su hijo en una casa propia. Ella posee una tienda que poco a poco ha ido abasteciendo D. productos. Marta piensa que cuando trabaja todo el día con esfuerzo una mejor vida para ella y su familia sale al encuentro; siempre esta entusiasta con muchas ganas D. trabajar y esa energía se la transmite a los clientes que la visitan, las personas siempre se van satisfechas porque les da un buen servicio y siempre encuentran en su tienda lo que buscan; es por eso que ella le solicita a INTEGRAL  un crédito que le permita comprar más productos como golosinas, granos básicos, bebidas, embutidos, jabones entre otros, para abastecer el negocio y no decepcionar a la clientela. Marta tiene confianza que todo su trabajo lograra satisfacer las necesidades D. su hogar y le permitirá en el futuro darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: Marta Magdalena is sixty years old and lives with her son in a house she owns.  She has a store that, little by little, she has supplied with products.  Marta believes that, when she works hard all day long, she will find a better life for herself and her family.  She is always enthusiastic and has a great desire to work, and this energy transmits itself to the customers who visit her.  They always leave satisfied, because she offers them quality service and they can find what they need in her store.  This is why she has turned to INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy more products such as snacks, basic grains, beverages, cold cuts and soaps, among other items, so she can supply her store and not let her customers down.  Marta has confidence that all her effort will satisfy her household’s needs and allow her to give her family a full life.

loans.use: buy snacks, basic grains, beverages, cold cuts and soaps.

loans.name: America

texts.es:
America es una mujer de 62 años de edad que vive en la zona rural del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz – Chiclayo. America siempre ha sido una mujer trabajadora y luchadora por el bienestar de sus hijos, quienes ahora son personas integras e  independientes.

La actividad que desarrolla America es la venta de comidas en el interior de un mercado del distrito de Chiclayo. America tiene gran experiencia en su negocio pues hace 20 años lo viene realizando. Ella se inicio como ayudante de cocina y su esfuerzo y dedicación le permitió tener su propio puesto de comida.  Los clientes de America están muy satisfechos con el servicio que ella brinda.

America tiene muchos deseos de mejorar su calidad de vida y por eso solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 3000 nuevos soles para mejorar su vivienda, exactamente para la reparación de sus servicios higiénicos y cocina que se encuentran en estado crítico. Ella desea arduamente esto y estaría muy agradecida de concedérsele el crédito pues le sería de gran utilidad.

America es un cliente reactivado de nuestra institución y solo ha trabajado con nosotros.
texts.en:
America is a 62 year-old woman who lives in the rural area of José Leonardo Ortiz district, Chiclayo.  America has always been a hard-working woman who has worked hard for the good of her children.  Her children are now grown up and live independently.

America's business activity is selling food in a market in Chiclayo district.  She has a lot of experience in her business, which she has been working in for 20 years.  She started out as an assistant cook and, through her efforts and commitment, she was able to acquire her own food stall.  America's customers are very satisfied with the service that she provides.

America has a great desire to improve her quality of life and, for this reason, she has requested a loan for 3,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which she will use to improve her home.  She will repair her bathroom and kitchen facilities which are in a critical condition.  She would really like to be able to carry out this work and would be very grateful for the loan as it would help her a lot.

America is a return client of our institution and has only worked with us.

loans.use: to repair the bathroom and kitchen facilities in her home

loans.name: Juliana.

texts.en:
Juliana is a lady who was married to Fedeline.  They have eight children, two of them are below the age of fithteen. She is now separated from her husband and lives in a two-room house with two persons per room in the Elemighong quarter in the Belo subdivision. Her first loan was given to her in 2010 and she invested it in the purchase of irish potatoes and beans to sell.

Juliana is requesting her second loan from GHAPE to do farming and also to buy irish potatoes, corn, fowls, tobacco and kerosene to resell. She plans to use the loan for 120,000 FCFA to buy irish potatoes for 30,000 FCFA, maize for 50,000 FCFA, fowls for 20,000 FCFA, tobacco for 10,000FCFA, kerosene for 10,000 FCFA.  She thinks she will succeed because she is always available at her business site to serve her clients and she makes sure her goods are always available for her customers at moderate prices. The loan will help the community since she sells what the people want. 

Juliana has faced challenges in her life.  One of her children had died, she felt sick for a long time, and her children ran and stayed in the bush for a night. The profit she will get from this loan will be used to pay tuition fees, hospital bills and food for the family. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because repayment can be made bit by bit, the interest rates are low, and GHAPE also gives out a training series on loan management.

About GHAPE 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy more items to resell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is married. She is 53 years old. She sells a variety of fruits and vegetables in their community. Yolanda has had this business for 10 years now.

Yolanda is requesting a loan of PHP6,000 as additional capital in selling. She will buy a larger volume of fruits and vegetables to sell around their village. Yolanda earns PHP500 each day doing this type of work.

In the future, Yolanda hopes that her business can expand to be able to sufficiently support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy a larger volume of fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Dora Elena

texts.es: Dora Elena de 36 años de edad, habita en casa familiar con sus dos hijos de 13 y 16 años, los cuales por el momento se encuentran estudiando. Dora es una mujer trabajadora que lucha día a día para sacar adelante a su querida familia. Se dedica a los negocios ya que vende diversidad de productos como: tortillas, bebidas y almuerzos. Es muy conocida en la zona gracias a su amabilidad, buena e higiénica comida que ofrece. Es una mujer responsable y confiable pero sobre toda con visión emprendedora ya que sueña con ver florecer su negocio y es por esta razón que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito para invertir en su negocio y comprar la materia prima necesaria como: arroz, carne, pollo, verduras, bebidas, maíz, y de mas artículos necesarios para preparar los ricos platillos y tortillas que cada día ofrece a sus clientes. Con esto espera mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Dora Elena is 36 years old. She lives in a house with her two children, aged 13 and 16. They are in school. Dora is a hardworking woman who struggles to get her beloved family ahead everyday. She works selling a variety of products, such as: tortillas, drinks and lunches. She is well known in the area thanks to her friendliness and the good and sanitary food she sells. She is a responsible and trustworthy woman who above all has an enterprising vision, since she dreams of making her business flourish. That is why she has decided to ask for this loan to invest in her business and buy ingredients such as: rice, meat, chciken, vegetables, drinks, corn, etc. as well as other necessary items to make the delicious dishes and tortillas that she offers to her customers. With this, she hopes to improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as: rice, meat, chicken, vegetables, drinks, corn, etc.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida, 48, is married and has one son and three daughters. Her husband is a farmer, he has some land planted with olive trees. 

Aida took out a $3,000 loan from FATEN to purchase baby olive trees for her husband to add to his olive grove to increase olive production. 

Aida's husband can't buy the trees now without a loan, as olives are a seasonal crop, and they are not in season right now, so he is short of cash. 

Aida is photographed in FATEN's branch in Jenin.

loans.use: to buy baby olive trees for her husband

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 45 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items for resale.

Imelda has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF. She has been running her sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from a carinderia (restaurant) and house rental.

Imelda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock for resale

loans.name: Kokou Edoh

texts.fr:
Kokou Edoh est un homme âgé de 49 ans. Il est marié å une commerçante et a 04 enfants. 
Kokou Edoh travaille comme imprimeur depuis 2004. Il sert ses clients dans un quartier de la place et achète les produits (intrants d’imprimerie) à LOME. 
Kokou Edoh a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter  des intrants d’imprimerie  pour accroitre son activité.
texts.en:
Kokou Edoh is a 49-year-old father of four, married to a shopkeeper.  He has worked as a printer since 2004.  He serves his customers in a central neighborhood and buys his printing supplies in Lomé.

Kokou Edoh requested his first loan from WAGES to buy printing supplies in order to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy printing supplies.

loans.name: Ammar

texts.en:
Ammar is a 37-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and child. He has been working in the construction field for the past 12 years. He works on a freelance basis and specializes in floor coverings and cleaning. His story illustrates the day-to-day challenges many people are facing in trying to help their families with their business income. 

Today, he is asking to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to invest in purchasing a floor polishing machine and new tools. In the future, he is planning to expand his business by opening his own construction office.

loans.use: to purchase a floor polishing machine and new tools

loans.name: 3.11.78 Thiệu Ngọc Group

texts.en:
Sen is 42 years old. She is married and has two children.

Sen is the group leader of the 3.11.78 Thiệu Ngọc solidarity group, which consists of three members.
 
She lives and works in the Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

Sen works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for six years. The main hardship that Sen faces in her business is the lack of capital. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase calves to raise and sell in the future. This is Sen's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Sen hopes to make enough money to provide for her children, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase calves to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Sra. María del Carmen cuenta con 66 años de edad, es casada su esposo se llama Germán es campesino.

Ella se dedica  al comercio vende comida por la noche, el cual su negocio le ayuda a mantener su familia ella invirtió su préstamo en la compra  de los insumos para elaborar su comida como son: aceite, chile, jitomate, cebolla, carne, pollo, etc.
