A la Sra. María del Carmen le gustaría tener una fonda, ella está pensando abrir un local para ahí establecer su fonda de comida ya que quiere hacerlo más grande.
texts.en:
Sra. María del Carmen is 66 years old and married to Germán, who is a farmer.

She is in the retail trade, selling food at night. Her business helps to maintain her family. María will invest her loan in the purchase of supplies for making her dishes such as oil, chili peppers, tomatoes, onions, meat, chicken, and other items.

Sra. María del Carmen likes having a business. She plans to open a shop where she can serve her food since she wants to have a bigger place.

loans.use: to buy oil, chili peppers, tomatoes, onions, meat, chicken, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 59 years old and has been widowed for almost 14 years. To support her children's education, she improved her house and has been offering rooms for rent, especially to students, for almost eight years. 

Virginia wants to construct new rooms and further expand her business to generate more income. Since she has insufficient funds, she is now asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy construction materials such as gravel, sand and cement to improve her business. She also wants to help students with the affordable rentals she offers. In the future, Virginia wants to increase her earnings and keep growing as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to improve her rooms for rent

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is 28 years old, married, and supports a family of six which includes his children (ages seven and four years old), his wife, and some family members. His wife is a business lady and she contributes to the family’s monthly income.  Reuben owns a retail shop in the Kaiboi trading center and has been in business for two years. He earns a monthly income of Kshs 8,000.

Reuben has borrowed a loan of Kshs 10,000 from KADET which is his first loan, and he wishes to use this amount to purchase more stock for his shop. Some of the items he will add include flour, rice, sugar, biscuits, soft drinks, and many more things. He hopes to use the anticipated profits to plow back into the business and improve his family's living standards.

He hopes to expand his business and be able to support his family without difficulty.

loans.use: To purchase flour, rice, sugar, biscuits, soft drinks, and other stock for his shop

loans.name: Kolin

texts.en:
Kolin is 48 years old and lives in the town of Bungokho in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has five children,  four of whom are currently in school. For the past fourteen years, Kolin has been working hard to manage her distillery, in which she makes a traditional Ugandan drink called Waragi. 

To help expand her business, Kolin has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more Waragi ingredients and will help Kolin to generate greater profits and improve her family's welfare. Kolin hopes that in the future she will be able to continue growing her business. 

Kolin is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves entrepreneurs like Kolin with small business who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients to distill a traditional Ugandan drink called Waragi.

loans.name: Sergio Regino

texts.es: Sergio Regino tiene 62 años, el un hombre pensionado el motivo del crédito que realiza es para realizarle mejoras a su vivienda ya que quiere construir un cuarto y colocar cerámica necesita comprar cemento, pega, pago de mano de obra. Es una persona que siempre está motivada por el cambio el deseo de superación personal, Sergio necesita realizar estas remodelaciones que son necesarias en su vivienda. Sueña con seguir proporcionando mejoras a su hogar.
texts.en: Sergio Regino is 62 years old, on a pension, and is asking for a loan in order to improve his housing as he wants to build a room and to lay down ceramic, and he needs to buy cement, glue, and to pay for the labor. He is a person that always is motivated by the desire for personal success. Sergio needs to make these renovations to his house. He dreams of continuing to make improvements to his home.

loans.use: to buy ceramic, cement, glue, and to pay for the labor

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es:
Paulino de 45 años, está casado con Rosa de 44 años, con quien tiene 5 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Cada mañana que despierta  y ve a lo lejos los rayos del sol recuerda que ya son las horas para enrumbar a las labores agrícolas. Gracias a las enseñanzas que le dejó su padre, hoy cultiva y produce cacao y café, productos que han logrado tener posionamiento en el mercado nacionale e internacional.
Asimismo sus produtos son cultivados de manera ogánica utilizando fertilizantes naturales, es por ello que tiene mucha demanda su producción. Ahora Paulino está obteniendo buenos ingresos económicos, esto se debe a la dedicación  en su trabajo. Usualmente trabaja con su pareja, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, pero en temporada de cosecha necesita de algunos peones para que faciliten la extracción de sus productos. En un futuro cercano  incrementará su campo agrícola, de esta manera obtendrá más ganancias. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá para contratar peones y lo ayuden a mantener su campo agícola libre de maleza.
texts.en:
Paulino, age 45, is married to Rosa, age 44. They have five children. They live together in their own home in the Pichari district. Every morning, when he wakes up and sees the distant rays of the sun, he knows it's time to start working on the farm. Thanks to his father's teaching, he now cultivates cocoa and coffee, which he is able to sell nationally and internationally.
He farms organically and with natural fertilizers, so his crops are in great demand. Paulino is currently making a good income, thanks to his dedication to his work. He normally works with Rosa, but sometimes their children help out as well. During the harvest season he needs to hire labourers to help out. In the near future, he will expand his lands in order to make a better income. 
This will be his second loan with MFP, so he promises to pay his quotas punctually. With the 1,500 nuevos soles, he will invest in hiring labourers to help him keep his fields free of weeds.

loans.use: to hire labourers.

loans.name: Norma Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Norma tiene 37 años y vive en la aldea de Altos de Santa Fe en el municipio de Choloma. Norma es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos de 12 y 13 años de edad, los cuales están en el colegio. 

Doña Norma vende mercadería como ropa (de dama, caballero, niño), juguetes y utensilios para la cocina entre otras cosas. Inició el negocio hace 5 años debido a la necesidad de generar ingresos para ayudar a sus hijos a salir adelante. Comenzó vendiendo poco hasta crecer el negocio. Sacó dos créditos  de L7000 y L10,500 para surtir el negocio y logró aumentar las ventas y le ayudó a dar un mejor nivel de vida para su familia. Hoy en día trabaja 10 horas diarias vendiendo sus productos. 

Solicitó este crédito de L18,000 para surtir su inventario con la compra de mercadería para la temporada navideña.  Ella espera aumentar sus ventas en esta temporada. Su sueño es ver a sus hijos graduarse.
texts.en:
Sra. Norma is 37 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Altos de Santa Fe in the town of Choloma. She is a single mother with two children (ages 12 and 13) who are in high school.

Doña Norma sells merchandise such as clothing (for women, men, and children), toys, cooking utensils, and other products. She started this business five years ago because she needed to generate income to help her children get ahead. Norma started with little and was able to grow her business. She received two previous loans of 7000 HNL and 10,500 HNL to restock her business and was able to increase her sales, which helped to improve her family’s standard of living. Today she works 10 hours each day selling her products.

Norma is requesting a loan of 18,000 HNL so that she can restock her inventory by purchasing merchandise for the Christmas season. She hopes to increase her sales during this time. Her dream is to see her children graduate.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chanthan pictured here) is 31 years old and his wife, Sarim, is 30 years old. They have been married for eight years and have two young children, one son and one daughter. The family is living in a village outside of Phnom Penh City.

Chanthan is a chef; he cooks for wedding parties and other occasions. He also drives a motor taxi when he is free. His wife is a garment worker. He is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to assist in his parents’ business making prahoc (a popular Cambodian condiment made of fermented fish paste and salt). Chantha’s parents will use the loan to buy small fish and other ingredients to make prahoc.

loans.use: To help his parents buy small fish and other ingredients to make prahoc.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en: Anne is 44 years old.  She sells clothes to earn a living. She has improved her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has managed to access financial resources easily.  Her desire is to open other branches of her business.  She has requested for a loan of 60, 000 Kenya shillings to open another outlet of her business.

loans.use: To open another outlet of her business

loans.name: Maqboolan's Group

texts.en:
Maqboolan is an embroidery expert. Her work is home based. She crafts beautiful embroidered designs on clothes which helps attract many customers towards her.  

She is very dedicated to her work and the reason is she loves doing it. She not only manages her household work and takes care of her family but also gives required time to her work. She is good administrator and manages the household expenses with limited resources.  

Her husband is an electrician by profession. He offers electricity repair services to the clients on demand. 

She is the mother of five children: three sons and two daughters. Her eldest son is an ice-cream seller while the other two are studying at a school and others stay at home. 

She has requested for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother who is a fruit seller by profession. He has a cart on which he keeps fruit and he visits different areas and streets in order to sell it.  He will invest the loan in order to buy seasonal fruits in large quantities for reselling and generating more revenue. 

He has been operating his business for the past seven years and Maqboolan is hopeful that her brother’s business will improve a lot after the loan investment. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady holding a book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Maqboolan”.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits to resell.

loans.name: Zillia

texts.en:
Zillia is 23 years old and a mother of one child. She sells fruits and vegetables and has been in the business for the last two years, with a monthly profit of KES 8,000. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and she is applying for her first loan of KES.20,000 from the company, with which she intends to add additional stock of mangoes, pineapples, kale and other vegetables for sale. 

The client will save the anticipated profit and help take care of her child. In the future, Zillia hopes to grow her business and also venture into other investments.

loans.use: to add stock of mangoes, pineapples, kale, and other vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Rosa Griselda

texts.es: Rosa Griselda de 44 años de edad, vive junto a sus dos hijos, ella es madre soltera y es una persona muy responsable. Ella posee una tienda, en la cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad, tanto alimenticios como de primera necesidad en el hogar, la cual está ubicada en su casa de habitación, en donde desde hace 5 años que se dedica a ella. Rosa solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir la tienda comprando más pan, leche, jugos y otros productos más, los cuales poseen mayor demanda, de esta forma  espera mejorar sus ventas. Rosa  es una mujer muy trabajadora la cual desea mejorar su negocio y de esta forma contar con una mejor estabilidad y de esta misma forma brindarle un mejor futuro a sus hijos en el cual pueda contar con todo lo necesario para vivir mejor.

loans.use: Compra de granos básicos y huevos para comercializar

loans.name: Neang's Group

texts.en:
Neang is a married woman living in a rural village located in the Phnom Proek district of Battambang province. She is 32 years old and has three children. To make a living, she has been growing cassava and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for 12 years, earning about 30,000 KHR of which she is able to save about 25,000 KHR each day.

Neang is in her first loan cycle with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a resident of Bakuli Zulila zone and married with two children who both attend school.

William is a boda-boda cyclist (motorcycle taxi), and this is his main source of income. He is a first time borrower of Ugafode Microfinance Ltd (MDI), and he has applied for a loan of UGX1,000,000 (One million shillings) to develop his plot of land that he bought using the savings from ferrying customers on the motorcycle.

William's dream is to escape the burden of renting by owning his own house. He is a hardworking and honest man.

William is determined to boost his business and achieve his long-term dream of constructing a house. He really appreciates Kiva's support and partnership.

loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fruits for sale to hotels.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Miguel is not only a successful farmer, he is the leader of the Primero de Agosto Asssociation that is comprised of Rice Farmers from Santa Lucia. He is one of the main organizers of their communal bank, having the responsibility of organizing the members and being the liaison with Mifex. He is also a very efficient rice farmer who has gained the respect of the community for his dedication to helping others. He will use the loan, like the other members of the communal bank, to purchase the necessary materials to plant and cultivate rice.

The Primero de Agosto Communal Bank in Santa Lucia

Miguel is part of one of the newest Communal Banks in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program: the Primero de Agosto Communal Bank. All bank members are part of the Association of Rice Farmers in Santa Lucia, and they will use these microloans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. As members of a communal bank, they are all guarantors for each other's loans. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Primero de Agosto Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many microfinance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we work with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about the commnity of Santa Lucia, compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program. Special thanks to Mario Balazantegui who provided expert insight and contributed to the development of the alliances with the local organizations.

Economy of Santa Lucia

Santa Lucia County has a population of about 33,000 people. The region is fit for rice cultivating because it is not in the lowlands and therefore it is not at risk of flooding. There is also great access to water because of the Daule River, which is accessible to many of the farmers in the area. About 70% of the farmers have basic infrastructure for watering their crops.

Rice production is the main economic activity of the area, as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Almost everyone is either directly or indirectly involved with the rice production, as they produce, commercialize or participate in activities that add value to the product. Within the county, there is a small town also named Santa Lucia. The town is filled with many small businesses and it serves as the social and commercial hub of the area.

Rice Farming in Santa Lucia

Most of the people in the Santa Lucia area are small farmers. They produce about 100 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds and plowing. The farmers then fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them harvest their crop. A risk factor does exist in rice farming because of drought, but in Santa Lucia this is somewhat mitigated by the access to water form the nearby river.

Access to Credit

The biggest struggle in the area has been the lack of credit. Because people do not have access to formal financial services, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also often lack skills and knowledge of how to commercialize their product and get fair prices for their crops.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will be used to to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. They will also be used to prepare the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase other materials. The loan repayment schedule is different from the typical microentrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them to repay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Plant and cultivate rice

loans.name: Bi

texts.en: Bi is 38 years old. Her husband is 52 years old. They have 5 sons and a daughter between 11 and 25. Only the daughter is attending school; the 5 other sons stopped going to school to help their parents cultivate the field. They have 2000(m2) land for growing watermelons. Their income is $12 per person/month. They hope to get a loan of $75 to increase watermelon production by supplying fertilizer and perform this activity again in future. They will repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To increase watermelon production by supplying fertilizer.

loans.name: Melba Marina

texts.en:
For 3 years and a half, I have a small business selling soft drinks and cakes. It allows me to help my family because I’m too old to work.

Now, I need to buy more soft drinks, juices and flour to make cakes. My best clients are all my neighbors in my community. I’ll be grateful if you can help me to provide them a better service.

Translated from Spanish by Arnaud Braud, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo un pequeño negocio de venta de refrescos y pasteles desde hace 3 años y medio con el cual puedo ayudar a mi familia, ya que no puedo trabajar a mi edad.

Ahora necesito comprar mas refresco, jugos y harina para hacer pasteles. Mis mejores clientes son todos mis vecinos de mi barrio. Os agradeceré que me ayuden para poder dar un mejor servicio en mi negocio.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, juices and flour to make cakes

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.es:
Anastacio A. is 41 years old. He comes from the Roque Gonzalez city (a city next to Carapegua). He is married to Mrs. Estela Duare and have three children. Together they have a pantry where both of them work at. They started it by buying coal at wholesale and packing it in smaller bags to sell to the public. They used a bicycle to distribute it throughout the town. That's how they built capital to open a small warehouse.

After some time he had a tough experience, one of his children got sick and he almost lost everything. He had a house and his own lot but due to the medical expenses that he carried and overwhelm by the situation, he had to sell both. His wife had to travel to Argentina to work as a domestic employee (maid) because it was the only solution for them at that moment.

Today their quality of life has improve due to the fact that all of their children have a career and in this way they contribute to the well-being of the family. Today they have establish their warehouse out of their home and they sell all kinds of staple groceries. The loan is for buying sugar, herbs, noodles, bread, and milk to supply their pantry.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer>

Anastacio A. tiene 41 años es de la ciudad de Roque González (ciudad aledaña a Carapeguá) está casado con la señora Estela Duarte y tienen tres hijos. Tienen una despensa que junto con su esposa llevan adelante, se han iniciado comprando carbón por cantidad y empaquetando en bolsas pequeñas, tenía una bicicleta y lo distribuía por el barrio así se hizo de capital y se animó a abrir un pequeño almacén. Tiempo después tuvo una dura experiencia, se enfermó su hijo y perdió casi todo. El tenía casa y terreno propio, pero debido a los gastos que acarreaba la enfermedad de su hijo y agobiado por la situación los vendió. Su esposa tuvo que viajar a la Argentina a trabajar como empleada doméstica porque era la única salida que encontró en ese momento. Hoy día su nivel de vida mejoró ya que sus hijos tienen profesión y de esta manera colaboran con el sustento de la familia. Hoy tienen ya establecido su almacén en su casa y vende todo tipo de insumos de primera necesidad. El crédito es para compra de azúcar, yerba, fideo, pan, leche.

loans.use: Buying groceries like: sugar, noodles, milk , bread, and herbs to supply his pantry.

loans.name: Naz

texts.en: I am Naz B. from Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. I live in a small rented house with my husband and three children. I used to make decorative tassels but now due to my weak eyesight I have had to quit that business. My husband operates a fruit cart. My eldest son is an apprentice at an auto workshop, whereas the younger one is an apprentice at a blacksmith shop. My eldest son has now attained a suitable level of expertise and he wishes to open up his own auto workshop. We are poor people and we do not have the required start up finances. Please lend us US$350 .

loans.use: Open up an auto workshop.

loans.name: Clement

texts.en: Clement Mensah is married with an 8 month old baby. His wife is a seamstress and she is working very hard to support her husband financially. Clement is a trader who deals in building tools and materials. His business is doing very well and he wants additional capital to buy more materials for his store.  He is asking for $1,200 to buy more nails, pick-axes, shovels, electrical appliances, electrical frames, and paint to meet customer demand.

loans.use: To buy more nails, pick-axes, shovels, electrical appliances, electrical frames, and paint to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Zafar

texts.ru:
Zafar was born in 1973 and is married with two children. His wife stays home and he is the sole provider for his children. He rents a small space for his business at the Rudaki district market, where he sells equipment and accessories for mobile phones. He purchases his inventory wholesale from China.

Zafar is experienced and has been in business for five years. He has reliable suppliers and many clients. Right now, it's especially important for him to stock mobile phone accessories and DVDs. He plans to use his loan to purchase these goods.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer.

Зафар арендует одно небольшое помешения для своего бизнеса на рынке Рудаки пос Сомониен.Его бизнес торговля орг техникой и аксесуарами к мобилным телефонам.Товары он закупает у оптовиков из Китая большими партиями.Он сам 1973 года рождения, женат и имеет 2 детей.жена домохозайка и семью кормит только он.Этим видом бизнеса он занимается уже 5 лет.Он достаточно опытен и имеет постоянных постовщиков так же у него много клиентов.Особенно хорошо сейчас имеет оборот мобильные аксесуары и DVD.Свой будущий займ он планирует потратить на покупку именно этих товаров.

loans.use: Business expansion.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es:
For the past three years, Mr. Manuel M. has dedicated himself to running an electrical automotive repair shop in the Sauce district of León, Nicaragua. He gained his skills in the repair of cars and motorcycles three years ago, which is when he began his business.

Manuel is the father of a young school-aged son, and for this reason he exerts himself every day in order to provide his child with an education and to supply all of his child's needs.

In spite of his difficult economic situation, Mr. Manuel M. has managed to maintain his immediate family and to better his financial circumstances. He has done this thanks to the support of the lending organization Ceprodel, which over the past year has given him a total of 10 credits that he has used to improve the condition of his business.

Currently Manuel needs to invest in the purchase of tools since the ones he owns are in disrepair. In addition, he needs to purchase new tools in order to continue providing his clients with high quality service.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 3 años, en el municipio de el Sauce en la ciudad de León, el señor Manuel M. se dedica al negocio de taller de electricidad automotriz teniendo destrezas en la reparación de automóviles y motocicletas desde hace 3 años que es el tiempo en que inicio su negocio.

Es padre de un pequeño hijo en edad escolar y por esta razón día a día se esfuerza para brindarle su educación y suplir todas sus necesidades.

A pesar de la difícil situación económica que atraviesa el señor Manuel Matus, ha logrado mantener su núcleo familiar y mejorar su condición económica. Esto lo ha realizado gracias al apoyo que le ha brindado Ceprodel desde hace un año con un total de 10 créditos que los ha utilizado para mejorar la condición de su negocio.

Su necesidad actualmente es la urgencia de invertir en la compra de herramientas debido a que las que posee se encuentran en mal estado y además debe de adquirir otras nuevas herramientas que nunca ha tenido para continuar brindando a sus clientes un servicio de alta calidad.

loans.use: To purchase tools for the repair of cars and motorcycles

loans.name: Thi Thoa's Group

texts.vi:
Ms. Hue, 30 years old, has two children who are still in school. Everyday, besides farming, she goes to the market to collect recyclables, with the hope to increase her family income. On average, her family income is about 100,000VND a day (roughly $6.25 per day). Ms. Hue has introduced Ms. Thoa, 31 years old, about microcredit offered by Binh Minh cdc (Kiva Partner in Vietnam), where borrowers who do no need to have so much collaterals can still borrow money. Microcredit by Binh Minh is also good for them because the will not need to go far away to repay their loan. Ms. Thoa then also wants to borrow money to collect metal recyclables, which she hopes will increase her famiy's income. Together, they propose to borrow 275USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Huế, 30 tuổi, có hai con đang đi học. Ngoài việc chăm lo công việc đồng áng, chị còn đi chợ sắt vụn hàng ngày để tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Thu nhập trung bình của gia đình chị khoàng 100000 đồng/ngày. Chị vay 2006000 đồng để thêm vốn đi chợ. Được chị Huế giới thiệu và tuyên truyền những lợi ích thiết thực mà chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminhcdc đem lại như không phải thế chấp sổ đỏ và đi lại xa xôi để trả tiền, chị Thoa, 31 tuổi, cũng vay vốn để đi chợ sắt tăng gia thu nhập.

loans.use: to collect metal recyclables

loans.name: I Putu Sugama

texts.id:
I Putu Sugama lives in Manistutu village in West Bali where almost 90% of the population works as farmers. He himself is a paddy farmer and he owns a land of 1 hectare (around 10,000 square meter). Ones of the important factors in farming are fertilizer and pesticide. Those are needed to maintain the quality of the paddy. At the moment I Putu Sugama is having limited capital to spend on fertilizer and pesticide as he already used most of his money to finance daily farming works. He wants to use the loan money to buy fertilizer and pesticide to be used at his paddy field.

I Putu is a hard worker and he believes the importance to work really hard for his paddy field in order to enable him to get maximal result so he can improve his family's well fare, to put on saving and also to repay his loan on time.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

I Putu Sugama tinggal di desa Manistutu, sebuah desa di Bali Barat yang mana hampir 90 % penduduknya bermata pencaharian sebagai petani. Khusus untuk lingkungan I Putu Sugama, sebagian besar petani bercocok tanam dengan menanam padi. Hal ini disebabkan karena pengairan diwilayah tersebut mencukupi untuk menanam padi. I Putu Sugama memiliki lahan seluas 1 hektar yang ia kerjakan seorang diri. Pada masa tanam saat ini, tanaman padi sangat membutuhkan pupuk dan anti hama untuk menjaga kwalitas yang didapat saat panen nanti. I Putu Sugama membutuhkan dana untuk membeli pupuk dan anti hama yang diperlukan karena semua dana yang dimilikinya sudah diinvestasikan untuk pengolahan sawahnya. Dengan pinjaman yang didapatnya, akan dipergunakan dengan sebaik – baiknya untuk pengolahan sawahnya. I Putu Sugama adalah pekerja keras, sawahnya dikerjakan dengan baik karena ia ingin mendapatkan hasil yang maksimal, sehingga dengan hasil yang maksimal ia bisa mencukupi kebutuhan keluarganya, menabung dan mengembalikan pinjaman tepat waktu.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide (membeli pupuk dan anti hama)

loans.name: Sefelmira

texts.es:
The friends of Sefelmira have been working as micro-empresarios for some time. One day they convinced her to attend a seminar on micro-business organized by EDAPROSPO. She attended a little fearfully and, even with many doubts, she decided to undertake a business. Her problem was that she did not know what to sell or what to produce that would be profitable. So that she decided to learn a method of making leather sandals. At present, she has already run her business for two and a half years, working from orders that she receives from people or from some stores. She says that her better season for production and sales is the second semester of each year, when she requires the aid of two people to be able to supply the demand. Today Sefelmira does not regret starting her micro-business. With the income she can help her husband to maintain her two small children.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Las amigas de Sefelmira llevan más tiempo como microempresarias; un buen dia la convencieron de asistir a una capacitacion de microempresas organizada por EDAPROSPO. Ella asistio un poco temerosa y aun con muchas dudas, decidio emprender una empresa. El problema suyo era no saber qué vender o qué producir que sea rentable. Asi que decidio aprender un metodo de hacer sandalias de cuero. Actualmente, ya lleva dos años y medio trabajando segun recibe pedidos de personas o de algunas tiendas. Ella afirma que su mejor temporada de produccion y ventas es el segundo semestre de cada año, es ahi cuando requiere de la ayuda de dos personas para poder abastecerse. Hoy en dia Sefelmira no se arrepiente de haberse de animado a poner su microempresa, con los ingreso ella puede ayudar a su esposo a mantener a sus dos hijos menores.

loans.use: To buy materials for making sandals.

loans.name: Savinh

texts.en:
Mrs. Savinh D., 50, and her husband, Mr. Boeun Chea, 64, who live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, have been married for thirty years and have six children, two daughters and four sons. Three of their children are married and live outside the family home. Of the other three children, one is a soldier, another is a construction worker, and the youngest one is in school.

Mrs. Savinh has been a silk weaver since she was 27 years old, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village who then sells them in Phnom Penh; Mr. Boeun is an artist. Mrs. Savinh is now requesting a loan of $100 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Sokhun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhun C., 34, and her husband, Mr. Chan Chok , 30, live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers north of Phnom Penh. They were married in 2000 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. Two of them are in a local school. 

Mrs. Sokhun has been a weaver since 1987, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to a middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Mr. Chan has a new job constructing wooden houses. Before started this business, he was also a silk weaver.

Sokhun is requesting a loan of US$600 to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to drive to work. Good transportation will allow him to spend more time on the job instead of being in transit.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her husband to drive to work.

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr:
Aissatou F. is married and has been a member of the Tenghory Transgambian bank for seven years. She trades in peanuts, also known as monkey nuts, and makes a beverage whose ingredients include monkey bread fruit, dried red hibiscus flowers, milk and sugar. Aissatou wants to improve their standard of living and please her customers. She is seeking a loan that would be repaid in a lump sum in six months’ time.

Translated from French by Joyce, Kiva Volunteer.

Aissatou F., mariée est membre du banc villageois de Tenghory Transgambienne depuis 7 ans. Elle achète et revendre des arachides et fait des jus à base de pain de singe, bissap, lait et sucre. Aissatou souhaite améliorer ses conditions de vie et satisfaire sa clientèle. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Sale of peanuts and fruit beverages

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
This is the second time that Mrs. Sam S. A. has asked for a loan to improve her business. She is a pig breeder in Dei Edth Kaoh Phos Village in Kandal Province. In her business, Mrs. Sam S. A. raises pigs under the house and it is very difficult for her to look after her pigs.

Thus, Mrs. Sam S. A. decided to ask for a loan to buy cement and brick in order to build a piggery. Her husband, Mr. Tith Chanreaksmey, is a jewelry maker who melts gold to make jewelry. Mrs. Sam S. A. is 43 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom owns a small jewelry store in the local market while three others are attending school. The youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is only four. Mrs. Sam S. A.'s husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy cement and brick in order to build a piggery

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy O. is 40 years old and happily married with four children. She lives in Badagry in Lagos State, Nigeria. Joy owns a restaurant where she sells cooked foods, like beans, rice, and yams. She also sells drinks. She learned to cook for commercial purposes from her late mother.

Joy has been a LAPO client for the past two years. She needs a loan for $525 to buy more drinks and foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you all for making this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and food stuffs to cook and sell.

loans.name: Aimée

texts.fr: Dame Q. Aimée est née le 28/04/1967 à Cotonou et est originaire de ouidah, ville historique du département de l'Atlantique. Elle est mariée à DOSSOUGOUIN Frédéric, gérant d'une station d'essence et est mère de 02 enfants, Razack 13 ans en classe de 4éme et la seconde Brigitte 09ans est en classe de CM1. Après son echec au Brevet d'Etude du Premier Cycle (BEPC), sa mère l'a initié à la vente de divers articles à savoir savons, lait, conserves, pâtes alimentaires, huile végétale, etc qu'elle continue de vendre jusqu'à ce jour.  En vue de renforcer son activité et de pouvoir répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle, elle sollicite ce second prêt. Elle compte s'approvisionner  en riz , lait en boîte , sucre et  pâte alimentaire.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aimée Q. was born on 04/28/1967 in Cotonou, she is from Ouidah, a historic town in the Atlantic department. She is married to Frederic DOSSOUGOUIN, a gas station manager, and is the mother of 2 children, Razack - 13 - in 8th grade and Brigitte - 9 -in 4th grade.

After failing her middle school exit exam in 9th grade, her mother initiated her to the sale of various goods such as soap, milk, canned good, dry pasta, vegetable oil etc. that she continues to sell up to now. In order to strengthen her business and to better meet her customers’ needs, she is requesting this second loan. She hopes to be able to stock up on rice, sugar and dry pasta.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 3 bags of rice, a box of milk, a box of sugar, and 4 boxes of dry pasta.

loans.name: Aura Luz's Group

texts.es:
La señora emprendedora Aura Luz P. R. tiene la edad de 47 años, su estado civil es casada, esta señora tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 2 dependen de ella una niña de 19 años de edad que hará el examen de admisión de la universidad publica de la unan- león y un varón de 17 años de edad que también realizara el examen en esa misma universidad, su compañero de vida labora como artesano en la elaboración de calzado, Doña Aura tiene sueños de instalar su negocio en un lugar mas cómodo para sus clientes en donde puedan deleitarse y disfrutar de sus deliciosos nacatamales para que estos a su vez logren tener las comodidades necesaria en un establecimiento, también como propósito esta el seguir ayudando a sus hijos ya que ellos son unas de las prioridades mas importantes para ella asegurarles a sus hijos un futuro seguro en estudios.



Su actividad económica es la elaboración de nacatamal y sus derivados como lo es: frito, chicharrón, chingaste  y adobado por lo que su ubicación es en su casa de habitación cancha posada del sol ½ C abajo en león , ella tiene de poseer este negocio alrededor de 25 años, sus inicios empiezan desde que tiene la edad de 7 años por  lo que el negocio le pertenecía  a su mama ya que Doña Aura ayudaba en la elaboración y al adquirir la practica su mama decide dejarle el negocio a ella  para que este no pierda los antecedentes familiares y desde entonces es ella quien ha tenido a cargo este negocio, por lo que es necesario el financiamiento para la compra de capital de trabajo ya que necesita realizar la compra de maíz, la hoja para envolver el nacatamal y los diferentes productos para  la elaboración del mismo.
texts.en:
The entereprising lady, Mrs. Aura Luz P. R. is 47 years old, married with 5 children, 2 still depend on her, a 19 year-old girl and a 17 year-old boy, both in the process of applying to the public university UNAN-León. Her life partner works in the manufacture of footwear. It is Doña Aura's dream to set up her business at a comfortable place for her clients where they can enjoy her delicious "nacatamales" with all the necessary comodities. She also wishes to go on supporting her children as it is one of her priorities to secure a safe study environment in the future for her children. For a living she makes "nacatamales" and the by-products such as "frito", "chicharrón", "chingaste" and "adobado" at her house located at Cancha Posada del Sol 1/2 C, abajo, in León. She has had this business for about 25 years. She started when she was 7, the owner of the business was her mother and Doña Aura helped in the preparation, and when experienced, her mother decided to let her take over the business to keep it in the family and since then she has been in charge. She needs the loan as work capital as she has to buy corn, leaves to wrap up the "nacatamal", and the raw materials for the production.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Mwanaisha's Group

texts.en:
Mwanaisha Hukongo, age 40, is a divorcee with one son age fifteen. She also takes care of her mother and her father. She has a food business which she started 6 years ago, and she works daily from 6am until 1pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around US$ 292.

This will be Mwanaisha’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase her stock and she repaid the loan successfully. She now hopes for the second loan to buy more foods for her food business.

Mwanaisha will share this loan with her subgroup Kariakoo, which has five members who have shops or are tailors or sell clothes. The members of the subgroup hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Mwanaisha is 2nd from left, behind.

loans.use: To buy more foods for her food business

loans.name: Bin

texts.en:
Bin K., 55, pictured here, is married and lives with her husband in Batheay district, Kampong Cham province. She runs a grocery store from her home and is able to make US$ 4 a day, while her husband, Peam Pan, is a local teacher at a state school. On average, he makes US$ 1 a day. He has been teaching since 1990. This couple has four children; three of them are students and one is a professional tailor.

Since a tailoring business is lucrative and makes more money to help share the cost of living, Mrs. Bin K. is requesting a loan from Kiva via Credit to open a tailor shop for her daughter.

loans.use: To invest in starting up a tailoring business

loans.name: Dorice

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania. This is 37-year-old Dorice L. from Mbeya. She is married with 4 children, between the ages of 6 and 18. Dorice has been running a poultry business since 2007. This client’s business is buying small chicks, raising them, and selling them when they grow up and are ready for consumption.

Dorice works at the business 6 hours per day, 7 days per week and is assisted by her husband. Dorice currently earns about 110 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase about 150 chickens to increase her project. In the future, she plans to start a new business. Dorice thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase about 150 chickens to increase her project

loans.name: Ghazala M. Arsh Group

texts.en:
Ghazala baji is a 31-year-old married woman and a citizen of Borewala, Pakistan for the past 31 years. She is married to a man named M. Arshad and he is a bus driver. Ghazala baji works in a decorative embroidery business. She prepares embroidered clothes with new designs. Ghazala baji has a very artistic mind. She always gives her dresses a new look which attracts a good number of customers. She is applying for a loan to buy an embroidery machine which will help her make new embroidered dresses. 

She is the group leader of more women in her area. Nadeeman baji would like a loan to buy clothes for her clothes selling business. Niamatay baji would like a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Ameena baji would like a loan to buy animals (goats) for her animal selling business. Jamila baji would like a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine

loans.name: Cemara C Group

texts.en:
Cemara C Group is a group of 15 farmers who rely on farming and selling crops to meet their families' needs. This Group is led by Zakarias R., a 77 year old man. Zakarias lives in Niukbaun Village, Kupang District of East Nusa Tenggara Province in Indonesia. He is married and has been blessed with 3 children. His children are: Thobias R., 18 years old; Merry Rasi, 15 years old – in Junior High School Grade 3; and Marthen R., 13 years old. Both Thobias and Marthen are not at school because they want to help their father (Zakarias) to earn money by farming. In this village, Zakarias works as a farmer who finances his family and the education of his children by selling banana, coconut and cassava. Sometimes the daily income that he earns is not enough to meet his family's needs. This is the reason why Zakarias wants to run another business. He is requesting a loan amounting to Rp 3,200,000 to buy cattle to be fattened.  Zakarias is interested in joining the cattle fattening program because he can benefit by the profit of the cattle sale. He has a dream to send his children to the university. 

The other members of this group also face the same situation as Zakarias faces. Their income from farming is not enough to meet their family's needs. And like Zakarias, they also want to improve their standard of living by running another business. They are interested in the cattle fattening program because they feel that this program can help them to generate more income for their family and for that reason, they are requesting a loan to buy cattle to be fattened. 

Note: When the group picture was taken, Anika and Sarluta weren’t present, so their husbands replaced them in the group picture.

loans.use: To buy cattle to be fattened

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en:
Haidar is a 51 year old man who lives with his wife in Tyre, southern Lebanon. Haidar has owned a grocery store since 2006. He has requested a loan of 1,200 U.S. dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is the first time that Haidar has requested a loan.

Haidar is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends, neighbors and tourists. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the startup capital. Haidar chose his business because of his experience and he wanted to improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans on enlarging his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his grocery store

loans.name: Olailagi

texts.en: Olailagi T., 73, is married with six children.  She has many years of experience in the taro and banana plantation business. She sells to the village community and general public, two days per week. She has had five previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~$110 US).  SPBD loans are Olailagi’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase tools and equipment such as spade, wheelbarrow, bush knives, water hose and rake

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
Marilu es socia del Banco Comunal Paraíso.
Marilu es casada, tiene 39 años y 3 hijos, Marilu tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, frutas, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Marilu alquila carros a instituciones.
Marilu necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de vitrinas.
Marilu sueña con abrir otra tienda.
texts.en:
Marilu is a member of the Paraíso (Paradise) Communal Bank. Marilu is 39 years old, married and has three children. She has a store in her house where she works every day selling groceries, vegetables and fruit. She also rents cars to institutions. Marilu needs a loan of 900 Sols which will be invested in the purchase of display cases. She dreams of opening another store.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy display cases.

loans.name: Ritta

texts.en:
Ritta has been a food vendor in the Kola neighborhood of Morogoro for one year. She belongs to the Waridi loan group (group code 2045/08). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $80. She works at her business for 12 hours every day.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items, like rice and bananas, for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Ritta is 45 years old and single with four children, ages 21, 16, 12, and 8. She also cares for three dependents.

loans.use: To buy more food items, like rice and bananas, for her business.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan resides in Urcos, a small community that is located in the Sacred Valley of the Incas, 50 minutes away from the city of Cusco. He 34 years old and has two children with his common-law wife, Ana Cecilia.  Juan is a musician and driver. He plays the keyboard and leads a six-member band that performs at weddings, birthday parties and other events. When he isn’t performing, Juan uses his own car to provide a transportation service to Andahuailillas, a nearby town that is 5 minutes away. 

Juan wants to purchase a new sound system for his group with this loan. This has been the best source of income for his family.

Juan and Ana Cecilia want their children to study in the university and eventually have a professional career. Juan is a member of a 44-person lending group with Arariwa that receives financial training from a loan officer, and he also participates in the group savings account.

loans.use: to purchase a new sound system

loans.name: Babalola

texts.en: D. sells juice and drinks. As a single parent, D. is faced with the problem of caring for her family of six, herself and five of her children. She is 53 years old. D. is requesting a loan of N140,000 to purchase more juice and drinks to sell. She remains grateful to Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more juice and drinks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 4 calves

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria T. M. es una señora de 52 años de edad, quien vive,  en una pequeña comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada La Esperanza localizada en San José de Upala, Provincia de Alajuela. Ahí se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, ganadería de doble propósito (carne y leche) y agricultura. Doña Gloria vive con su esposo y dos de sus seis hijos.

Desde hace poco más de 5 años que doña Gloria inició un negocio de confección de ropa. Ella elabora diferentes tipos de prendas de vestir que luego vende en negocios de la comunidad y sus alrededores o incluso la llegan a buscarla a su casa. Su microempresa ha ayudado a que la condición de vida de su familia haya mejorado considerablemente.

En estos momentos doña Gloria desea obtener un microcrédito  por ¢680,000 (seiscientos ochenta mil colones), para comprar una máquina  especial para coser y materiales como telas, hilos, etc. Con esta inversión espera poder incrementar su producción y mejorar la calidad de los  productos. Afirma que gracias a este préstamo podrá ofrecer más y mejores opciones para sus clientes actuales y potenciales.

Doña Gloria es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Mujeres la Esperanza; la cual está integrada solo por mujeres, ya que se especializa en apoyar a mujeres no profesionales y  jefas de hogar, es una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo  préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Gloria is 52 years old and lives in the small rural community of La Esperanza, in San Jose de Upala, Alajuela Province, Costa Rica. The local economic activities include commerce, livestock raising (for meat and milk), and agriculture. She lives with her husband and two of her six children.

It has been a little over 5 years since Gloria started her clothes making business. She makes different types of garments which she later sells in businesses locally and in the surrounding areas. People also come to her house to buy them. Her micro-enterprise has improved her family's condition of life considerably.

At present, Gloria wishes to obtain a loan of $1,175 to buy a special sewing machine and materials such as cloth, thread, etc. With this investment she hopes to increase production and improve the quality of her products. She assures us that with this loan she can offer more and better options to her existing and potential customers.

Gloria is a member of La Esperanza Womens Community Credit organization, which specializes in helping non-professional women and women who head households. It is one of 100 organizations belonging to EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be Gloria's second loan and with it, she hopes to continue her personal and economic growth, as well as participate actively in her community's credit organization.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING A SPECIAL SEWING MACHINE, CLOTH, THREAD, AND ACCESSORIES

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en: Valentina has a husband and two adult children. She owns a business selling clothing. Instead of having a single business location, she travels and sells her inventories at six small markets in the area.  Valentina has been in this business for 12 years. She enjoys selling women's clothing and providing her clients with what they need where they are. Valentina lives with her husband in a small apartment. Valentina would like to borrow 12,200 UAH to increase her clothing selection.

loans.use: To purchase clothing

loans.name: Hélène

texts.fr: Hélène A. est une femme de 46 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. elle est revendeuse de charbons de bois à Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Hélène exerce ce commerce depuis 5 ans. Elle souhaite avec ce crédit, le deuxième à FECECAV, augmenter la taille de son commerce en achetant des sacs de charbons. Cette aubaine lui permettra d’aider son mari dans la prise en charge des enfants
texts.en:
Hélène A. est une femme de 46 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. elle est revendeuse de charbons de bois à Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Hélène exerce ce commerce depuis 5 ans. Elle suhaite avec ce crédit, le deuxième à FECECAV, augmenter la taille de son commerce en achetant des sacs de charbons. Cette aubaine lui permettra d’aider son mari dans la prise en charge des enfants

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acheter des sacs de charbons de bois

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy merchandise for their businesses

loans.name: Adovi

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur a pour activité la vente d’appareils électroniques, il fait aussi la location de matériel de sonorisation. Sa clientèle grandit de jour en jour, pour pouvoir tous les satisfaire et convenablement il doit augmenter son stock de marchandises, pour cette raison il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour gonfler son stock avec 40 hauts parleurs et 20 écrans de 14 pouces.
Il est marié et est père de 3 enfants, sa femme est une revendeuse. Avec ce qu’il gagne de son commerce, il subvient aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This man's business is the sale of electronic devices. He also installs sound equipment. His clientele grows from day to day. To be able to satisfy them all properly he must grow his stock of merchandise. For this reason he requests a loan from WAGES to increase his stock with 40 tall speakers and 20 14-inch screens. He is married and is the father of 3 children. His wife is a dealer. With what he earns from his business he provides for the family expenses.

Translated from French by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy tall speakers and 14-inch screens for resale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth Q. sells various kinds of fresh fish at Elmina seashore. Elizabeth has a senior high education. She is single and has four children. 

Elizabeth has been selling fresh fish since 1971. She is responsible for paying school fees, utility bills and general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more fish for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn M. is from the village of Macanhan, Cagayuan De Oro City. She is 33 years old. Evelyn is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling green bananas in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 7 years.

In 2009, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn is requesting a loan which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Macanhan, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Nieta Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Nieta sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne  d’âge de 42 ans et 5 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans le village de MARKA COUNKO, sous préfecture de FANA, Région de KOULIKORO, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues à  travers des liens de voisinage et de parentés. Elles exercent le commerce d’articles divers il y’a un peu longtemps de cela. 
Ces femmes collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pérenniser leurs activités lucratives. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter, des tissus au Burkina, une grande quantité de condiments alimentaires et d’articles divers tels que le sucre, l’huile alimentaire, les boîtes de conserves. Ces produits sont achetés à Bamako et le tout est revendu sur place à MARKA COUNKO à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.  
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 20 000F CFA par mois. Les bénéfices sont d’une part réinvestis dans l’activité et d’autre part dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of Nieta Group are all married women who, on average, are 42 years old and have five children. They live with their husband and children in large traditional families in the village of Marka Counko, subprefecture of Fana, in the region of Kolikoro of the Republic of Mali. They know each other through neighborhood and family links.

These women have been merchants of various articles for quite some time. They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to ensure the long-term success of their businesses. This is their sixth solidarity loan. They have repaid all their previous loans on schedule.

They will use this new loan to buy fabrics in Burkina Faso and also a large quantity of food condiments and various grocery articles such as sugar, vegetable oil and cans. They will buy these products in Bamako and retail them in Marka Counko to a clientele made up of women and men.

They expect to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 CFA francs each. They will reinvest part of their profit in their businesses and use part of it to contribute to the daily expenses of their families.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various articles

loans.name: Manvel

texts.en: Manvel G. was born in 1965. He lives and works in Yegheg village, in the Kapan area. He is the manager of a household village school. Manvel is married and has 3 children: 2 sons and a daughter. One of his sons serves in the Armenian Army, and the second one studies at the Kapan Agricultural Institute in the juridical department. His daughter will finish high school next year. Manvel’s wife is a nurse at a hospital. All of Manvel’s family is engaged in bee-keeping. Bee-keeping takes a lot of time for its upkeep and development; in the summer months it requires approximately 8 hours per day, and in the other seasons 4 hours per day, but Manvel is not afraid of difficulties and he is very proud of his business. To increase his family’s annual income, Manvel needs a 1,050,000 AMD loan to buy a pickup truck to move his bee families from place to place depending on the season.

loans.use: To buy a pickup truck

loans.name: Turmunh

texts.en: Turmunh is 45 years old and lives with his wife and five children in Uvs Province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a "ger", a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest daughter, who is 19 years old, is in university and the other children all go to a local secondary school. Turmunh and his friend operate a car repair business in their town. He began this business in 2008 while working as an employee at another car repair business. He is planning to buy a truck in order to provide a transportation service to supplement his earnings. Turmunh says, “I am planning to have my own auto repair building in the future.” He is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase paints and spare parts for his business.

loans.use: To purchase paints and parts for his business

loans.name: Diol Marie

texts.en:
Diol Marie P. is from the village of Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 21 years old. Diol Marie is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Diol Marie owns and operates a business selling clothing and shoes in the local community. Diol Marie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $25 a week from this activity.

In 2010, Diol Marie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Diol Marie is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
La Sra. Lucy, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 49 años y es madre de 04 hijos, todos ya independientes, Lucy presenta estudios hasta tercer grado de Primaria.

El espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de comidas en su misma casa, donde poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad.  Sus ventas lo realiza  diariamente  a partir de las 5.30pm. Lleva 07 años trabajando en este tipo de actividad y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace.

Con su primer crédito de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles compró: arroz en sacos, pollos en javas, sazonador para aderezar los pollos, racimos de plátano y maduro.

Con este crédito  de S/ 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles,  comprará insumos como arroz en sacos, huevos, gallinas criollas para sus juanes y pollos desviscerados para sus anticuchos, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad.  

Lucy, se siente muy tranquila y feliz y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Lucy, 49, is a member of the "Honestidad y Trabajo" (Honesty & Work) communal bank, which is in Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres province, San Martín department. She lives with her life partner and has 4, independent children. Lucy finished third grade. She has always been noted for her tenacious spirit and her wish to succeed in life through her own efforts. This led her to set up a food preparation and sales business in her home. Gradually, she became well-known among her customers and she tells us that, today, she does quite well. She is open for business daily from 5:30am. She has been in this line of work for 7 years and she is very pleased with what she does. She used her first, 300 new sol, loan to buy sacks of rice, crates of chickens, seasonings for her chicken, bunches of bananas and plantains. She will use this new, 3000 new sol, loan to buy ingredients like: sacks of rice, eggs, chickens for juanes (a rice and chicken mixture cooked inside banana leaves), dressed chickens for her anticuchos (skewered grilled meat snacks), as well as kitchen utensils to provide quality service. Lucy feels very tranquil and happy and is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her reach her goals and dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her meal preparations.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora D. is from the town of Zone IV Rosales, Pangasinan. She is 45 years old. Flora is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Flora owns & operates a butcher shop, butchering and selling a variety of meats in the local community. Flora has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 12000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Flora joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Flora is requesting a loan of 20000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Flora from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve & expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Elygito

texts.en: Elygito tills a hectare of rice field. He is 45 years old, married, and has seven children. His oldest child is only 18. He is faced with a challenge of sending all his children to school. Because of the increasing school fees, he works hard to be able to keep up. He grows bananas that he can sell at harvest just to have an extra income. He is also thankful to be introduced to CEVI, an MFI. He thinks its program is exactly what he needs to sustain his farm. He applied for a loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos to supply his farm with seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs it needs.

loans.use: Seed, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Jovelyn's Group

texts.en:
Jovelyn P. is from the town of Fugo Jones. She is thirty-one years old. Jovelyn is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Jovelyn P.'s group.

Jovelyn is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jovelyn owns and operates a general store in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jovelyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jovelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Jovelyn's first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-five branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas of the country. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Juana Fidelia

texts.es: La señora Juana F. tiene 54 años de edad, posee 2 hijos a su cargo. Ella tiene aproximadamente 5 años de dedicarse a la venta de mercadería en general. Sus ventas generalmente las realiza de manera ambulante, sin embargo en su casa oferta también sus productos. Ella empezó con un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa usada, después fue agrandando el negocio con inversión y con los préstamos otorgados por la fundación, hasta que ahora tiene un negocio establecido con una clientela que la reconocen. El crédito solicitado por la señora será invertido en la compra de mercancías. Por lo sueña con mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Juana F. is 54 years old, and she has two children under her care. She has been selling general merchandise for approximately five years. She generally sells as a street vendor. However, she also sells products in her house. She started with a small business of selling used clothes. Later she was expanding her business with investment from the loans from the Fundación. Now she has an established business with customers who know her. The loan she has requested is to buy merchandise. She dreams of improving her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mrs. Ny Sok Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nine people make up this village bank loan. They live in Thmey village in Kandal province. All the members will use their share of the loan for different purposes to improve their businesses. 

Mrs. Ny S. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. She owns a general store in the local village to earn money to support her family. Since her business is going well she wants to expand it, but she does not have enough money. Thus, Mrs. Ny S. is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to resell. Her husband, Mr. Chea S., is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow rice on to support his family. They have three children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, while another is a laborer, and the third is attending public school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to resell

loans.name: Nerissa's Group

texts.en:
Nerissa A. is from the village of Maluno Sur. She is 43 years old. Nerissa is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Nerissa A. Group.

Nerissa is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Nerissa owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling personal products such as perfumes and watches in the local community. Nerissa has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nerissa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nerissa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Nerissa is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Nerissa from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 62 years old, married, and has five children. She has been selling vegetables since 2006 and also sells charcoal to supplement her income.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya under the group called Githunguri Wisdom, Cecilia has been able to service two loans which she used to boost her business. This has also enabled her to improve her living standards.

Her group members trust her; they have guaranteed her another loan of Kes 25,000. She plans to use this loan to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To add to her stock of vegetables

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando es un padre de familia de 30 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a dos hijos en el sector Muy Finca, una zona rural dedicada a la agricultura que pertenece al distrito de Mochumí, la zona pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Orlando se dedica a trabajar desde que era muy joven criando y vendiendo animales, el cría aves domésticas en algunos corrales que tiene instalados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando sus aves ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona adquiriendo animales para revenderlos en la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Este negocio le provee de algunos ingresos que utiliza en el sostenimiento de su familia, adicionalmente trabaja como peón agrícola en los cultivos de la zona. El desea adquirir más aves para aumentar sus ventas y percibir mas ingresos, por lo que ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme  Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

El es una persona tranquila y responsable, sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran alguien de confianza y que siempre está dispuesto a ayudar al que le necesita.
texts.en:
Orlando is a 30 year old father who lives with his wife and two children in the Muy Finca sector, a rural agricultural area in the district of Mochumí. This area is part of Lambayeque Province, which is located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

From a young age, Orlando has worked raising and selling animals. He raises poultry in the pens he established behind his house. When the birds are fully developed, he sells them to the merchants who always pass through the area to acquire animals to sell in the city of Chiclayo.

This business provides some of the income he needs to support his family. In addition, he works as a farm laborer in the area. He wants to acquire more birds so that he can increase his sales and earn more income. For this reason, he is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN.

Orlando is a peaceful and responsible individual. His neighbors and acquaintances consider him to be someone who is trustworthy and always willing to help when needed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire more birds to raise and sell

loans.name: Heriberto Esteban

texts.es:
Heriberto de 61 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con una ecología en reconstrucción). El es confeccionista, desde joven el cocía ropa para poder ayudar a su familia económicamente. 

Desde joven el trabajo con ropa por eso que cuando se caso el continuo con este trabajo pero ahora con ayuda de su esposa, el horario de trabajo es variado ya que trabaja en su casa. Para asegurar el futuro de el y su esposa el quiere construir mejor su casa con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento y bloques.   

En el futuro el quiere seguir con salud para seguir trabajado alado de su esposa.
texts.en:
Heriberto is 61 years old, he lives in Guayaquil, near the motorway known as La Perimetral (a periurban zone whose green areas are being reinstated). He is a tailor: ha started in his youth, sewing clothes in order to economically help his family. Working with clothes in his youth, after he got married he kept on working in this field with his wife’s help. Working hours vary as he works in his home. In order to grant a future to his wife and to himself he wants to ameliorate his house. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy cement and bricks. He hopes to be still in good health in the future in order to keep on working alongside his wife.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cement and bricks.

loans.name: Canh

texts.en: Canh T. V. is 48 years old and has three children. She sells vegetables and fruit in the market and grows rice.
